title: Pinterest Adds Ulta Beauty Chief To Board As AI Commerce Push Grows
summary: Pinterest has appointed Kecia Steelman, CEO of Ulta Beauty, to its board of directors, signaling a strategic push towards AI-powered commerce and shopping integration. This move comes amid company restructuring and aims to leverage Steelman's extensive retail experience to enhance Pinterest's shopping features and monetization efforts. Investors should monitor how this board change influences product decisions, partnerships, and ultimately, whether it translates into improved financial performance against competitors.

title: Waste Connections (TSE:WCN) Hits New 52-Week Low - Time to Sell?
summary: Waste Connections (TSE:WCN) recently reached a new 52-week low of C$212.72 during mid-day trading on Thursday, with its stock declining significantly from its previous close. Despite this downturn, the company maintains strong analyst sentiment, with nine analysts rating it a "Strong Buy" and one a "Hold," alongside recent upgrades from several major firms. However, the company faces mixed fundamentals, including a high price-to-earnings ratio of 89.44 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 102.69, which suggest a rich valuation and notable leverage.

title: Meta Platforms, Inc. Announces Quarterly Cash Dividend on Class A Common Stock and Class B Common Stock, Payable on March 26, 2026
summary: Meta Platforms, Inc. has announced a quarterly cash dividend of $0.525 per share for both its Class A and Class B common stock. This dividend is scheduled to be paid on March 26, 2026, to shareholders who are on record as of the close of business on March 16, 2026. The announcement was published on February 12, 2026, at 04:05 pm EST.

title: Software Stocks: Are Investors Worrying Too Much About AI Disruption?
summary: The article discusses investor concerns about AI disruption in software stocks, leading to recent selloffs affecting hyperscalers and business services firms. It argues that many companies, despite these fears, possess strong economic moats due to high switching costs and are currently undervalued. The author highlights opportunities in the tech sector, especially among undervalued hyperscalers and software companies, based on Morningstar's analysis.

title: Alphabet Drops 7% Post Q4 Earnings: Buy, Sell or Hold the Stock?
summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) shares dropped 7% after its Q4 2025 earnings report, primarily due to investor concerns over the high capital expenditure guidance for 2026, aimed at building AI and cloud infrastructure. Despite strong cash flow and continued dominance in search and cloud with significant AI integration, the stock is considered overvalued with a "Hold" rating from Zacks. The company's AI advancements are boosting user engagement and enterprise client adoption, but increased spending, capacity constraints, and valuation concerns temper short-term enthusiasm.

title: Should You Buy the Invesco QQQ ETF With the Nasdaq Near a Record High? Here's What History Says.
summary: The Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ) tracks the Nasdaq-100, an index heavily weighted towards technology stocks, particularly those involved in hypergrowth themes like AI. Despite the Nasdaq nearing an all-time high, historical data suggests that investing in the Nasdaq-100 for the long term has consistently generated positive returns, even when purchased at peak levels or during downturns. The article highlights key AI-driven stocks within the QQQ and emphasizes that market timing is less crucial than a long-term investment horizon of at least five years.

title: NextEra Energy's Stock Recovery Potential Emerges Amid AI Demand
summary: NextEra Energy is well-positioned for significant growth due to the surging electricity demand driven by artificial intelligence, with data centers projected to consume substantial power. The company stands to benefit from substantial tax credits for its extensive wind and solar projects, cementing its leadership in clean energy. Furthermore, NextEra Energy offers attractive dividend growth potential with a 31-year streak of increases and projected hikes, making it appealing to income investors as interest rates decline.

title: Unity Software Inc. (NYSE:U) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Unity Software Inc. (NYSE:U) reported its Q4 2025 earnings, highlighting strong performance driven by its Vector advertising business and a return to growth in its Create software segment. The company's Vector revenue comfortably exceeded guidance, with expectations to exceed a $1 billion annual run rate in 2026, while the traditional IronSource ad network will become a much smaller component of revenue. Unity also outlined significant strategic initiatives for 2026, including enhanced collaboration tools accessible via web browser and the integration of AI for authoring casual games with natural language.

title: AEP expands spending plan, beats profit estimates as electricity demand surges
summary: American Electric Power (AEP) exceeded Q4 profit expectations and announced an expansion of its five-year capital expenditure plan, now exceeding $72 billion, to address the escalating demand for electricity driven largely by data centers for AI-related tasks. The utility company is a major beneficiary of this surge, with hyperscalers like Google and Amazon driving 80% of its growth. AEP emphasized its commitment to affordability for residential customers while investing in necessary infrastructure to meet the increased load, which has doubled since October.

title: Arista Networks earnings on deck: AI buildout meets guidance test

The company's ability to demonstrate continued growth in AI despite competition and its $177 billion market cap at 49x forward earnings will be key to investor sentiment.

title: Nebius Group Buys Tavily To Deepen Full Stack Agentic AI Offering
summary: Nebius Group (NasdaqGS:NBIS) has acquired Tavily, a provider of agentic search technology for AI agents, to integrate real-time web search into its AI cloud platform. This acquisition aims to deepen Nebius's full-stack AI offering for enterprises utilizing agentic AI solutions, positioning the company to better compete with major cloud providers like Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, and Google Cloud. The deal signifies Nebius's strategic move into product differentiation within the agentic AI space, though it introduces additional capital requirements and execution risk.

title: Apple’s Siri Upgrade Potentially Delayed After Testing Issues: Report
summary: Apple's planned upgrades for its virtual assistant Siri are reportedly facing delays due to testing issues, where Siri struggled with processing queries correctly or took too long to respond. Initially set for a March rollout with the iOS 26.4 beta, the functional changes may now be deferred to future updates, possibly in May or September with iOS 27. Despite the potential delay, analysts believe Apple's long-term AI strategy, including a rumored AI chatbot for Siri, still holds significant value for investors, especially as the company reported a strong Q1 2026 driven by iPhone sales.

title: Ackman Calls Meta 'One Of The World's Greatest Businesses,' Adds Stock Alongside Amazon, Alphabet
summary: Bill Ackman's Pershing Square Capital Management has disclosed a new significant stake in Meta Platforms, considering it one of the "world's greatest businesses" with strong long-term upside potential from AI integration. The firm has also maintained positions in Amazon and Alphabet, while exiting holdings in Chipotle Mexican Grill, Nike, and Hilton Worldwide Holdings. These moves reflect Ackman's preference for Magnificent Seven stocks, with Meta, Amazon, and Alphabet now making up a substantial portion of his portfolio.

title: Corning (GLW) Declares Consistent Quarterly Dividend
summary: Corning Incorporated (GLW) announced it is maintaining its quarterly dividend at $0.28 per share, resulting in a forward yield of 0.84%. The company is accelerating its Springboard plan with a new Meta agreement, targeting an $11 billion increase in annual sales by 2028. Despite strong financial health indicated by an Altman Z-Score of 5.16 and a Piotroski F-Score of 8, investors should consider the stock's high valuation ratios and recent insider selling activity.

title: Analyst Sentiment on Arista Networks (ANET) Remains Strong Ahead of Fiscal Q4 2025 Results
summary: Analyst sentiment for Arista Networks (ANET) remains overwhelmingly positive, with 90% of analysts bullish on the stock ahead of its fiscal Q4 2025 results, anticipating a 27.5% upside. Recent upgrades and "Buy" ratings from Piper Sandler and Melius Research highlight the company's strong position due to enterprise adoption, AI exposure, and its superior networking solutions for hyperscale users. Despite competition, analysts foresee a "Year of Refresh" in 2026 for the company.

title: Analyst Sentiment on Vistra (VST) Remains Strong Following Goldman Sachs' Bullish Update
summary: Vistra Corp. (VST) has seen strong analyst sentiment, with over 90% of analysts bullish on the stock and a consensus price target implying significant upside. Goldman Sachs recently upgraded Vistra to 'Buy' from 'Neutral,' citing a decline in shares, rising estimates, and the company's successful large-scale contract with Meta Platforms. This partnership involves a 20-year power purchase agreement for zero-carbon energy from nuclear plants, demonstrating Vistra's capability in securing major deals.

title: Is B2Gold Corp. (BTG) One of the Most Undervalued Gold Stocks to Buy According to Analysts?
summary: B2Gold Corp. (BTG) is considered one of the most undervalued gold stocks by analysts, with CIBC increasing its price target to $6.50 based on revised gold price forecasts. Despite short-term production hurdles at its Goose mine, the company projects significant ramp-up and is advancing strategic expansions like the Antelope underground deposit. B2Gold is a Canadian gold producer with operations across Mali, the Philippines, and Namibia, and is also involved in a project in Colombia.

title: Pershing Square Sells Stake in Canadian Pacific Kansas City (CP)
summary: Pershing Square has sold its holdings in Canadian Pacific Kansas City (CP), along with stakes in Chipotle, Nike, and Hilton, as part of adjustments to its investment portfolio. The firm has simultaneously invested in Hertz, Amazon, and Meta Platforms, expressing optimism about their future potential despite noting financial stress indicators and insider selling at CP. Canadian Pacific Kansas City, a Class I railroad with a market capitalization of $74.68 billion, shows strong revenue growth and profitability but faces liquidity concerns and a declining gross margin.

title: Taboola And Reach Test GenAI Answers To Keep Readers On Site
summary: Taboola has partnered with UK publisher Reach to implement its GenAI-powered DeeperDive answer engine on sites like Express and Daily Star. This collaboration aims to boost reader engagement and advertising by using AI to keep users on publisher sites, rather than losing them to external AI search tools. For Taboola, this expands its AI capabilities beyond content recommendations into search-style queries, aligning with its goal to turn publisher intent into performance advertising inventory.

title: Unity Software Faces Market Turbulence Amid Project Genie Rollout
summary: Unity Software's stock has dropped significantly (-32.11%) following Google's launch of Project Genie, an AI tool for 3D environments, which poses a major competitive threat. Analysts at BofA and UBS have lowered their price targets for Unity due to concerns about market positioning, increased competition, and potential overvaluation. Despite a high gross margin, Unity faces operational profitability challenges, with negative EBIT and pretax profits, highlighting the urgency for strategic innovation to adapt to the evolving gaming industry landscape.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: New Street Research Forecasts Strong Price Appreciation for Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOGL) Stock

Despite insider selling, the consensus remains a "Moderate Buy" with a target price of $361.64.

title: Lumen Technologies (LUMN) Stock Gains 29% After CEO Buys $500,000 in Shares
summary: Lumen Technologies (LUMN) stock surged 29% after CEO Kathleen Johnson purchased $500,000 worth of shares, signaling strong confidence in the company's strategy. title: Oracle: Strong Generative AI Demand Supports Data Center Buildout
summary: Oracle's stock recently saw a significant jump, driven by positive reception to OpenAI's GPT-5.3-Codex and increased capital expenditure plans from other tech giants. Despite this rally, the stock is still down year-to-date. Morningstar maintains a $277 fair value estimate for Oracle, acknowledging the strong demand for generative AI supports the company's data center buildout, but highlights high risks associated with debt management and GPU sourcing.

title: Asking AI 'Are you sure?' usually doesn't help, TELUS Digital finds
summary: TELUS Digital released a poll and research paper indicating that asking AI follow-up questions like "Are you sure?" rarely improves accuracy, and can even reduce it. A survey of 1,000 AI users found that while 60% asked follow-ups, only 14% saw the AI change its answer. The research, which tested models like GPT-5.2 and Gemini 3 Pro, highlighted that reliability primarily stems from how AI is built, trained, and tested, rather than user prompting.

title: Oklo’s DOE Fuel Recycling Award Tests Long Term Nuclear Thesis
summary: Oklo (NYSE:OKLO) received funding from the U.S. Department of Energy for nuclear fuel recycling research, aiming to build a facility in Tennessee to convert used nuclear fuel into new reactor fuel. This project could significantly advance U.S. nuclear technology and fuel sustainability, positioning Oklo uniquely despite its current pre-revenue status and share price volatility. The company's success in this endeavor could differentiate it from competitors and strengthen its long-term business model by reducing reliance on third-party fuel supplies.

title: Revisiting asset allocation in an AI world
summary: The AI boom has fundamentally reshaped the U.S. stock market, leading to increased concentration in technology, a tilt towards higher-beta stocks, and elevated factor volatility. This structural shift necessitates a review of traditional asset allocation strategies, with investors needing to be mindful of unintentional risks and potentially incorporate new diversification approaches. The authors suggest focusing on active risk management, alternative return sources, better portfolio hedges, and tactical opportunities in areas like healthcare, small/mid-cap equities, and emerging markets.
authors: Christina Kellar, CFA, Som Priestley, CFA, Farris G. Shuggi, CFA

title: Everus Construction Group, Inc. (NYSE:ECG) Given Consensus Recommendation of "Hold" by Brokerages

title: Arista Networks Ties Growth To AI Data Centers Amid New Risks

While this presents significant opportunities, the company also faces challenges such as competition, potential supply chain issues impacting margins, and execution risks with high-speed Ethernet platforms. Investors are monitoring Arista's ability to maintain sustainable demand, manage profitability, and leverage its strong position in high-bandwidth Ethernet switching amidst these evolving market dynamics.

title: Alphabet boosts debt sale again as total raise exceeds $30 billion, sources say

The company plans to spend up to $185 billion this year on capital expenditures to fund its AI initiatives. This move follows other tech giants like Oracle seeking debt financing to support their significant investments in AI infrastructure.

title: The Glass Architecture of AI: A Comprehensive Research Feature on Corning Inc. (GLW)
summary: Corning Inc. (GLW) has transformed from a traditional glass and ceramics manufacturer into a critical enabler of the generative AI revolution, leveraging its fiber-optic solutions and glass substrates for next-generation semiconductors. The company's strategic "Springboard" growth plan, coupled with significant partnerships with tech giants like Meta and Apple, has led to substantial financial growth and a re-rating by the market. Despite risks such as valuation and geopolitical exposure, Corning is well-positioned to benefit from the increasing demand for high-bandwidth connectivity and advanced chip packaging, supported by U.S. industrial policy.

title: Taiwan Semiconductor’s January Sales Show the AI Tsunami Is Still Growing
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing (TSM) reported record-breaking January revenue of $12.7 billion, a 37% year-over-year increase, significantly surpassing analyst expectations. The company is aggressively increasing its capital expenditure guidance to fund new advanced chip capacity, indicating strong future commitments from its largest customers, including major hyperscalers like Amazon, Meta, Alphabet, and Microsoft.

title: IEI vs. IGIB: How Does Government Bond Exposure Compare Against Corporate Bonds?

IGIB focuses on investment-grade corporate debt and offers a lower expense ratio and higher yield but higher risk and volatility, while IEI invests in U.S. Treasuries, providing lower risk but also lower returns. The choice between them depends on an investor's risk tolerance, as bond ratings decline, they offer higher yields and returns because they’re riskier and more volatile.

title: Wisconsin energy utilities sacrifice affordability and sustainability to fuel the AI gold rush

Critics argue that the need to power data centers is leading to increased reliance on fossil fuels, higher energy bills for consumers, and stalled clean energy transitions, while utility companies profit from infrastructure investments and tax breaks for Big Tech. Residents and officials are pushing for more regulation and a temporary moratorium on data center construction to address these concerns.

summary: Progressive Investment Management Corp significantly reduced its stake in Booking Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ:BKNG) by 33.8% in Q3, selling 743 shares and retaining 1,454 shares valued at $7.85 million. Despite this reduction, institutional ownership remains high at 92.42%, with other major funds adjusting their positions, some increasing and some decreasing their holdings. Market sentiment for Booking is mixed, with a "Moderate Buy" analyst consensus and a $6,180 average price target, contrasting with recent insider selling totaling $16.2 million and a short-term pullback in share price.

title: The Hidden Gem AI Networking Stock That Could Own the Next 5 Years
summary: Arista Networks (NYSE: ANET) is highlighted as a crucial AI infrastructure player due to its ultra-fast Ethernet switches, which connect large GPU clusters in AI data centers. The company is poised to capitalize on the growing data center networking market by offering open-source, high-speed Ethernet as an alternative to proprietary solutions, and is expanding into enterprise and campus networking. Despite not being a "top 10 stock" pick by all analysts, Arista shows strong growth prospects with significant revenue and market cap projections fueled by increasing AI spending.

title: Arista Networks: A Hidden Gem in AI Networking
summary: Arista Networks is positioned as a strong player in the AI networking market due to its advanced Ethernet switching technology and significant financial performance. With projected revenue growth and market capitalization increases, analysts see strong investment potential. Despite some analyst downgrades focusing on valuation, the company's fundamentals and AI exposure suggest continued growth.

title: From Edison's Light Bulbs to AI's Backbone: How Corning Bet Two Decades of Losses on Fiber Optics and Won
summary: Corning, a 175-year-old glassmaker, made a significant bet on fiber optics despite almost two decades of losses, a decision now paying off with its stock at all-time highs due to the AI revolution. A $6 billion deal with Meta Platforms for AI data centers and ongoing negotiations with other tech giants highlight its crucial role. The company's long-term patience, extreme vertical integration, and commitment to its workforce allowed it to capitalize on the explosive demand for high-speed connectivity, particularly for co-packaged optics within servers.

title: Nuclear sees tipping point as Meta makes deals with Bill Gates’ TerraPower, Sam Altman-backed Oklo
summary: Meta has partnered with Bill Gates' TerraPower and Sam Altman-backed Oklo to develop small modular reactor (SMR) projects, signaling a potential new era for the nuclear industry driven by the soaring energy demands of AI data centers. This move by Meta is seen by analysts as a harbinger of more Big Tech companies investing in nuclear power, with SMRs offering faster deployment and scalability compared to traditional reactors. The article highlights that while challenges such as regulatory fears and fuel supply persist, technological advancements, bipartisan support, and expedited regulatory processes are converging to position nuclear as a critical clean energy solution for future electricity needs.

title: Black Hills Weighs Merger And Data Center Growth Against Valuation Signals
summary: Black Hills Corporation is exploring a potential merger with NorthWestern Energy and significantly expanding its data center pipeline to over 3 gigawatts, attracting major tech firms like Meta and Microsoft. These strategic moves could alter its capital allocation and customer base, with investors closely watching regulatory approvals and long-term contracts. The stock is currently trading near its estimated fair value, with analysts seeing a modest upside.

title: Jim Cramer On Amazon Stock Slip: Not Saying Downside Overdone, 'I Figure Tomorrow's Pretty Ugly'
summary: Jim Cramer commented on Amazon's recent stock decline, acknowledging that the immediate future for the stock looks "pretty ugly" but maintains that the company's significant investment in capital expenditures, particularly in AI infrastructure, is justifiable. Amazon's shares fell sharply despite beating Q4 revenue expectations, primarily due to CEO Andy Jassy's announcement of a projected $200 billion capital expenditure in 2026. Analysts like Gene Munster and Daniel Newman support Amazon's long-term strategy, viewing the increased spending as beneficial for the company and the broader AI market, as Amazon aims to catch up and leverage AI across various business segments.

title: Applied Digital stock jumps 25% as AI data-center names rebound — what’s next for APLD
summary: Applied Digital (APLD) stock surged 25.52% following a broader rebound in tech and AI data-center names after a recent selloff. The company reported a 250% revenue jump in Q2 and has leased 600 MW of capacity, with plans for a new 430 MW campus. However, financing costs and investor sentiment towards high capital expenditure in the AI sector remain key factors to watch.

title: New Buy Rating for Uber Technologies (UBER), the Technology Giant
summary: Evercore ISI analyst Mark Mahaney has issued a Buy rating for Uber Technologies (UBER) with a $150.00 price target, highlighting a 9.8% average return and 52.02% success rate in his coverage. This positive outlook is supported by Uber's latest quarterly revenue of $14.37 billion, despite a decrease in net profit compared to the previous year. However, corporate insider sentiment for UBER is currently negative, with increased selling of shares by insiders in recent months.

title: Corning (GLW) Jumps 18.3%, Hits All-Time High on Stellar Earnings, New Billion-Dollar Deal
summary: Corning (GLW) surged 18.3% to a new all-time high after tripling its net income to $1.596 billion and increasing net sales by 19% to $15.6 billion in 2025. The company also announced a new $6 billion partnership with Meta Platforms for fiber optic cable supply, further boosting investor confidence. Corning raised its net sales growth outlook, with incremental annualized sales targeted at $6.5 billion for the current year.

title: Arista Networks (ANET) stock jumps into the weekend — here’s what traders watch next week
summary: Arista Networks (ANET) stock jumped 6.85% on Friday, breaking a two-day losing streak ahead of its earnings report on February 12th. Trading volume for ANET was significantly higher than average, and options traders are anticipating volatility. Investors are also watching the U.S. CPI data release on February 13th for broader market impact.

title: Meta Platforms, Inc. $META Position Raised by Bank of New York Mellon Corp
summary: Bank of New York Mellon Corp increased its holdings in Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META) by 3.7% in Q3, making Meta its fifth-largest position valued at $10 billion. Despite this, sentiment on Meta is mixed due to a broader tech sell-off, regulatory concerns, and insider selling, though its strong AI leadership and earnings beat expectations. Analysts generally maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with a consensus price target of $847.40.

title: Cullinan Associates Inc. Trims Position in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Cullinan Associates Inc. slightly reduced its stake in Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) by 0.5% in the third quarter, though Apple remains its largest holding, valued at approximately $114.91 million. This comes as Apple exceeded Q1 earnings and revenue expectations, announced a $0.26 quarterly dividend, and holds a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating from analysts with an average price target of $291.70. The report also highlights positive sentiment around Apple's potential expansion into third-party voice AI for CarPlay, strong Q1 results, and favorable regulatory news in the EU regarding the Digital Markets Act.

title: Texas Capital Initiated Coverage of Oklo Inc. (OKLO) with a Buy Rating
summary: Texas Capital initiated coverage on Oklo Inc. (OKLO) with a Buy rating and a $138 price target, highlighting the company's advanced nuclear solutions and integrated business model. This follows Bank of America's upgrade of Oklo to Buy with a $127 price target, driven by a binding agreement with Meta Platforms Inc. to develop a 1.2-gigawatt advanced nuclear campus. The article underscores the growing importance of nuclear power as AI and data center demands accelerate.

title: Trump Steps Back From Hollywood's Biggest Bidding War For Warner Bros-Netflix Media Merger: 'The Justice Department Will Handle'
summary: President Donald Trump has announced he will not personally intervene in the proposed $82.7 billion merger between Netflix Inc. and Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., deferring instead to the Justice Department's career regulators. This reversal from his previous stance comes amidst a fierce bidding war, including a hostile takeover attempt by Paramount Skydance Corp., and intense regulatory scrutiny over potential market concentration. The article also notes the underperformance of NFLX, WBD, and PSKY stocks compared to the Nasdaq 100 in 2026.

title: The Truth About Alphabet Inc. (Class A): Is This Viral Tech Giant Still a Must-Cop or Past Its Peak?
summary: This article examines whether Alphabet Inc. (Class A) remains a compelling investment, despite its popularity and strong market presence. It analyzes Alphabet's business drivers, including its leadership in AI, the robust YouTube platform, and its advertising strength, while also considering risks like regulatory challenges and competition from Meta and Microsoft. The author concludes that Alphabet is still a strong long-term core holding for serious investors, though not a short-term "moonshot" stock.

title: IAC stock rating reiterated at Buy by Benchmark on People margin outlook
summary: Benchmark reiterated its Buy rating and $57.00 price target for IAC/InterActiveCorp (NASDAQ:IAC), citing potential undervaluation despite the company missing its Q4 2025 EPS estimates. The firm expressed disappointment with the initial People margin outlook but noted Chairman Diller's commitment to improving performance and focusing capital allocation on IAC and MGM rather than M&A. InvestingPro data highlights IAC's healthy liquidity and oversold RSI, suggesting a compelling risk/reward profile even with ongoing business challenges.

title: Amaze CEO Aaron Day, Featured on Escaping The Drift with John Gafford, Discusses the Evolution of Creator-Led Commerce
summary: Amaze Holdings, Inc. CEO Aaron Day was recently featured on the podcast "Escaping The Drift with John Gafford" to discuss the future of creator-led commerce and how social platforms are changing online product sales. Day shared his journey and how Amaze enables creators to build digital storefronts on platforms like YouTube, TikTok, and Instagram, leveraging AI to turn social engagement into physical products. The discussion covered the creator economy's evolution, first-party branding, and the influence of niche creators.

title: Vistra (VST) Upgraded by Goldman Sachs with $205 Price Target
summary: Goldman Sachs has upgraded Vistra (VST) from Neutral to Buy, setting a $205 price target, leading to a 5.4% stock increase. This upgrade follows a recent stock pullback and a significant power purchase agreement with Meta, which boosted FY 2027 EBITDA estimates by 5%. Despite financial health concerns like high leverage and insider selling, the company's valuation metrics suggest potential undervaluation and positive market sentiment.

title: |‘One of the All-Time Great Investors’: How Fidelity’s Will Danoff Proved Active Management Can Still Succeed
summary: |Fidelity Contrafund manager Will Danoff is retiring at the end of the year, leaving a significant legacy in active management. Morningstar's Russ Kinnel highlights Danoff's consistent outperformance and his unique ability to process vast amounts of information to identify growth opportunities. His co-managers, Asher Anolic and Jason Weiner, will succeed him, with expectations to continue the growth strategy, and investors can learn from Danoff's continuous curiosity and engagement.

title: Microsoft's free cash flow considered 'most resilient' of hyperscalers: BNP Paribas
summary: BNP Paribas has identified Microsoft's free cash flow as the most resilient among major hyperscalers. This comes as the top five hyperscalers are projected to spend nearly $700 billion in capital expenditure this year, a significant increase from previous estimates.

title: Nvidia's Huang says tech is in a 'generational' buildout with AI; weighs in on China, OpenAI (NVDA:NASDAQ)
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang stated that the tech industry is experiencing a "generational" buildout driven by AI, referencing significant capital spending by major tech companies. He also touched upon topics related to China and OpenAI. This observation comes as Nvidia continues to be at the forefront of technological advancements.

title: Coursera, Inc. (NYSE:COUR) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Coursera held its Q4 and Full Year 2025 earnings call, reporting $757 million in revenue for the full year, a 9% increase, and record free cash flow of $78 million. The company announced an agreement to combine with Udemy, aiming to accelerate strategy, enhance investment in AI-native product innovation, and expand its global ecosystem of learners and enterprise customers. Coursera also introduced a 15% platform fee for new eligible sales to fund ongoing investments in its AI-native platform capabilities, expecting a gradual financial impact beginning in the second half of 2026.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Stock Holdings Lifted by Smith Shellnut Wilson LLC ADV
summary: Smith Shellnut Wilson LLC ADV increased its stake in Apple Inc. by 9.1%, bringing its total holdings to 34,809 shares valued at $8.863 million. Apple reported strong Q1 earnings, surpassing analyst estimates, which has led to a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating among analysts with a target price of $291.70. Despite some mixed news like Apple scaling back an AI health-coach project, positive sentiment from Q1 results, analyst bullishness, and a cautious AI stance continue to support investor confidence.

title: Halliburton Company (NYSE:HAL) Given Consensus Rating of "Moderate Buy" by Analysts
summary: Halliburton Company (NYSE:HAL) has received a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating from analysts, with an average 1-year target price of $34.76. The company recently surpassed quarterly earnings expectations, reporting $0.69 EPS against an estimated $0.55, and revenues of $5.66 billion against $5.39 billion. Despite insider selling by the CEO and EVP, Halliburton also declared a quarterly dividend of $0.17 per share.

title: For approximately $2B: Apple acquires a secret Israeli start-up
summary: Apple has acquired the Israeli start-up Q.AI for approximately $2 billion, marking one of its largest acquisitions to date. Q.AI specializes in "silent speech" technology, which interprets facial movements to control AI systems, aiming to enhance Apple's smart wearable devices and compete with Meta, Google, and OpenAI in the personal AI field. This strategic move highlights Apple's focus on strengthening its computer vision and AI capabilities and follows concerns about its standing in the AI race.

title: How watermarking AI content benefits businesses
summary: AI watermarking is becoming crucial for businesses to identify deepfakes, enhance transparency, and build trust in AI-generated content. While it offers benefits like regulatory compliance, IP protection, and customer trust, challenges such as reliability issues, false positives, and a lack of universal standards limit its widespread adoption. Despite these hurdles, early adoption provides strategic readiness and credibility in a rapidly evolving regulatory landscape.

title: Exponent, Inc. Reports Strong Q4 2025 Earnings with AI-Driven Growth
summary: Exponent, Inc. reported strong Q4 2025 earnings with an 8% increase in revenues to $147.4 million, net income of $24.8 million, and diluted EPS of $0.49, driven by demand in user research and risk management. The company projects high single-digit revenue growth and consistent EBITDA margins for Q1 and full-year 2026, supported by a diversified client base and robust cash flow. Wall Street analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating, with an average 1-year price target of $85.50, citing Exponent's strong rebound potential and leadership in science and engineering consulting.

title: Corbus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CRBP) COO Sells $19,537.35 in Stock
summary: Corbus Pharmaceuticals' COO, Ian Hodgson, sold 2,415 shares of company stock for $19,537.35 on February 3rd, reducing his stake by 4.44% to 51,927 shares. The clinical-stage biopharma, trading at $8.01 with a $140.58 million market cap, has a negative P/E ratio and analysts hold a "Moderate Buy" consensus with a $44.38 target price despite recent mixed earnings and institutional trading activity. The company's lead drug, lenabasum, is in Phase 3 trials for dcSSc and Phase 2 for cystic fibrosis-related inflammation.

title: Digital Realty: A New Investment Choice for Cloud and AI
summary: Digital Realty (DLR) is presented as an attractive investment for cloud and AI, highlighting its projected FFO growth, increasing occupancy rates driven by AI demand, and a stable 2.9% dividend yield. Despite a recent downgrade by BofA due to slower-than-anticipated AI participation, analysts generally forecast a stock price rise, reflecting the company's strong leasing performance and optimistic revenue guidance for 2026. Digital Realty's role as the world's largest data center operator and its REIT structure further underscore its potential in the rapidly growing AI data center industry.

title: Congressman Who Spent Millions On Magnificent Seven Stocks In 2025 Makes First 2026 Purchases: Here's What He's Buying
summary: Congressman Cleo Fields, known for his significant investments in "Magnificent Seven" stocks in 2025, has made his initial stock purchases for 2026. His recent acquisitions include shares of Alphabet (Class C), Netflix, IREN, and Meta Platforms, alongside Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing. These latest trades show a slight shift in strategy, with fewer "Magnificent Seven" stocks and some smaller purchase amounts compared to his 2025 activity.

title: Better Nuclear Energy Stock: SMR vs. OKLO
summary: This article compares two nuclear energy stocks, NuScale Power (SMR) and Oklo (OKLO), highlighting their potential and risks. While NuScale focuses on small modular reactors and has seen recent struggles, Oklo, known for fast-fission power plants, boasts stronger partnerships and a more robust financial position, making it the author's pick for long-term investment despite high volatility. The piece emphasizes the growing demand for nuclear energy to power AI needs.

title: Royal Caribbean, IBD Stock Of The Day, Builds A Handle
summary: Royal Caribbean Group (RCL) has been named IBD Stock Of The Day, with its stock currently forming the fifth day of a handle on a cup base pattern. The handle has an entry point of 351.57, and the company holds a Composite Rating of 85/99 and an Industry Group Ranking of 72/197. This chart pattern suggests potential for a positive breakout.

title: Corning reports ‘outstanding’ 2025 results with annual sales up 13% to $16.4 B
summary: Corning announced "record results" for its fourth quarter and full-year 2025, with annual sales up 13% to $16.41 billion and core EPS growing 29% to $2.52. The company forecasts accelerated growth in Q1 2026, with core sales expected to rise by approximately 15%, and has upgraded its "Springboard Plan" to add an additional $11 billion in incremental annualized sales by the end of 2028. This positive financial performance is supported by a significant agreement with Meta worth up to $6 billion for critical technologies for next-generation data centers.

title: Expedia announces 100 job cuts at Austin offices
summary: Online travel company Expedia is laying off 100 workers at its Austin office, starting April 1. These cuts are part of a broader company strategy to assess necessary skills, simplify their structure, and reduce organizational layers, affecting around 160 other employees at its Seattle headquarters. Expedia had previously laid off dozens of Austin workers in February 2024 and operates several brands including Hotels.com and Vrbo.

title: 3 Reasons to Hold Oracle Stock Despite 43% Decline in 6 Months
summary: Oracle's stock has declined significantly by 42.8% over the past six months, but several fundamental factors suggest investors should hold their positions. The company shows strong long-term revenue visibility with an unprecedented $523 billion backlog, strategic infrastructure expansion for AI workloads, and a differentiating multi-cloud strategy. However, Oracle's premium valuation and increased capital expenditures warrant caution for new investors.

title: Homestead Advisers Corp Purchases New Shares in National Vision Holdings, Inc. $EYE
summary: Homestead Advisers Corp has acquired a new position of 100,400 shares in National Vision Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: EYE), valued at approximately $2.93 million. This purchase represents about 0.13% of the company, which recently reported a beat on quarterly EPS and revenue. Analysts have shown a positive outlook for National Vision, with multiple upgrades and increased price targets, resulting in a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating and an average target price of $29.00.

title: Mission Wealth Management LP Sells 19,562 Shares of Oklo Inc. $OKLO
summary: Mission Wealth Management LP significantly reduced its stake in Oklo Inc. (NYSE:OKLO) by 71.1% in the third quarter, selling 19,562 shares and retaining 7,938 shares valued at $886,000. This comes alongside substantial insider selling by CEO Jacob Dewitte and CFO Richard Bealmear, totaling over $153 million in the past 90 days. Despite this selling activity and recent EPS misses, analyst coverage remains largely positive with a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating and an average price target of $103.20.

title: AI Spending Pays Off for Major Cloud Providers
summary: New research indicates that major cloud providers like Alphabet, Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft have seen their AI infrastructure investments pay off, with their combined capital expenditures more than doubling between 2022 and 2025 alongside a significant increase in return on invested capital (ROIC). This profitability gain is attributed to strong utilization of new compute infrastructure and robust cloud revenue. The Alger 35 ETF (ATFV) is highlighted as an investment option for those seeking exposure to companies central to AI infrastructure development.

title: IZEA Worldwide, Inc. (NASDAQ:IZEA) Shares May Have Slumped 26% But Getting In Cheap Is Still Unlikely
summary: IZEA Worldwide, Inc.'s shares have dropped 26% in the last month, though they are up 25% over the past year. Despite the recent slump, the company's Price-to-Sales (P/S) ratio of 1.6x is still considered high compared to the Interactive Media and Services industry average of below 1x. Analysts are forecasting a revenue decline of 1.3% for IZEA in the coming year, while the rest of the industry is expected to grow by 18%, suggesting the current high P/S ratio may not be justified by future prospects.

title: AXT, Inc. (AXTI): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on AXT, Inc. (AXTI), highlighting its strong position in the optical communications sector due to the AI boom. AXTI is a leading manufacturer of Indium Phosphide (InP) substrate wafers, essential for high-performance lasers in data centers, and benefits from a unique pricing arbitrage for raw materials. Despite geopolitical risks associated with its China-based manufacturing, the company projects significant revenue and EBITDA growth.

title: Piper Sandler Maintains Overweight on Global-E Online Ltd. (GLBE) Amid Software Sector Reset
summary: Piper Sandler analyst Billy Fitzsimmons maintained an Overweight rating on Global-E Online Ltd. (GLBE) with a $48 price target despite a broader software sector reset. The firm noted mixed sentiment in the software sector but highlighted Global-e's strong Q3 2025 performance, with GMV up 33% and revenue up 25.5%. The company is well-positioned for sustained growth in cross-border e-commerce, driven by its platform and early traction in AI-driven commerce.

title: Expedia to cut 100 jobs from Austin offices starting April 1 amid broader corporate restructuring
summary: Online travel company Expedia plans to cut 100 jobs from its Austin, Texas offices starting April 1 as part of a broader corporate restructuring. This move is aimed at simplifying its structure and reducing organizational layers, following previous layoffs in Seattle and Austin in 2024. Despite these cuts, Expedia Group exceeded financial expectations in its most recent quarter, reporting $959 million in profit.

title: 4 Undervalued Stocks to Buy Before the Big Game
summary: This article identifies four wide-moat, undervalued stocks—Intuit, Meta Platforms, Mondelez International, and Salesforce—that Morningstar analysts recommend buying and holding for the long term, even as these companies advertise during the upcoming "big game." The analysts provide detailed commentary on each company's financial performance, market position, and growth prospects, highlighting their reasons for a bullish outlook. The piece contrasts a long-term investment strategy with speculative buys based on advertising exposure.

title: Citizens reiterates Market Outperform rating on IAC stock after Q4 results
summary: Citizens has reiterated its Market Outperform rating and a $47.00 price target for IAC Inc. following its Q4 2025 results. The company's fourth-quarter revenue slightly surpassed forecasts, despite an earnings per share miss, driven by strong performance in its People Inc. segment. Citizens highlighted IAC's strategic priorities, including share repurchases and simplifying its corporate structure, as key drivers for its investment thesis.

title: Amazon to report Q4 earnings with capex, AI growth in focus
summary: Amazon is set to release its Q4 earnings report, with investor focus on capital expenditures (capex) and AI growth amid concerns about overspending in the AI sector. The company's results will follow Meta and Microsoft's recent announcements, with Amazon also having announced 16,000 job cuts and store closures. Wall Street will keenly observe Amazon's capex projections for 2025 and 2026, which could significantly impact its stock performance.

title: Wall Street trading floors shocked at the magnitude of the momentum stock sell-off
summary: Wall Street is trying to understand if the recent momentum stock sell-off, marked by a significant drop in the iShares MSCI USA Momentum Factor ETF, indicates a simple sector rotation or a broader breakdown of the bull market. The decline was substantial, with Bank of America and JPMorgan noting it as one of the worst one-day moves in years, yet the broader S&P 500 saw only a modest dip. While Goldman Sachs suggests momentum dips can be buying opportunities, they advise short-term hedging due to the absence of clear capitulation signals and the strong run-up prior to the slide.

title: Alphabet Earnings: Continued Momentum on Cloud and Search as Capital Expenses Set to Mount
summary: Alphabet reported strong fourth-quarter earnings with sales up 18%, driven significantly by Google Cloud's 48% growth, illustrating the company's success in integrating AI. Despite upbeat results, management projects substantial capital expenditures of USD 180 billion in 2026, a 97% year-over-year increase, primarily due to AI investments. Morningstar maintains a USD 340 fair value estimate for Alphabet, viewing it as a clear AI leader with a fairly valued stock.

title: Strong Competition and Weak Monetization Pressure Snap’s Long-Term Growth Prospects
summary: The article discusses how Snapchat's parent company, Snap, faces significant challenges to its long-term growth due to intense competition and its inability to effectively monetize its large user base. Despite having over 450 million daily active users, Snap's ad-targeting and user-engagement algorithms are deemed less potent compared to major rivals like Meta and TikTok. The report highlights that high-margin products such as Snapchat+ are crucial for improving platform monetization.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Shares Sold by St. Johns Investment Management Company LLC
summary: St. Johns Investment Management Company LLC reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 4.6% in the third quarter, while several other institutional investors either increased their positions or initiated new ones. Analyst ratings for Apple are largely positive, with an average rating of "Moderate Buy" and a price target of $291.70. The company reported strong Q1 earnings, beating consensus estimates, and recently declared a quarterly dividend.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Position Decreased by PKO Investment Management Joint Stock Co
summary: PKO Investment Management Joint Stock Co reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 12.6% in the third quarter, now owning 195,000 shares valued at $49.65 million. Despite this reduction, Apple remains its fourth-largest holding, comprising 4.2% of its portfolio. Other institutional investors like Capstone Wealth Management LLC and Vermillion Wealth Management Inc. increased their positions in Apple during the same period.

title: Corning (GLW) Among Hidden Winners To Watch In AI Investing Space
summary: The rapid expansion of AI is driving significant investment in data center build-outs, presenting opportunities for less visible "glue" companies that provide essential infrastructure. Companies like Corning (GLW), Cisco (CSCO), and potentially Amphenol (APH) supply critical fiber optics, networking components, and cabling that enable the massive data transfer required for AI. Investors are encouraged to look beyond headline-grabbing AI companies and consider these undervalued infrastructure providers benefiting from the demand for AI-driven data centers.

title: Owens Corning Declares Quarterly Cash Dividend
summary: Owens Corning's Board of Directors has declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.79 per share, payable on April 9, 2026, to shareholders of record as of March 9, 2026. This decision reflects the company's strong financial health and ongoing profitability, with future dividends to be determined by the Board based on earnings and cash requirements. Founded in 1938, Owens Corning reported $11.0 billion in sales in 2024 and employs over 25,000 people globally, emphasizing sustainable development.

title: NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA), highlighting its sustained growth due to AI scaling laws and its significant projected revenue from new platforms. Despite substantial capital expenditures, NVIDIA's free cash flow per share continues to rise, positioning it as a strong long-term investment. The company's leadership in AI and its parallel to historical infrastructure growth reinforce its potential for durable value creation.

title: Oklo (NYSE:OKLO) CFO Richard Craig Bealmear Sells 9,726 Shares
summary: Oklo (NYSE:OKLO) CFO Richard Craig Bealmear sold 9,726 shares of the company's stock on February 2nd at an average price of $76.93, totaling over $748,000. This transaction reduced his position by 4.71% and followed other recent sales by Bealmear and CEO Jacob Dewitte. The insider selling coincided with a significant intraday stock drop to $68.20 and mixed analyst ratings for the loss-making company.

title: Bestinfond's Strategic Moves: ArcelorMittal SA Takes Center Stage with 4.13% Portfolio Share
summary: Bestinfond's Q4 2025 report reveals significant strategic investment decisions, including adding seven new stocks and increasing stakes in 22 others. ArcelorMittal SA was the most significant new addition, representing 4.13% of the portfolio. The fund also exited 12 holdings and reduced positions in 11, with Reckitt Benckiser Group PLC seeing a major reduction.

title: Alphabet Live: Complete Coverage Of GOOG’s Q4 Earnings
summary: Alphabet (GOOG) reported its Q4 earnings, beating on both top and bottom lines, but shares initially dropped due to significantly higher-than-expected CapEx guidance of $180 billion for 2026, compared to analyst expectations of $116 billion. Despite strong growth in Google Cloud and early monetization signals from AI initiatives like Gemini, investors are scrutinizing the justification and ROI timelines for these massive infrastructure investments. The company's Q4 revenues were $113.83 billion and EPS was $2.82, with Google Cloud showing accelerated growth of 48%.

title: PayPal Leadership Shake-Up - Former HP Exec Hired As New CEO
summary: PayPal Holdings, Inc. (PYPL) experienced a leadership change with Enrique Lores, former HP Inc. CEO, appointed as its new President and CEO, effective March 1. The announcement led to a premarket stock decline, reflecting investor uncertainty despite the Board's confidence in Lores's ability to drive innovation. This shift follows PayPal's subpar Q4 performance, missing analyst estimates for both earnings and sales, and comes as analysts maintain a "Hold" rating on the stock with a cautious outlook due to weak momentum and quality scores.

title: Lawsuit Investigation: Tenet Healthcare Privacy Violations?
summary: Attorneys are investigating Tenet Healthcare Corporation for potential privacy violations, specifically alleging that the company shared sensitive patient information with Facebook and Google via tracking tools on its hospital websites. The investigation focuses on whether Tenet unlawfully transmitted medical data, such as symptoms and treatments, to third parties. If successful, a class action lawsuit could provide compensation to affected patients and prevent future data-sharing issues.

title: Why Oklo Stock Could Soar Again in 2026 After Rallying 238% Last Year
summary: Oklo stock saw a significant rally of 238% in 2025, driven by pro-nuclear policies and strategic partnerships with the U.S. Department of Energy. Despite a subsequent pullback, the company's recent agreement with Meta to develop a 1.2 gigawatt nuclear energy campus highlights the validation of its technology and its potential for future growth. The article suggests that if Oklo meets its target of achieving criticality in pilot reactors by mid-2026, its stock could resume an upward trend.

title: Ex-PayPal President David Marcus Says 'Defensive' BNPL Strategy Handed PYPL's Market Share To Rivals, Leading To Stagnant Growth
summary: Former PayPal President David Marcus criticizes PayPal's "defensive" approach to Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) and its shift from product-led innovation to financial optimization, which he believes led to the company losing market share to rivals. He argues that PayPal's failure to make BNPL a core consumer relationship amidst its internal focus allowed competitors like Klarna and Affirm to thrive, leading to stagnant growth and a significant drop in PayPal's stock price. Marcus also expressed skepticism about the new leadership appointed to turn the company around.

title: Nvidia-backed AI voice startup ElevenLabs hits $11 billion valuation in fresh fundraise, as it eyes IPO
summary: AI startup ElevenLabs, backed by Nvidia, has successfully raised $500 million, pushing its valuation to $11 billion, which is more than triple its valuation from January 2025. The London-based company, known for its AI text-to-speech models and expanding portfolio in audio technology, is now setting its sights on a potential IPO. This significant funding round, led by Sequoia Capital and involving other major investors, highlights the booming investment landscape for AI startups, which saw record funding levels in 2025.

title: Vistra's Beaver Valley nuclear site VP talks Meta deal - Pittsburgh Business Times
summary: Barry Blair, Site Vice President at Vistra Corp.'s Beaver Valley nuclear plant, discusses the company's 20-year deal with Meta. This agreement involves adding approximately 140 megawatts to the plant through equipment upgrades and modernization efforts. The article is part of the "Corridors of Opportunity: Beaver County" series.

title: Tech Tour 2026: Are big tech valuations still reasonable?
summary: T. Rowe Price experts Dominic Rizzo, Anthony Bruce Wang, and Jennifer O'Hara Martin discuss whether big tech valuations remain reasonable in 2026. They conclude that valuations are reasonable due to strong earnings growth, especially when considering growth-adjusted metrics like the PEG ratio, and the companies' ability to leverage AI for enhanced growth. They suggest that large-cap tech companies, including semiconductor firms, appear cheaper than the rest of the market when adjusted for their rapid growth.
authors: Dominic Rizzo, CFA, Anthony Bruce Wang, Jennifer O'Hara Martin

title: 4 Internet Stocks Poised to Top Estimates This Earnings Season
summary: This article identifies four internet stocks — Akamai Technologies (AKAM), Five9 (FIVN), Fastly (FSLY), and Spotify Technology (SPOT) — that are well-positioned to exceed earnings estimates for the fourth quarter of 2025. The strong prospects are attributed to factors like accelerating AI adoption, robust advertising demand, and improved cloud infrastructure, despite challenges such as tariff uncertainties and economic deceleration concerns. The stock picks are based on a combination of a positive Earnings ESP and a favorable Zacks Rank.

title: Alphabet Q4 earnings today outlook for GOOGL stock - Alphabet is set to report quarterly earnings today wi
summary: Alphabet (GOOGL) is set to announce its Q4 earnings today, with projected revenue exceeding $111 billion. The stock has already seen significant gains, and options markets are预测 a 5% swing post-earnings, driven by expectations of Google Cloud growth and massive AI adoption. Investors are keen to see if AI spending translates into returns and how capital expenditures for 2026 will be managed to maintain Alphabet's high valuation.

title: Why This Analyst Just Raised Their Price Target on Broadcom Stock
summary: Wolfe Research has upgraded Broadcom (AVGO) to "Outperform" with a $400 price target, citing increasing confidence in Google's TPU program and Broadcom's critical role as a supplier. This upgrade follows Broadcom's stellar Q4 2025 results, which saw record revenue and earnings driven by accelerated AI demand. Despite recent stock volatility, analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" consensus with a mean price target reflecting significant upside potential.

title: Memory Costs Squeeze Tech, Apple Holds Firm
summary: Rising memory prices are impacting the tech industry, increasing build costs for smartphones and AI infrastructure, while demand remains soft. Apple, however, is better positioned due to its scale and negotiating power, reportedly seeking better pricing from suppliers. This helps Apple maintain margins as rivals struggle and as memory costs add billions to data center builds for companies like Microsoft and Meta Platforms.

title: Grocery Outlet Launches First-Ever Shoppable Livestream Series
summary: Grocery Outlet Holding Corp. (NASDAQ: GO) has launched its inaugural shoppable livestream series, "The Grocery Outlet Xtreme Value Stock Up Show," to offer customers interactive bargain hunting. The series, which debuted on February 4, 2026, focuses on helping shoppers prepare for the "Big Game" by providing deals on name-brand groceries at significantly reduced prices, accessible via Instacart during the live stream. It aims to deliver an engaging "Treasure Hunt" experience directly to consumers' screens.

title: Is Oklo Stock the Next Great Passive-Income Powerhouse for 2026?
summary: Oklo, a pre-revenue company specializing in small modular nuclear reactors, is positioned to capitalize on big tech's increasing interest in nuclear energy for AI data centers. A significant long-term deal with Meta Platforms highlights the demand for Oklo's technology, aligning with the U.S. Department of Energy's investment in nuclear power. However, its high valuation and lack of current profitability make it a high-risk investment, with dividends unlikely in the near future.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Shares Bought by Citizens Financial Group Inc. RI
summary: Citizens Financial Group Inc. RI increased its stake in Apple Inc. ($AAPL) by 48.4% in the third quarter, making Apple its second-largest holding. This increased position follows Apple's strong quarterly earnings, which surpassed analyst expectations, though challenges like AI talent departure and TSMC capacity constraints remain. Wall Street maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for Apple, with an average price target of $291.70.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Stock Position Decreased by Godsey & Gibb Inc.
summary: Godsey & Gibb Inc. reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 1.2% in the third quarter of 2026, selling 1,893 shares but still holding 159,201 shares valued at $40.54 million, making it their third-largest position. Despite this reduction, other institutions significantly increased their Apple holdings, and the company reported strong quarterly earnings with an EPS of $2.84 and revenue of $143.76 billion, exceeding expectations. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Apple with a consensus target price of $291.70.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Position Lessened by Lederer & Associates Investment Counsel CA
summary: Lederer & Associates Investment Counsel CA decreased its stake in Apple Inc. ($AAPL) by 6.6% in the third quarter, reducing its holdings to 51,861 shares, although Apple remains its largest portfolio position. Meanwhile, other institutional investors like Vanguard Group Inc., State Street Corp, and Northern Trust Corp significantly increased their positions in Apple during various quarters. The article also provides recent insider trading activity, analyst ratings, and details on Apple's financial performance including its latest earnings report and dividend announcement.

title: Vicus Capital Grows Stock Position in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Vicus Capital increased its stake in Apple Inc. by 6.6% in the third quarter, bringing its total holdings to 59,542 shares valued at $15.161 million, making Apple its 24th largest holding. Apple recently reported stronger-than-expected earnings, beating EPS and revenue estimates, and announced a quarterly dividend of $0.26 per share. Analysts have a "Moderate Buy" rating for Apple, with a consensus target price of $291.70, despite some concerns about AI talent drain and supply competition.

title: The Atomic Pivot: AI’s $50 Billion Power Move
summary: The AI industry's bottleneck has shifted from processing power to electrical power, leading tech giants like Oracle and Meta to invest heavily in developing their own nuclear energy infrastructure. Oracle plans to raise $50 billion to build gigawatt-scale data centers powered by small modular reactors (SMRs), demonstrating a significant pivot in capital investment towards nuclear energy. This shift benefits SMR developers like Oklo and NuScale Power, as well as uranium suppliers like Cameco, while regulatory changes in the US aim to fast-track nuclear reactor deployment.

title: Fate Therapeutics, Inc. (NASDAQ:FATE) Given Consensus Rating of "Hold" by Analysts
summary: Nine analysts have issued a consensus "Hold" rating for Fate Therapeutics, Inc. (NASDAQ:FATE), with an average 12-month price target of $3.92. The biopharmaceutical company's shares are trading at $1.19 with a market cap of $137.3 million, and it reported negative earnings with a P/E ratio of -0.90. Institutional investors hold approximately 97.54% of the stock.

title: PDD Holdings Inc. (PDD): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on PDD Holdings Inc. (PDD), highlighting its potential as a value investment due to trading below its perceived fair value and the "China discount." The company, which owns the rapidly growing e-commerce platform Temu, boasts strong revenue growth, attractive valuation, and high financial efficiency despite regulatory and geopolitical risks. The report suggests that while risks exist, they are largely priced into the market, creating a compelling opportunity for value-oriented investors.

title: Relx loses over £6bn in value as Anthropic launches legal work AI
summary: Relx, a major information and analytics company, saw its market value drop by over £6 billion after Anthropic launched an AI product targeting the legal industry, a key market for Relx. This event contributed to a broader £14 billion loss across London's media and data companies, as fears grow that AI tools could weaken demand for existing products in various sectors. The sell-off also affected other data, financial, and tech companies in both the UK and US, highlighting investor concerns about AI's disruptive potential.

title: Greater clarity on the main risks to the market
summary: This article discusses two primary risks to the market: the potential loss of Federal Reserve independence and the possibility of an AI bubble. It argues that the Fed's independence remains intact with the nomination of Kevin Warsh, whose background supports central bank stability. Regarding AI, the article suggests it's not a bubble but a sorting process, as evidenced by recent earnings from Meta and Microsoft, where market discernment is clear between actual earnings leverage and hype.

title: Wearable Devices Wraps Up Successful 2025: Fueling the Smart Glasses Multi-Billion Dollar Market with Intuitive, Touch-Free Control Solutions
summary: Wearable Devices Ltd. (Nasdaq: WLDS, WLDSW) reflects on a transformative 2025, fueled by the booming smart glasses market and increasing demand for intuitive, touch-free control. Their Mudra Band and Mudra Link products, utilizing AI-powered neural input, position them at the forefront of this shift, with strategic partnerships and technological advancements enhancing their offerings. The company anticipates continued growth and innovation in 2026, focusing on deeper integration with next-gen smart glasses and advancing their proprietary Large MUAP Model and edge AI capabilities.

title: Breaking Down Tech’s Wild Earnings Season So Far
summary: The article analyzes the recent earnings season for major tech companies like Microsoft, Meta, Tesla, Apple, and ServiceNow, discussing market reactions, fair value estimates, and future outlooks. While Meta and Tesla saw significant boosts in their fair value estimates due to strong growth and strategic shifts (AI investments, robotaxis/robots), Microsoft and Apple experienced market disconnects despite solid results, and software stocks like ServiceNow continue to face investor skepticism. Morningstar analysts provide insights into what drove these outcomes and offer buy/sell recommendations based on their valuations and risk assessments.
authors: David Sekera, CFA and Susan Dziubinski

title: Morgan Stanley flags hyperscaler depreciation risk echoing Michael Burry concerns (XLK:NYSEARCA)
summary: Morgan Stanley has identified a significant risk stemming from rising capital expenditures by hyperscalers, warning that this could lead to much higher depreciation charges than currently anticipated by consensus forecasts. This concern echoes earlier warnings made by short-seller Michael Burry. The issue suggests a potential overestimation of future profitability for companies heavily investing in cloud infrastructure.

title: Analysts Offer Insights on Communication Services Companies: Meta Platforms (META), Charter Communications (CHTR) and Comcast (CMCSA)
summary: Three analysts have provided bullish sentiments on Communication Services stocks: Meta Platforms (META), Charter Communications (CHTR), and Comcast (CMCSA). Paul Chew of Phillip Securities maintained a Buy rating on Meta Platforms with an $825.00 price target, while Evercore ISI's Kutgun Maral issued a Buy rating on Comcast with a $35.00 price target. The article highlights analyst consensus ratings and price targets for these companies, suggesting potential upsides.

title: Corning stock steadies before U.S. open after JPMorgan sticks with Overweight, insider sale disclosed
summary: Corning shares held steady before the U.S. market open after a nearly 7% rise the prior session, with JPMorgan reiterating an Overweight rating due to strong LCD panel price trends. The article also highlights Corning's multi-year deal with Meta for data center connectivity hardware and fiber, while noting a recent sale of 25,000 shares by retired president Eric Musser. The stock is being watched to see if it can maintain above the $110 mark and potentially challenge its recent peak.

title: Corning and Meta Make Fiber Deal for Up to US$6 Billion
summary: Corning and Meta have formed a multiyear partnership worth up to US$6 billion to build advanced data center infrastructure across the United States. Meta will procure optical fiber, cable, and connectivity products from Corning, who in turn will significantly expand its production capabilities in North Carolina. This collaboration aims to meet the growing demand for fiber connectivity driven by digital tools and generative AI, creating jobs and strengthening the domestic supply chain for AI infrastructure.

title: Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights: Meta, Centrus Energy, Microsoft and Uranium Energy
summary: This article from Zacks Investment Ideas highlights Meta, Centrus Energy, Microsoft, and Uranium Energy, focusing heavily on the soaring potential of uranium stocks. It argues that the increasing demand for electricity due to the AI boom and the U.S. government's push for nuclear energy will drive significant growth in the uranium sector. Centrus Energy (LEU) and Uranium Energy Corp. (UEC) are presented as "Strong Buy" opportunities, integral to the domestic nuclear revival, with strong earnings revisions and robust balance sheets, respectively.

title: Convergence Investment Partners LLC Takes Position in Expedia Group, Inc. $EXPE
summary: Convergence Investment Partners LLC has purchased a new position in Expedia Group, Inc. (NASDAQ:EXPE) in the third quarter, acquiring 4,683 shares valued at approximately $1,001,000. Wall Street analysts maintain a generally positive outlook on EXPE, with an average rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $290.10, despite some recent insider selling.

title: Caterpillar Rewards Shareholders With $56 Billion Returns
