This strategy positions CAT as the 48th highest capital-returning company in history, a notable achievement for an industrial leader. Despite being a strong cash generator, the article also highlights potential risks including significant stock declines during past economic crises.

title: Federated Hermes Inc. Buys 88,403 Shares of Broadcom Inc. $AVGO
summary: Federated Hermes Inc. increased its stake in Broadcom Inc. by 4.3% in the third quarter, acquiring an additional 88,403 shares, bringing their total holdings to 2,123,784 shares valued at approximately $700.7 million. Broadcom (AVGO) is now Federated Hermes's seventh-largest holding, representing about 1.2% of its investment portfolio. The company has a "Buy" rating from analysts with an average target price of $437.28, supported by expectations of growth in the custom AI chip market, and recently increased its quarterly dividend to $0.65 per share.

title: Uber (UBER) Reports Q4: Everything You Need To Know Ahead Of Earnings
summary: Uber (UBER) is set to report its Q4 earnings this Wednesday, with analysts expecting a 19.9% year-on-year revenue growth to $14.34 billion and adjusted earnings of $0.69 per share. The company has a strong record of beating revenue estimates, with only one miss in the last two years. While some consumer internet peers have seen varied stock performance, Uber's stock price remained unchanged in the last month, heading into earnings with an average analyst price target significantly above its current share price.

title: Apple Inc. $AAPL Shares Acquired by Solidarity Wealth LLC
summary: Solidarity Wealth LLC has increased its stake in Apple Inc. ($AAPL) by 2.1%, making it their largest holding. This comes as Apple exceeded Q1 earnings expectations, driven by strong iPhone 17 demand, and announced a quarterly dividend of $0.26 per share. Various other institutional investors have also adjusted their positions in AAPL, while analysts have reiterated "buy" ratings and raised price targets for the stock.

title: Should Winmark’s (WINA) S&P Index Additions and Dividend Hike Require Action From Investors?
summary: Winmark Corporation's recent inclusion in multiple S&P indices and its approved quarterly dividend of US$0.96 per share enhance the company's visibility and liquidity, particularly for institutional and income-focused investors. While these developments strengthen Winmark's investment narrative by attracting new shareholders, they do not mitigate underlying risks like high leverage and a dividend not fully covered by free cash flow. Investors should consider these financial challenges and the stock's valuation, which is currently above some fair value estimates, despite the increased market presence.

title: Arm Holdings (ARM) Is Down 6.8% After Record AI Deals With Meta, Apple, AWS, Google
summary: Arm Holdings (ARM) experienced a 6.8% stock drop despite reporting its best-ever quarter and announcing significant AI collaborations with Meta, Apple, AWS, and Google. These deals reinforce Arm's central role in AI infrastructure, but the stock's rich earnings multiple and reliance on large AI customers present risks. The article advises investors to consider various perspectives and conduct thorough research before investing.

title: Corning (GLW) Climbs 6.87% on Rare Earths Devt Support
summary: Corning Inc. (GLW) surged 6.87% to $110.35 after investors reacted positively to President Donald Trump’s proposed $12 billion rare earths stockpile project, called Project Vault, which is expected to significantly benefit industries requiring critical minerals. Corning has reportedly signed up for Project Vault and recently secured a $6 billion fiber optic cable deal with Meta Platforms Inc. The company also announced a 215% jump in net income and a 19% increase in net sales in its latest quarterly report.

title: T-Mobile lays off hundreds of Washington workers amid 'changing business needs'
summary: T-Mobile has announced new layoffs affecting 393 employees in Washington, primarily in senior and managerial roles. This follows a previous round of 131 layoffs in August. The Bellevue-based company cited "changing business needs" as the reason for the job cuts.

title: Arista Networks, Inc. (ANET): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Arista Networks, Inc. (ANET), highlighting its exceptionally strong balance sheet with zero long-term debt and massive liquidity, making it a financially secure company in the technology sector. ANET benefits from the accelerating AI infrastructure buildout, providing high-performance networking solutions to hyperscalers and enterprises. The company's robust financial performance, strong cash flow, and reasonable valuation relative to its growth and AI tailwinds suggest a compelling long-term outlook and a significant upside potential despite market concerns.

title: 3 Cheap Stocks to Buy Now as Small Caps Heat Up
summary: This article from Morningstar's "The Morning Filter" podcast discusses cheap stocks to buy as small caps heat up, analyzes recent tech earnings from Microsoft, Meta, Apple, and Tesla, and provides insights on other companies like Alphabet, Amazon, Pepsi, Mondelez, and Clorox. The hosts also address listener questions about Adobe and Amphenol, and conclude with three undervalued small-cap stock picks: Sensata Technologies (ST), Terex (TEX), and Mosaic (MOS).
authors: David Sekera, CFA and Susan Dziubinski

title: Micron Technology, Inc – DRAM shortage fuels pricing upside
summary: Phillip Securities Research initiated coverage on Micron Technology (MU) with a "BUY" recommendation and a target price of US$500, driven by the strong demand for its high bandwidth memory (HBM) products and an industry-wide DRAM shortage. Micron's HBM3E chips are designed into Nvidia and AMD GPUs, and its upcoming HBM4 is expected to challenge SK Hynix's market share. The report highlights increasing DRAM prices, sold-out HBM products for 2026, and significant benefits Micron expects from US CHIPS Act grants.

title: Oracle stock in flux following $50 billion AI fundraising announcement
summary: Oracle plans to raise $45 billion to $50 billion this year to fund its expanding artificial intelligence infrastructure. This announcement caused significant fluctuations in the company's stock, which had previously dropped over 50% from its peak last year, though it saw a brief recovery before dipping again. The capital influx aims to meet demand from major clients like AMD, Meta, Nvidia, and OpenAI, and will be financed through a combination of debt and equity issuances.

title: AMD to report Q4 earnings amid AI spending concerns
summary: AMD is set to report its fourth-quarter earnings, offering insight into the AI market alongside competitors Microsoft and Meta. Despite AI spending concerns, both AMD and Nvidia have seen significant stock increases. The report will detail AMD's performance across data center, client, and gaming segments, featuring its new AI rack and MI500 series GPUs.

title: Barry Schwartz's Past Picks: Meta, Copart & Live Nation Entertainment
summary: Barry Schwartz, President and CIO at Baskin Wealth Management, discusses the performance of his past stock recommendations, which include Meta, Copart, and Live Nation Entertainment. He provides insights into how these companies are currently faring in the market. The article likely features a video segment detailing his analysis.

title: Company News for Feb 2, 2026
summary: This article summarizes company news for February 2, 2026, highlighting significant stock movements. Hecla Mining Company's shares sharply declined, while Verizon Communications Inc. saw a substantial increase due to strong earnings. Meta Platforms, Inc. shares fell on expense and AI spending concerns, and Colgate-Palmolive Company's stock rose.

title: Perspective on Factors Influencing Market Sentiment - Raymond James - Commentaries
summary: Larry Adam of Raymond James addresses key factors influencing market sentiment, including concerns about a "Sell America" trade, the decline of the U.S. dollar, depressed consumer confidence, and recent underperformance in the tech sector. He argues that concerns about a "Sell America" trade are exaggerated, the dollar's dominance is resilient despite short-term fluctuations, consumer spending is likely to remain strong despite low confidence, and tech's underperformance is short-lived with continued strong demand for AI-related technologies.

title: Mosaic: This Undervalued Small-Cap Stock Could Be a Smart Long-Term Buy
summary: Mosaic (MOS) is considered an attractive long-term buy due to its undervaluation, trading 19% below Morningstar's fair value estimate of $35. Despite recent challenges from declining fertilizer demand and weak phosphate prices, analysts anticipate a rebound in demand from North American farmers in 2026 and potential benefits from a commodity supercycle. The company, a leading producer of potash and phosphate fertilizers, is expected to improve its profitability by lowering unit production costs as it shifts production to more efficient mines.

title: Phillips 66 $PSX Shares Acquired by National Pension Service
summary: National Pension Service increased its stake in Phillips 66 by 3.5% in Q3, purchasing over 20,000 shares to bring its total ownership to approximately 0.15% valued at $81.9 million. While institutional investors are growing their positions, company insiders recently sold significant blocks of shares, totaling nearly $12 million. Analysts maintain a consensus "Hold" rating for Phillips 66, with an average price target of $154.47.

title: Inside Tesla's $20B Capex Plan: How TSLA Is Shaping Its Future
summary: Tesla plans to significantly increase its capital expenditures to over $20 billion in 2026, up from $8.5 billion in 2025 and $11.3 billion in 2024, to invest heavily in AI, robotics, and autonomy. This spending will fund six new facilities, expand existing factories, and build AI compute infrastructure to support initiatives like full self-driving, robotaxis, and the Optimus robot. With over $44 billion in cash, Tesla is positioning itself as a technology and AI-driven company, a strategy mirrored by other tech giants like Meta Platforms and Nebius, which are also ramping up AI-related capital investments.

title: Oracle shares fall as investors assess up to $50 billion AI funding plan
summary: Oracle's shares dropped by about 4% in premarket trading after the company announced plans to raise $45 billion to $50 billion this year for cloud infrastructure expansion. This fundraising initiative, aimed at meeting demand from major customers like AMD, Meta, and Nvidia for AI-related services, has raised concerns among investors about Oracle's increasing debt load and the long-term profitability of AI spending. Analysts noted that the financing mix should protect Oracle's credit rating, but warned of potential near-term margin pressure.

title: Goldman’s Snider Says Forecasts From US Companies Look Healthy
summary: Goldman Sachs strategists, led by Ben Snider, report that the 2026 earnings outlook for US companies remains strong, with over half of S&P 500 members forecasting above analyst expectations. This positive forecast alleviates concerns stemming from a somewhat underwhelming Q4 earnings season for 2025. Companies like Lockheed Martin, Verizon, and Meta Platforms have seen stock gains after providing optimistic outlooks, while Microsoft faced declines due to a weaker-than-expected cloud business report.

title: Oracle rises after company announces $50 billion fundraising plans. Here's what's happening
summary: Oracle's stock rose 2% after the company announced plans to raise $45 billion to $50 billion in 2026 to expand its data center capacity for cloud customers, including major players like Nvidia and Meta. This move comes as hyperscalers pour funds into AI infrastructure, despite investor concerns over Oracle's aggressive buildout strategy and recent stock drops following disappointing financial results and debt raising. The company has already made significant bets on AI infrastructure, including an $18 billion bond sale and a $300 billion deal with OpenAI in September.

title: Oracle Plans To Lay Off 20,000 To 30,000 Employees: Report
summary: Oracle Corporation is reportedly considering laying off 20,000 to 30,000 employees, about 10% of its workforce, to fund its ambitious AI data center expansion projects. This move is expected to free up $8 billion to $10 billion to support a $300 billion partnership with OpenAI and other AI infrastructure. The company is also exploring selling some of its businesses, including the healthcare software unit Cerner, and plans to raise $45 billion to $50 billion in 2026 for additional cloud infrastructure capacity.

title: This Utility Stock Could Be the Next Big AI Winner
summary: NextEra Energy (NYSE: NEE) is presented as a strong investment opportunity in the AI boom due to its role as one of North America's largest utility companies. The company is actively signing deals with major tech firms like Alphabet and Meta Platforms to power data centers and support AI infrastructure development. NextEra's stock is considered appealingly priced, and it offers a growing dividend, making it attractive for long-term investors looking for indirect exposure to the AI sector.

title: Associated Banc Corp Has $151.18 Million Stake in Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Associated Banc Corp reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 2.1% in the third quarter, now holding 593,731 shares valued at $151.18 million, making Apple its fourth-largest position. Despite this reduction, other institutional investors significantly increased their holdings in Apple, while analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average price target of $289.23. The article also notes recent insider stock sales, positive quarterly earnings, mixed sentiment regarding Apple's AI strategy and supply chain, and details its recent dividend announcement and stock performance.

title: iShares U.S. Technology ETF
summary: The iShares U.S. Technology ETF (IYW) provides low-cost exposure to the U.S. tech sector, tracking the Dow Jones U.S. Technology Index. With over 150 securities, it's liquid and has significant assets under management, though it's heavily concentrated in major tech giants like NVIDIA, Apple, and Microsoft. While suitable for tactical investors or those looking to increase tech exposure, its sector-specific focus might be too granular for a long-term buy-and-hold portfolio.

title: Take-Two (TTWO) To Report Earnings Tomorrow: Here Is What To Expect
summary: Take-Two (TTWO) is scheduled to report earnings after market hours this Tuesday. Analysts anticipate revenue growth of 16.2% year-on-year to $1.58 billion and adjusted earnings of $0.83 per share. The company has a strong track record of beating revenue estimates, and despite recent underperformance in the consumer internet segment, analysts have largely reconfirmed their expectations for the upcoming report.

title: Earnings To Watch: Electronic Arts (EA) Reports Q4 Results Tomorrow
summary: Electronic Arts (EA) is expected to report its Q4 results after market close on Tuesday. Analysts anticipate a 25% year-on-year revenue growth to $2.35 billion, with adjusted earnings around $4.80 per share. The company has missed Wall Street's revenue estimates twice in the past two years, and its stock price has remained largely unchanged over the last month despite a general underperformance in the consumer internet segment.

title: Broadcom's AI Infrastructure Growth Potential is Huge
summary: Broadcom (AVGO) is poised for substantial growth in the AI infrastructure sector, with Cathie Wood forecasting AI infrastructure spending to reach $1.4 trillion by 2030. The company is benefiting from rising demand for networking components and custom AI chips, with its AI revenue projected to potentially soar from $20 billion to $100 billion over the next two years. Recent analyst upgrades and strong customer orders further underscore Broadcom's promising position in the expanding AI market.

title: Dollar Rebounds from Multi-Year Lows and Market-Wide Volatility is Rising
summary: The article discusses the resurgence of volatility across financial markets, with the Dollar rebounding from multi-year lows. It highlights how political headlines and global events are increasingly influencing market sentiment, leading to sharp movements in currencies and commodities. Despite relative calm in benchmark US indices, market-wide volatility is rising, making key economic data points like Nonfarm Payrolls crucial for understanding future market direction.

title: 1 Nuclear Stock That Could Power Your Retirement Income for Decades
summary: Constellation Energy (NASDAQ: CEG) is highlighted as a promising nuclear stock for retirement income due to its leadership in U.S. nuclear power generation. The company is poised to benefit from increasing energy demands and government support for nuclear energy, with key deals already in place with tech giants like Microsoft and Meta Platforms. Despite a current low dividend yield, its strong earnings growth projections suggest significant dividend increases in the coming decades, making it an attractive long-term investment.

title: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Acquires Israeli Startup Q.ai For Approximately $2 Billion: Report
summary: Apple Inc. (AAPL) has reportedly acquired Israeli AI audio startup Q.ai for approximately $2 billion, according to the Financial Times. This acquisition aims to enhance Apple's capabilities in developing wearable devices that interact with artificial intelligence, helping to close the gap with competitors like Meta and Alphabet. The news comes after Apple reported strong first-quarter fiscal 2026 earnings, exceeding revenue and EPS estimates driven by robust iPhone demand.

title: GOOG stock price: What to watch before Alphabet’s Feb. 4 earnings after Wall Street’s Friday slide
summary: Alphabet (GOOG) stock faces a critical week with its Q4 2025 earnings report on Feb. 4, following a Wall Street slide. Investors are focused on factors like advertising demand, Google Cloud expansion, AI monetization, and capital expenditures, which analysts project could exceed Street estimates by a significant margin. Further complexity comes from ongoing legal battles and the potential impact of AI innovations on both growth and costs for the tech giant.

title: Vistra Corp. (VST) Powers Ahead with Strategic Acquisitions and Analyst Upgrades
summary: Vistra Corp. (VST) has announced the closing of a $2.25 billion private offering, with proceeds intended to finance the acquisition of Cogentrix Energy for $4.7 billion. This acquisition will add 5,500 megawatts of natural gas-fired power plants, diversifying Vistra's geographic footprint. Additionally, UBS reiterated a Buy rating on VST and raised its price target to $233, citing power purchase agreements with Meta Platforms for Vistra's nuclear assets.

title: Meta Platforms, Inc. $META Position Reduced by UNIVEST FINANCIAL Corp
summary: UNIVEST FINANCIAL Corp reduced its stake in Meta Platforms by 4.2% in the third quarter, selling 2,665 shares but still holding 61,323 shares valued at $45 million. Despite Meta's strong Q4 earnings beat and analyst upgrades, concerns persist regarding the planned $115–$135 billion capital expenditure for 2026 and continued losses from Reality Labs. This reduction by UNIVEST FINANCIAL Corp reflects a cautious approach amidst these financial considerations, even as other institutional investors increased their positions.

title: Direxion Daily META Bull 2X Shares (NASDAQ:METU) Short Interest Update
summary: Short interest in Direxion Daily META Bull 2X Shares (METU) significantly increased by 44.4% in January to 4,469,549 shares, representing 19.8% of the float. This leveraged ETF tracks Meta Platforms Class A shares and recently raised its quarterly dividend to $0.209, resulting in an annualized yield of about 2.3%. The ETF has a market cap of $816.7 million and a beta of 4.09.

title: Narwhal Capital Management Sells 2,402 Shares of Apple Inc. $AAPL
summary: Narwhal Capital Management reduced its stake in Apple Inc. by 0.9% during the third quarter, selling 2,402 shares and retaining 272,566 shares valued at $69.404 million, making Apple its fourth-largest holding. Despite this reduction by one firm, other institutional investors increased their positions in Apple. The article also touches on mixed analyst sentiment regarding Apple's recent performance, AI strategy, and supply chain issues.

title: How Vistra’s Long-Term Nuclear Deal With Meta Amid PJM Scrutiny Will Impact Vistra (VST) Investors
summary: Vistra recently announced a 20-year, 2.6 GW nuclear power deal with Meta, providing carbon-free electricity to support Meta's data centers. This agreement reinforces Vistra's strategy of long-duration, zero-carbon contracts, but also brings increased regulatory scrutiny in markets like PJM. Investors should consider the balance between this contract's revenue visibility and the risks associated with policy intervention and earnings volatility.

title: Constellation Energy's Opportunities in AI Data Center Expansion
summary: Constellation Energy is well-positioned to capitalize on the increasing energy demand from AI data centers, having secured long-term power purchase agreements with Microsoft and Meta. The company's expansion through the acquisition of Calpine Corp. and its strong carbon-free nuclear assets provide reliable and sustainable power. Despite potential market challenges like future electricity auction price caps, Constellation's strategic moves and clean energy profile indicate continued benefits from the AI data center boom.

title: Linde stock price heads into earnings week: what to watch for LIN shares when markets reopen
summary: Linde plc (LIN.O) is set to release its fourth-quarter 2025 earnings on Thursday, Feb. 5, with investors closely watching for pricing trends, volume performance, and the 2026 outlook. The report follows a recent leadership change and comes amid broader market reactions to political and economic shifts, including new inflation data and a Fed chair nomination. Analysts will assess how Linde navigates cost pressures and industrial demand, particularly in Europe.

title: 2 Millionaire-Maker Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks
summary: This article highlights Palo Alto Networks (PANW) and Broadcom (AVGO) as two promising AI stocks with significant growth potential. Palo Alto Networks is poised to benefit from the booming AI cybersecurity market through its platformization strategy, while Broadcom is gaining traction as a key player in custom AI processors for hyperscalers and AI companies. Both companies are expected to deliver substantial financial gains by capitalizing on the increasing adoption and infrastructure development in artificial intelligence.

title: Ziff Davis’ New AI Shopping Portfolio Might Change The Case For Investing In ZD

This initiative, along with HALO and IMAGINE, aims to reposition the company by leveraging its traffic and data for enhanced engagement and advertising. While it could support revenue and margins, investors should consider the balance between AI investment, potential valuation, and current market challenges.

title: Gene Munster Says Apple Stock's Tepid Reaction To Strong Earnings Beat Comes Down To One Thing: Investors Want More AI Substance
summary: Gene Munster of Deepwater Asset Management suggests that Apple's stock did not significantly rise despite strong earnings and positive guidance because investors are seeking more concrete details on the company's AI strategy. Although Apple reported a strong fiscal first quarter, exceeding revenue and earnings estimates, the stock's muted reaction indicates skepticism about the meaningful impact of AI on future growth. Munster posits that Apple's previous unveiling of Apple Intelligence set high expectations for AI, which the company has since failed to fully deliver on, leading to investor demands for clearer AI milestones and monetization plans.

title: SanDisk, UnitedHealth, Meta Platforms And More: 5 Stocks Investors Couldn't Stop Buzzing About This Week

The piece details each company's performance, key financial figures, and investor sentiment.

title: Jim Cramer Discusses Major Potential Catalyst For Corning (GLW)
summary: Jim Cramer highlighted Corning Incorporated (GLW) as a significant stock, noting its potential to replace copper with glass inside chips for improved performance. This comes after GLW's strong stock performance, a deal with Meta Platforms, and analyst upgrades, with some analysts predicting the Meta deal could double revenue and be followed by another with Microsoft. The article also mentions the company's optical business scaling beyond first-quarter guidance.

title: NetClass Technology Standardizes Director Pay with New Cash-Based Agreement

However, Spark notes potential bearish momentum from technical analysis and limited upside due to high valuation, though Nvidia's focus on AI and data centers positions it for long-term growth.

Projections suggest that Meta's advertising revenue could surpass Google Search's advertising revenue this year, largely due to AI-driven improvements in its ad products. While Alphabet's total advertising business, including YouTube, is still larger, Meta's consistent outperformance in growth indicates it may eventually surpass Alphabet as the world's biggest advertising business.

The company's dual business model offers a natural hedge for investors, combining growth potential with reliable returns.

title: Arista Networks's Options Frenzy: What You Need to Know

summary: Apple Inc. has seen at least four more of its artificial intelligence researchers and a top Siri executive depart in recent weeks, with several heading to competitors like Meta Platforms Inc. and Google DeepMind. These departures highlight ongoing turbulence in Apple's AI division, which has struggled to keep pace with competitors and has faced talent exodus, particularly after a decision to outsource some technology to Google. Despite reporting strong earnings, the lack of compelling AI breakthroughs and the continuous drain of talent pose significant challenges for the company's future AI endeavors.

title: La Rosa Holdings Posts Strong Revenue Growth and Strategic Moves in AI Expansion

These efforts have led to a 25% reduction in cash burn and positioned the company for future growth in the evolving real estate market.
authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Microsoft Vs. Meta: A Tale Of Two AI Cities
summary: The article compares Microsoft (MSFT) and Meta (META) in the context of AI-driven growth. It argues that Meta has demonstrated superior AI monetization, leading to significant revenue growth and improved user engagement, while Microsoft's AI growth remains incremental. Despite similar valuations, the author suggests Meta is a clearer buy due to its stronger earnings trajectory and effective AI leverage.

With a strong order book, accelerating growth, and an undervalued stock price compared to the U.S. technology sector, Ciena is poised for significant upside.

title: Susquehanna Sees Over $1B Annual Royalties From Arm's (ARM) AI XPU

Despite anticipated royalty headwinds in 2026 for mobile and PC markets, these new ventures are expected to significantly boost Arm's growth.

title: QLTY’s 37% Tech Allocation Was A Tailwind; Now It’s A Liability

The next 12 months will test whether its quality screen can protect capital against rate volatility and concentrated tech exposure.

title: Arm Holdings Deepens AI Ties With OpenAI And Meta Data Centers
summary: Arm Holdings is expanding its role in the AI and data center markets by developing an AI XPI ASIC for OpenAI and a custom server CPU potentially for Meta. The deeper involvement in these areas could broaden Arm's addressable market and solidify its position amidst hyperscale clients, though it also introduces increased execution complexity and competition.

title: Apple buys Israeli startup Q.ai as the AI race heats up
summary: Apple has acquired the Israeli AI startup Q.ai for nearly $2 billion, aiming to enhance its AI capabilities, particularly in audio technology. Q.ai specializes in imaging and machine learning, with expertise in interpreting whispered speech and improving audio in noisy environments, which could benefit Apple products like AirPods and the Vision Pro headset. This acquisition marks CEO Aviad Maizels' second company sold to Apple, and it comes as Apple prepares to announce its quarterly earnings, expecting strong iPhone sales growth.

This expansion is expected to create 5,000 new jobs and significantly increase Corning's presence in North Carolina.

Elon Musk plans to shift focus from some EV models to robotics, AI, energy, and self-driving technology, with significant capital expenditures planned for 2026.

CEO Satya Nadella cautioned about the potential for an economic bubble if AI benefits aren't widely distributed.

title: Microsoft's Quarterly Sales Beat Expectations, But Investors Remain Concerned About AI Spending
summary: Microsoft exceeded Wall Street's quarterly sales expectations, driven by strong demand for AI services on its Azure cloud platform, with revenue up 17% to $81.3 billion and net income rising 60% to $38.5 billion. Despite this strong performance, investors are concerned about the substantial investments in AI infrastructure potentially impacting long-term profit growth, leading to a 6% drop in Microsoft's shares after hours. CEO Satya Nadella highlighted concerns about an AI bubble if benefits aren't widely distributed, while CFO Amy Hood reported Cloud revenue exceeding $50 billion this quarter.

Discovery could reignite growth, expanding into live sports and leveraging AI for production efficiencies are also seen as viable strategies to boost value.

summary: Microsoft (MSFT) stock crashed nearly 12% on January 29, 2026, marking its worst single-day fall in six years and wiping out $400 billion in market value. Smith projects continued growth and shareholder returns for 2026, though challenges in China are expected to persist.

The disruption coincided with a surge in user skepticism and app deletions following an update to TikTok's U.S. privacy policy.

summary: S&P 500 futures showed gains in premarket trading. Among individual stocks, International Business Machines Corp. (IBM) rose 9.5% and Meta Platforms Inc. (META) increased by 8.8% ahead of the market open.

title: Why One Fund Just Bet $4 Million on Teleflex Stock Despite a 42% One-Year Drop
summary: Eos Management has disclosed a new $3.76 million stake in Teleflex (TFX), purchasing 30,831 shares despite the medical technology company's stock experiencing a 42% decline over the past year. This move is notable because Teleflex has underperformed the S&P 500 significantly and is facing operational uncertainties, including a narrowed revenue growth outlook and a leadership transition. The investment suggests confidence from Eos Management that Teleflex's recent challenges are already factored into its stock price and that its strategy to focus on higher-acuity hospital markets will lead to long-term growth and improved margins.

title: AI Sparks Competition, Reshapes Tech Industry Dynamics
summary: David Eiswert, Global Portfolio Manager at T. Rowe Price, discusses how artificial intelligence is transforming the technology sector. He highlights that AI is disrupting the power of established tech monopolies, fostering increased competition, and opening up new investment opportunities for smaller firms across the supply chain. The article emphasizes how the demand for innovative technology and high-bandwidth memory is surging, shifting value towards companies with unique technological advantages.

title: These Stocks Are Today’s Movers: Microsoft, Meta, Tesla, IBM, SAP, Las Vegas Sands, Apple, and More
summary: Stock futures showed an upward trend on Thursday as investors processed a wave of Big Tech earnings reports. This market movement occurred despite ongoing concerns about escalating tensions between the U.S. and Iran. The article highlights several key movers including Microsoft, Meta, Tesla, IBM, SAP, and Las Vegas Sands.
authors: Mackenzie Tatananni, George Glover and Joe Woelfel

title: META Platforms (NASDAQ:META) Passes Key Peter Lynch Investment Filters
summary: META Platforms (NASDAQ:META) has successfully passed key investment filters derived from Peter Lynch's investment philosophy, known as Growth at a Reasonable Price (GARP). The company demonstrates strong profit expansion, a sensible PEG ratio of 0.91, high return on equity, and robust financial strength with a low debt-to-equity ratio. These factors, combined with Meta's widely used "Family of Apps," suggest it aligns well with Lynch's criteria for a sound investment.

title: Microsoft, Meta, Tesla, IBM, SAP, Apple, and More Stock Market Movers
summary: This article lists some of the major stock market movers, including Microsoft, Meta, Tesla, IBM, SAP, Apple, and Las Vegas Sands. Stock futures were experiencing modest rises on Thursday. This movement occurred despite investors processing numerous Big Tech earnings reports and geopolitical tensions between the U.S. and Iran.

title: Meta earnings: Strong end to 2025 as AI monetization begins to show
summary: Meta Platforms reported strong fourth-quarter earnings for 2025, with sales up 24% to $60 billion, although operating margins contracted due to rising AI-related costs. The company's investments in AI are driving engagement, ad efficacy, and content recommendations, leading to an 18% increase in ad impressions. Despite shares being up, Morningstar maintains its $850 fair value estimate, viewing Meta as undervalued with significant potential from its AI initiatives and continued ad business strength.

title: Corning's Q4 tops expectations. Why company expects more growth in 2026
summary: Corning Inc. reported better-than-expected Q4 2025 results and forecast strong growth for 2026, driven by its "Springboard" initiative and a new $6 billion deal with Meta. The company posted record Q4 and full-year results, with adjusted EPS of $0.72 and revenue of $4.41 billion. Corning expects continued growth in Q1 2026, with core sales projected to be up 15 percent, and has upgraded its Springboard plan to add an incremental $11 billion in annualized sales by 2028.

title: Corning stock jumps after $6 billion Meta fiber deal
summary: Corning Inc.'s stock surged after it announced a multiyear supply agreement with Meta Platforms, potentially generating up to $6 billion in revenue. The deal involves Corning providing advanced fiber, cable, and connectivity solutions for Meta's U.S. data centers, thus supporting the growing demand for AI infrastructure. Corning plans to expand its North Carolina manufacturing capacity and increase employment by 15-20% to meet this demand.

title: Analysts Conflicted on These Communication Services Names: Meta Platforms (META), TIM (TIMB) and Warner Bros (WBD)
summary: This article highlights differing analyst opinions on several Communication Services companies: Meta Platforms (META), TIM (TIMB), and Warner Bros (WBD). While Meta Platforms received a 'Strong Buy' consensus with substantial upside, TIM has a 'Hold' consensus, and Warner Bros carries a 'Moderate Buy' consensus despite a projected downside from current levels. The report details specific analyst ratings and price targets for each company.

title: NANO Nuclear appoints former NRC professional as licensing director By Investing.com
summary: NANO Nuclear Energy Inc. has appointed Michael Montecalvo, a veteran with over 30 years of nuclear industry experience and former NRC professional, as its Licensing Director. Montecalvo will spearhead the company's licensing strategy for its modular nuclear microreactors. This appointment strengthens NANO Nuclear's regulatory capabilities as it prepares for the formal licensing process of its KRONOS MMR Energy System and expands its operations.

title: Live Social Shopping Expansions
summary: QVC® has announced a significant expansion of its live social shopping platform, welcoming new beauty and wellness brands like K18 and Make Time Wellness, and extending offerings from existing vendors. This move aims to enhance its immersive retail experience through "exclusive value bundles" across various platforms including TikTok Shop, QVC.com, and QVC+ streaming. The expansion highlights key trends in live social shopping, science-driven beauty, and the convergence of e-commerce with streaming media.

title: Tesla plans $20 billion capital spending spree in push beyond human-driven cars
summary: Tesla plans to significantly increase its capital spending to over $20 billion this year, primarily focusing on ventures beyond traditional electric vehicles for human drivers. This investment targets autonomous vehicles like the Cybercab, humanoid robots, and battery/lithium production, reflecting a strategic shift towards AI-driven technologies. CEO Elon Musk emphasized this is a "very big capex year" for an "epic future," moving away from car production in some factories to prioritize these new business lines, which aim to justify the company's valuation akin to major tech firms rather than automotive manufacturers.

title: Corning (GLW) Climbs to All-Time High on New Meta Billion-Dollar Deal
summary: Corning Inc. (GLW) reached a new all-time high after securing a $6 billion deal with Meta Platforms Inc. to supply fiber optic cables for its data centers. This agreement will expand Corning's manufacturing in North Carolina, creating new jobs and strengthening domestic supply chains. The deal comes as Corning prepares to announce its Q4 and full-year 2025 earnings.

title: Meta Is a Social Media Behemoth With Strong Growth Ahead of It
summary: Meta Platforms (META) is identified as a dominant force in social media, boasting nearly 4 billion monthly active users across its key applications. The article emphasizes Meta's strong growth potential, particularly with the emerging monetization of AI. Despite a strong end to 2025, the stock is considered undervalued by analysts, though future AI costs are noted as a significant factor.

title: Meta Guidance Lifts Shares 9%; Microsoft Drops 7%, Tesla Edges Up 2%
summary: Meta Platforms' shares surged 9% in aftermarket trading after the company issued a bullish first-quarter sales forecast that significantly beat analyst expectations. In contrast, Microsoft's stock dropped 7% due to slowing cloud growth and higher-than-expected capital expenditures, raising concerns about its AI investment returns. Tesla also saw a modest 2% gain after beating Q4 earnings expectations, despite reporting its first-ever annual revenue decline.

title: These AI Cloud Stocks Are Starting to Soar Again Thanks to Nvidia: ANET, CRWV
summary: AI-focused cloud stocks Arista Networks (ANET) and CoreWeave (CRWV) are experiencing a significant rally due to renewed investor interest in AI infrastructure, driven by major chipmakers like Nvidia (NVDA) signaling strong long-term demand for data center capacity. CoreWeave has seen a 40% spike in the last month after a new partnership announcement with Nvidia, which includes a $2 billion equity infusion, making Nvidia its second-largest shareholder. Arista Networks is also performing well, benefitting from its AI-networking leadership and partnerships with hyperscalers like Microsoft and Meta Platforms.

title: Meta Platforms Inc-Class A (NASDAQ:META) Beats Q4 2025 Estimates and Issues Strong Q1 Guidance Amid Major AI Spending Plans
summary: Meta Platforms Inc-Class A (NASDAQ:META) reported strong Q4 2025 results, surpassing analyst estimates for both revenue and EPS, driven by its core advertising business. The company also issued optimistic Q1 2026 guidance, projecting higher revenue than consensus. Despite these strong financial performances, a significant highlight is Meta's aggressive investment strategy for 2026, focusing heavily on AI development and infrastructure, which will drive substantial capital outlays.

title: Earnings live: IBM stock surges, Whirlpool slides; Meta, Microsoft, Tesla report beats across the board
summary: The fourth-quarter earnings season saw strong performances from tech giants like Meta, Microsoft, and Tesla, with Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg highlighting a major AI acceleration. IBM stock surged due to accelerated software revenue growth, while Whirlpool missed expectations due to tariffs and an intense promotional environment. Several other companies, including ServiceNow, GE Vernova, and Texas Instruments, also reported their latest earnings, reflecting varied impacts from market conditions and AI demand.
authors: Grace O'Donnell, Brooke DiPalma, Jenny McCall

title: IBM beats Q4 estimates as generative AI business tops $12.5B
summary: International Business Machines Corp (NYSE:IBM) surpassed Q4 revenue and profit expectations, driven by strong software sales and the growth of its generative AI business, which now exceeds $12.5 billion. The company reported $19.69 billion in revenue and an operating EPS of $4.52, both beating analyst forecasts. Following these positive results, IBM's shares rose 7.7% in aftermarket trading.

title: Royal Gold stock hits all-time high at 299.77 USD
summary: Royal Gold Inc. (RGLD) stock has reached an all-time high of $299.77, reflecting a significant 113.31% increase over the past year and a 94.19% surge in the last six months. The company's market capitalization now exceeds $25 billion, driven by strong investor confidence and favorable market conditions in the precious metals sector. Despite appearing slightly overvalued according to InvestingPro analysis, analysts have set price targets as high as $356, and the company recently reported strong Q3 2025 revenue and an increased dividend.

title: A Meta deal just turned this 175-year-old company into a linchpin of the AI data center boom
summary: Corning, a 175-year-old company known for various glass innovations, has become a crucial supplier for AI data centers following a deal with Meta. Meta has committed up to $6 billion to Corning by 2030 for fiber-optic cable, prompting Corning to expand its manufacturing facility in North Carolina. This deal, which sent Corning's stock soaring 16%, highlights the company's re-invention as a key player in the AI boom by providing essential fiber-optic infrastructure for connecting powerful GPUs within data centers.

title: Form 424B2 BARCLAYS BANK PLC
summary: This SEC filing (Form 424B2) from Barclays Bank PLC details an offering of $7,588,000 Phoenix AutoCallable Notes due January 31, 2028. These notes are linked to the performance of the S&P 500® Index, the Russell 2000® Index, and the Dow Jones Industrial Average®. The document outlines the terms, risks, and tax considerations for investors, highlighting that the principal repayment and contingent coupon payments are subject to the creditworthiness of Barclays Bank PLC and potential U.K. Bail-in Power.

title: Corning Q4 Earnings Call Highlights
summary: Corning reported strong Q4 and full-year 2025 results, with Q4 sales up 14% to $4.41 billion and core EPS up 26% to $0.72. The company also raised its Springboard ambitions, targeting $11 billion in incremental sales by 2028, and announced a multi-year agreement worth up to $6 billion with Meta. Optical Communications was identified as the primary growth driver, with significant investments planned for capacity expansion.

title: NextEra Energy targets 15GW of new generation for data center hubs by 2035
summary: NextEra Energy aims to develop 15GW of new generation capacity for data center hubs by 2035, driven by significant interest (20GW) from hyperscale data center customers. The company is currently developing 20 data center hubs and plans to expand to 40 by year-end, leveraging its robust renewables and storage portfolio for rapid deployment and exploring small modular reactor co-location opportunities. NextEra has also sealed major agreements with tech giants like Google Cloud and Meta to power their data center expansions.

title: Form 424B2 CANADIAN IMPERIAL BANK
summary: This SEC filing (Form 424B2) from Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce describes Market Linked Securities—Auto-Callable with Contingent Coupon with Memory Feature and Contingent Downside Principal at Risk Securities due February 16, 2029. These securities are linked to the performance of the common stock of Amazon.com, Inc., Alphabet Inc. (Class A), and Meta Platforms, Inc. (Class A), with payouts depending on the lowest performing stock among the three, regular contingent coupon payments with a memory feature, potential for early automatic call, and principal at risk if not automatically called.

title: Universal Beteiligungs und Servicegesellschaft mbH Has $1 Billion Stock Holdings in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Universal Beteiligungs und Servicegesellschaft mbH has nearly $1 billion USD in Alphabet Inc. stock, making it their 8th largest position despite a recent 1.8% reduction in holdings. Corporate insiders have been net sellers, with significant sales from CEO Sundar Pichai. Wall Street analysts maintain a "Buy" rating for Alphabet, following a strong earnings beat and a market capitalization of approximately $4.04 trillion.

title: Is FCEL Better Positioned Than OKLO for Data Center Power?
summary: This article compares FuelCell Energy (FCEL) and Oklo Inc. (OKLO) as power solutions for data centers, highlighting their differing approaches and market positions. FCEL offers modular fuel cell systems for immediate deployment, aligning with current data center needs, while OKLO focuses on long-term advanced nuclear reactors with significant future potential but present uncertainty. The analysis suggests FCEL is better positioned due to its nearer-term relevance, improving financial trajectory, and practical solutions for data center power demands, contrasting with OKLO's long development timelines and speculative valuation.

title: Corning Inc (NYSE:GLW) Beats Q4 Earnings, Raises Long-Term Growth Targets Despite Market Caution
summary: Corning Inc. (NYSE:GLW) exceeded Q4 earnings and revenue expectations, reporting core sales of $4.41 billion and EPS of $0.72. The company also significantly upgraded its multi-year "Springboard" growth plan, increasing its target for incremental annualized sales by the end of 2028 to $11 billion. Despite strong results and optimistic guidance, shares saw a slight dip in pre-market trading, potentially due to a "sell the news" reaction or focus on mixed segment performance.

title: Bank of America resets Amazon stock price target before earnings
summary: Bank of America has updated its price target for Amazon (AMZN) stock to $286 from $303 ahead of the company's Q4 earnings release on February 5. Analyst Justin Post and his team project Amazon to exceed Wall Street's estimates for Q4 revenue and EBIT, expecting 22% year-over-year AWS revenue growth. The lowered price target reflects broader software as a service sector multiple compression, despite positive indicators like AWS's new European Sovereign Cloud and strategic partnerships.

title: Roper Technologies Sees Q4 Revenue Increase, Led by Software Businesses
summary: Roper Technologies (NASDAQ: ROP) reported a 10% increase in fourth-quarter revenue, reaching $2.06 billion, primarily driven by its software businesses. For the full fiscal year 2025, total revenue grew 12% to $7.90 billion. The company also announced strategic acquisitions and share repurchases, and provided optimistic guidance for 2026, expecting approximately 8% total revenue growth.

title: Assessing Ziff Davis (ZD) Valuation After Seven 2025 Acquisitions And Expanded AI And AWS Initiatives
summary: Ziff Davis (ZD) is attracting attention from value investors following seven acquisitions in 2025, active share repurchases, and a focus on AI and AWS-driven products. Despite recent share price momentum, the stock is currently trading at a 63% discount to its intrinsic value estimate of $43.43 per share, classifying it as undervalued according to analysts. The article suggests investors consider both the potential for growth and risks such as weakening advertising trends.

title: Corning Announces Outstanding 2025 Financial Results (1) – Upgrades Springboard Plan for Faster Sales Growth on Significantly Enhanced Financial Profile
summary: Corning Incorporated reported outstanding financial results for Q4 and full-year 2025, exceeding previous guidance with significant growth in core sales and EPS. The company also announced an upgraded Springboard plan, projecting an additional $11 billion in incremental annualized sales by the end of 2028, up from the original $8 billion target. This positive outlook is supported by an enhanced financial profile, including expanded operating margins and nearly doubled adjusted free cash flow since the Springboard plan's inception.

title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOG Shares Sold by Osborne Partners Capital Management LLC
summary: Osborne Partners Capital Management LLC reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG) by 3.9% in the third quarter, selling 5,681 shares and holding 139,540 shares valued at $33.99 million. Other institutional investors also adjusted their Alphabet holdings, with some increasing their positions and others initiating new ones. The article also provides a news roundup for Alphabet, insider trading details, analysts' price targets, stock performance, and dividend information.

title: Lam Research stock price pops in premarket as LRCX heads into earnings
summary: Lam Research (LRCX) stock price rose approximately 4.4% in premarket trading, reaching $249, as the company anticipates releasing its December-quarter earnings today after the U.S. market closes. Analysts forecast a 20% year-over-year revenue climb to $5.25 billion and adjusted earnings of $1.17 per share, with investors closely watching the company's outlook for the March quarter. This pre-earnings surge follows recent price target increases from Evercore ISI and Lynx Equity, highlighting increasing optimism for the chip-equipment maker.

title: Amazon cuts 16,000 jobs globally in broader restructuring
summary: Amazon announced it is cutting 16,000 jobs worldwide, marking its second major round of layoffs in three months. The company is restructuring after pandemic-era over-hiring and focusing on expanding the adoption of artificial intelligence tools, which its CEO believes will lead to more automation and corporate job losses. These cuts contribute to a broader goal of trimming about 30,000 corporate roles across various departments.

title: Amazon plans to cut 16,000 jobs as AI competition heats up
summary: Amazon plans to terminate approximately 16,000 corporate employees in an effort to streamline bureaucracy and intensify its focus on artificial intelligence. This wave of layoffs brings Amazon's total job cuts to 30,000 within three months, with the company aiming to reduce management layers and automate more operations. Other tech giants like Meta, Pinterest, and ASML Holding NV have also announced significant job reductions, signaling a broader industry trend towards AI-driven restructuring.

title: Celestica Inc. (CLS): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on Celestica Inc. (CLS), highlighting its transformation from a low-margin Electronics Manufacturing Services provider to a high-margin Connectivity & Cloud Solutions partner, especially in AI data centers. The strategy involves selling deep out-of-the-money put options to acquire the high-growth company at a discount while generating immediate premium income. The thesis points to the company's strong balance sheet, free cash flow, and integral role in the AI Capex supercycle as key drivers for future growth and stability.

title: Corning, Meta agree on $6 billion deal to support data center buildout
summary: Corning Inc. and Meta Platforms have announced a multiyear deal worth up to $6 billion to accelerate the buildout of advanced data centers in the United States, supporting Meta's AI ambitions. Corning will expand its optical cable manufacturing facility in Hickory, North Carolina, and increase its employment in the state by 15 to 20 percent. This partnership aims to strengthen domestic supply chains and utilize U.S. innovation for critical data center infrastructure.

title: Eli Lilly (LLY) Drives Q4 Gains as Pharma Fundamentals Shine Amid Sector Rotation
summary: Polen Capital Management's Q4 2025 investor letter highlighted Eli Lilly and Company (LLY) as a top relative contributor to their Polen Focus Growth Strategy despite the overall fund underperforming due to market volatility. Eli Lilly's stock rallied over 40% in Q4 2025, driven by strong financial results, market leadership, and a new agreement with the White House regarding GLP-1 drug pricing, which is expected to expand its addressable market. The company remains a significant holding among hedge funds, although Polen Capital Management also noted a focus on AI stocks for potentially higher, shorter-term returns.

title: Corning forecasts first-quarter sales above estimates on strong optical fiber demand
summary: Corning expects first-quarter sales to exceed estimates, driven by strong demand for its fiber-optic products, which contribute nearly 40% of its revenue. The company recently secured a multi-year deal worth up to $6 billion with Meta Platforms to supply fiber-optic cables for AI-focused data centers. Despite better-than-expected results, Corning's shares fell over 4%, as much of the positive news was already priced in following the Meta deal announcement.

title: Corning, Meta seal $6B data deal
summary: Corning Inc. and Meta have announced a long-term agreement worth up to $6 billion to accelerate the construction of Meta’s U.S. data centers. Corning will supply advanced optical fiber, cable, and connectivity products, and the deal includes a new manufacturing plant in North Carolina, which will boost Corning's workforce and sustain thousands of high-skilled jobs. The partnership highlights a significant investment in U.S. infrastructure and job creation in the tech sector.

title: Oklo (OKLO) Is Down 5.2% After Meta Reactor Deal And BofA Upgrade Has The Bull Case Changed?
summary: Oklo (OKLO) recently secured a significant upfront payment of US$25 million from Meta Platforms for an advanced nuclear energy campus, alongside a Buy rating upgrade from Bank of America and anticipated isotope revenue. These developments, coupled with growing public and investor interest in nuclear energy, strengthen Oklo's position in clean power and data centers. However, the company faces ongoing challenges such as price volatility, capital raises, and dilution risk, indicating that execution and regulatory progress remain critical for its investment narrative despite positive recent news.

title: Texas Capital initiates NANO Nuclear Energy stock with Buy rating
summary: Texas Capital Securities initiated coverage on NANO Nuclear Energy (NASDAQ:NNE) with a Buy rating and a $49.00 price target, citing the company's KRONOS MMR reactor and its vertical integration strategy as competitive advantages. Despite being currently unprofitable, NANO is seen as a potential leader in the advanced nuclear power industry, developing multiple subsidiaries across the supply chain. Recent company activities include exploring space applications for its microreactors, signing an MOU with South Korea's DS Dansuk Co., Ltd., and successfully dismissing securities class action lawsuits.

title: Corning plans massive Hickory expansion after $6 billion deal with Meta
summary: Corning plans a significant expansion of its optical cable manufacturing facility in Hickory, North Carolina, following a $6 billion deal to supply fiber-optic cable to Meta Platforms for its AI data centers. This expansion is expected to increase Corning's employment in the state by 15-20% and make the Hickory plant the largest fiber-optic facility globally. The partnership highlights a strengthened domestic supply chain for critical technologies powering next-generation data centers in the U.S.

title: Nomura Expects NetEase (NTES.US) 4Q25 Total Rev. to Hike 4% YoY, Below Mkt Consensus; Rating Kept at Buy
summary: Nomura forecasts NetEase (NTES.US) to report a 4% year-over-year increase in total revenue for 4Q25, reaching RMB27.7 billion, which is 4% below market consensus. The report also projects online game revenue for the same period to be RMB21.7 billion, showing a 5.8% YoY growth but a 5% QoQ decline. Despite these figures, Nomura maintains a "Buy" rating for NetEase's US stock with a target price of US$160.

title: Morgan Stanley: Corning (GLW.US) Secures $6 Billion Mega Order from Meta (META.US), Set to Become a Strong Growth Driver for Optical Communications Business
summary: Corning (GLW.US) has secured a significant $6 billion fiber supply agreement with Meta (META.US) to provide optical fiber products for Meta's data centers until 2030. Morgan Stanley believes this deal will substantially boost Corning's optical communications business, which currently accounts for 40% of its revenue, and could lead to an upward revision of its "Project Springboard" growth targets. The announcement caused Corning's stock price to surge over 16%.

title: Vistra completes $2.25 billion private offering of senior secured notes
summary: Vistra Operations Company LLC, a subsidiary of Vistra Corp. (NYSE:VST), has successfully completed a private offering of $2.25 billion in senior secured notes to finance its acquisition of Cogentrix Energy and for general corporate purposes. The offering includes $1 billion in 4.700% notes due 2031 and $1.25 billion in 5.350% notes due 2036. These notes are secured by first-priority security interests and guaranteed by Vistra subsidiaries.

title: Texas Capital Securities initiates Buy rating on Oklo stock with $138 target
summary: Texas Capital Securities has initiated coverage on Oklo (NYSE:OKLO) with a Buy rating and a $138 price target, citing the company's advanced Aurora reactor technology as a key investment vehicle in the nuclear sector. Despite being unprofitable currently, Oklo is highlighted for its walk-away safety features, high-efficiency power generation, and potential to use spent nuclear fuel. Recent developments, including a binding agreement with Meta and an agreement with the U.S. Department of Energy, further underscore its growth in the nuclear energy sector.

title: Corning: Meta Deal Greatly Expands Our Fiber Growth Expectations
summary: Corning and Meta Platforms have signed a long-term supply agreement for optical fiber cable, projected to reach up to $6 billion in sales by 2030, leading Morningstar to significantly raise its fair value estimate for Corning stock. This deal is expected to materially increase Corning's fiber growth expectations, with a new forecast of $10 billion in new annual revenue by 2030, compared to 2025. Despite the positive outlook, Morningstar has increased Corning's Uncertainty Rating to High due to AI spending risks, noting that the stock appears modestly overvalued given its recent performance.

title: Corning Inc./Meta Reach $6B Data Center Deal
summary: Corning Inc. and Meta (Facebook/Instagram's parent company) have announced a $6 billion multi-year deal to accelerate the construction of Meta's US Data Centers. Corning will supply Meta with advanced optical fiber, cable, and connectivity solutions. This partnership will expand Corning's manufacturing facilities in North Carolina, create jobs, and strengthen domestic supply chains for high-tech data center infrastructure.

title: Allstate Corp Buys 74,596 Shares of Meta Platforms, Inc. $META
summary: Allstate Corp significantly increased its stake in Meta Platforms, acquiring an additional 74,596 shares in Q3, bringing its total holding to 78,979 shares valued at approximately $58.0 million. This makes Meta 1.3% of Allstate's portfolio and its 16th largest holding. While Meta recently beat earnings expectations and analysts have a "Moderate Buy" consensus with an average target of $822, the stock faces potential volatility from upcoming earnings, legal challenges, and high capital expenditure.

title: Final Trades: AbbVie, SLB, Amphenol and the IYH
summary: The article features the "Halftime Report" segment where the Investment Committee provides their top stock picks for the second half of the year. The recommended stocks include AbbVie, SLB, Amphenol, and the IYH. The content also features several other unrelated video clips on various business and economic topics.

title: How 2026 AI Spending Forecasts Could Reshape Big Tech Stock Performance
summary: This article discusses how capital expenditure projections for AI spending by hyperscalers like Microsoft, Meta, Alphabet, and Amazon will be crucial for their stock performance in 2026. While financial results for the past quarter might meet expectations, the market's focus will primarily be on the future capex guidance for AI development. Analyst David Sekera suggests that if these spending forecasts do not continue to increase, investors in AI stocks, many of which are already considered overvalued, could face disappointment.
authors: David Sekera, CFA, Susan Dziubinski, Jess Bebel

title: Corning Stock Jumps 16% on Deal With Meta. Glass Maker Is an AI Darling.
summary: Corning's stock soared 16% to become the top performer in the S&P 500 after announcing a multiyear deal with Meta Platforms. The agreement, valued at up to $6 billion, involves Corning's glass products for Meta's data center infrastructure. This positions Corning as a key player in the AI industry's data center expansion.

title: Corning Stock Hits Record High on Meta Platforms Deal
summary: Corning Inc. (NYSE:GLW) shares surged by 16.7% to a record high of $110.80 after Meta Platforms signed a multiyear fiber-optic supply deal worth up to $6 billion. This deal will support Meta's U.S. AI data-center expansion, with Corning providing optical fiber, cable, and connectivity hardware and increasing manufacturing capacity. The stock's performance marks its best daily percentage gain since April 2004, and its options are experiencing high trading volume.

title: Corning Stock Jumps on $6 Billion Deal With Meta. The Glass Maker Is an AI Darling.
summary: Corning's stock saw a significant increase following the announcement of a multiyear agreement valued at up to $6 billion with Meta Platforms. This deal focuses on Corning's role in helping Meta construct data centers. The article highlights Corning's growing importance in the AI sector due to such partnerships.

title: Meta signs deal to pay Corning up to $6 billion for fiber-optic cables, CNBC reports
summary: Meta Platforms has reportedly signed a deal with Corning worth up to $6 billion through 2030 for fiber-optic cables to support its AI data centers. Corning expects AI hyperscalers like Meta, Amazon, Alphabet, and Microsoft to be its primary customers next year, driving significant growth and prompting an expansion of its cable factory in North Carolina. This agreement underscores Meta's aggressive investment in AI infrastructure despite recent challenges with its AI models.

title: Y Intercept Hong Kong Ltd Boosts Stake in Tenaris S.A. $TS
summary: Y Intercept Hong Kong Ltd significantly increased its stake in Tenaris S.A. (NYSE:TS) by 1,183.9% in Q3, now holding 84,686 shares valued at $3.03 million. Other institutional investors also adjusted their positions in the company, which topped its Q3 earnings and revenue expectations. Analyst sentiment for Tenaris is mixed, with a consensus "Hold" rating and an average price target of $42.72.

title: NYSE Content Advisory: Pre-Market update + Block Exceeds $200 Billion in Credit Provided to Its Users
summary: The NYSE provided a pre-market update on January 27, 2026, noting that U.S. equities are higher as earnings season progresses, with Boeing and Northrop Grumman reporting and Apple and Meta expected later in the week. Additionally, Block announced it has extended over $200 billion in credit to its users through Cash App Borrow, Afterpay, and Square Loans, with further discussion anticipated on NYSE Live. IAB CEO David Cohen also joined from the NYSE floor to mark the group's 30th anniversary.

title: $5.2T social shopping market: Amaze backs SoCom 2026 creator summit
summary: Amaze (AMZE) announced its sponsorship of the second annual SoCom Conference, the first dedicated social commerce conference, set to take place in Venice Beach on February 26, 2026. This sponsorship highlights Amaze's commitment to creator-led retail, supporting the rapidly growing social commerce market projected to reach $5.2 trillion by 2030. As part of the event, Amaze will host a private Creator Dinner and a post-conference mixer to foster connections and collaboration among creators, brands, and platform leaders.

title: Corning's deal with Meta should boost optical business: Morgan Stanley (GLW:NYSE)
summary: Morgan Stanley believes Corning's new $6 billion agreement with Meta to provide optical fiber for its data centers will significantly enhance Corning's optical business. Following the announcement of the deal, Corning's shares experienced a surge of over 16%. This news comes ahead of Corning's fourth-quarter earnings report.

title: Inside Meta's up to $6B Corning deal to wire US AI data centers
summary: Corning Incorporated and Meta Platforms, Inc. have announced a multiyear agreement worth up to $6 billion to support Meta's AI data center buildout in the United States. Corning will supply advanced optical fiber, cable, and connectivity solutions and will expand its manufacturing capabilities in North Carolina. This collaboration aims to strengthen domestic supply chains, create skilled U.S. jobs, and ensure the development of advanced data centers using American innovation.

title: Corning and Meta Announce Multiyear, up to $6 Billion Agreement to Accelerate US Data Center Buildout
summary: Corning Incorporated and Meta Platforms, Inc. have announced a multiyear agreement worth up to $6 billion to expedite the construction of advanced data centers in the United States, supporting Meta's AI ambitions. Corning will supply optical fiber, cable, and connectivity solutions, expanding its manufacturing capabilities in North Carolina with Meta as an anchor customer. This partnership aims to strengthen domestic supply chains, create skilled jobs, and reinforce the U.S. lead in AI infrastructure.

title: Lawsuit Claims Meta Can See WhatsApp Chats in Breach of Privacy
summary: An international group of plaintiffs has sued Meta Platforms, Inc., alleging that the company falsely claims the privacy and security of its WhatsApp chat service. The lawsuit focuses on Meta's assertion of "end-to-end" encryption, which implies that only the sender and recipient can access messages, not Meta itself. The plaintiffs contend that Meta's actions constitute a breach of privacy.

title: Oklo Meta Nuclear Deal Puts Ohio Data Center Power In Focus

This partnership highlights commercial interest and policy support for advanced nuclear power, representing a significant step for Oklo toward commercial deployment. The project is multi-phase and its success will depend on regulatory progress, funding, and further customer commitments, while Oklo currently reports no revenue and a significant loss.

title: IBM stock price dips into the weekend as investors brace for Jan. 28 earnings

Despite the cuts, Autodesk's CEO clarified that AI is not displacing workers and the company aims to maintain its human-centric approach to technology.

title: AI set to boost cloud spending — again: S&P Global

This substantial investment comes as enterprises wait for their own AI investments to yield significant returns, with nearly eight in 10 executives not expecting substantial revenue contributions from AI until 2030. Despite the slow return, enterprise IT budgets are expected to continue increasing their AI investments, driving global IT spend past $6 trillion in 2026.

title: eBay bans AI agents from shopping, but hints at future approved bots
summary: eBay is updating its user agreement to explicitly ban AI agents and chatbots from making purchases on its platform, effective February 20, 2026. This move aims to prevent "agentic shopping" by bots competing with human users, although eBay hints it may permit authorized AI agents in the future. The e-commerce giant is also experimenting with its own agentic shopping experiences amidst broader industry trends of AI integration in retail.

title: Microsoft More Than Double Carbon Removal Deals to 45 Million Tonnes in 2025
summary: Microsoft has significantly increased its carbon removal efforts, contracting 45 million metric tonnes of carbon dioxide removal in 2025, more than double the volume from 2024. This rapid expansion is a crucial part of the company's strategy to achieve carbon negativity by 2030, balancing emissions from its growing data centers and AI computing. Microsoft prioritizes high-quality, long-term removal methods and plays a leading role in anchoring the nascent carbon removal market.

The company's valuation is extreme, requiring a rapid ramp-up to multi-hundred-million-dollar revenues despite currently having zero sales and ongoing high R&D expenditures.

title: Alibaba and Regencell among market cap stock movers on Thursday By Investing.com
summary: Thursday saw significant stock movements, with Alibaba and Regencell Bioscience Holdings experiencing rallies, while Abbott Laboratories saw a decline. The article highlights major stock movers across mega-cap, large-cap, mid-cap, and small-cap categories, attributing changes to various news triggers and financial reports. Notable updates include regulatory approvals, earnings results, and strategic acquisitions impacting company valuations.

title: Array Technologies stock hits 52-week high at 10.48 USD

(VMI) stock reached an all-time high of $448.09, reflecting a 31.46% increase over the past year and a 26.07% return in the last six months, despite current valuations suggesting it may be trading above its Fair Value. summary: Jefferies Financial Group has reiterated a "buy" rating for Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META), setting a $910.00 price target that suggests a 48.46% upside. Despite some insider selling, analyst downgrades, and regulatory concerns, the company maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating among analysts.

title: Vicor Corporation stock hits all-time high at 165.55 USD
summary: Vicor Corporation (VICR) stock has reached an all-time high of $165.55, representing a 187.94% increase over the past year and a 258.58% return in the last six months. Although the stock appears overvalued with an RSI suggesting overbought conditions, its strong fundamentals and significant cash reserves are driving investor confidence.

title: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company Ltd. $TSM Shares Sold by Locust Wood Capital Advisers LLC
summary: Locust Wood Capital Advisers LLC reduced its stake in Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSM) by 24.3%, selling 267,595 shares. title: Meta Platforms to Double Production For Meta Glasses While TD Cowen Lifts PT From $810 to $820
summary: TD Cowen has raised its price target for Meta Platforms, Inc. (NASDAQ: META) from $810 to $820, maintaining a Buy rating, based on an advertising buyer survey predicting Meta's social media platforms will increase their global digital advertising share to 34% by 2030. Concurrently, Meta Platforms and EssilorLuxottica are discussing doubling the production capacity for Meta smart glasses to 20 million units or more annually by the end of 2026 due to high demand. The companies are also considering increasing capacity to over 30 million units if demand warrants it.

title: Raymond James upgrades this ‘Magnificent Seven’ titan as AI-driven growth accelerates
summary: Raymond James has upgraded Alphabet (GOOG) to a strong buy rating from outperform, raising its price target to $400 from $350, suggesting a 22% upside. This upgrade is driven by a reassessment of Google Search and Cloud, leading to materially higher 2026 and 2027 revenue estimates based on Alphabet's accelerating AI investments. Analyst Josh Beck believes the company is entering a cycle of improving AI narrative and upward revisions, positioning it as a top AI acceleration story.

title: Vest Financial LLC Purchases 57,723 Shares of AT&T Inc. $T

(NYSE:T) by 36.9% in the third quarter, acquiring an additional 57,723 shares, bringing their total holdings to 214,256 shares valued at approximately $6.05 million. title: Pinnacle Financial Partners Inc Buys 1,539 Shares of Broadcom Inc. $AVGO
summary: Pinnacle Financial Partners Inc increased its stake in Broadcom (AVGO) by 3.0% in Q3, acquiring an additional 1,539 shares to hold a total of 53,093 shares valued at approximately $17.5 million. title: Gerber LLC Lowers Stock Holdings in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Gerber LLC significantly reduced its stock holdings in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG) by 63.6% in the third quarter, now owning 2,165 shares valued at $527,000. title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOG Shares Sold by Walter Public Investments Inc.
summary: Walter Public Investments Inc. has reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. ($GOOG) by 24.9% during the 3rd quarter, now holding 119,838 shares valued at $29.19 million. Analyst ratings generally remain positive, with a consensus "Buy" and an average price target of $321.97 for the company.

title: Utility 2.0: The Deep-Dive on Vistra Corp’s (VST) AI-Powered Transformation
summary: Vistra Corp. (VST) has transformed into a "Utility 2.0" powerhouse, leveraging AI and a significant nuclear fleet to become a key infrastructure partner for tech companies like Meta Platforms. The company has a strong financial performance, benefiting from strategic acquisitions and a integrated business model. Despite its success, Vistra faces challenges including operational risks with aging nuclear assets and regulatory scrutiny, but also has opportunities for further expansion in tech power purchase agreements and nuclear technology.

title: Deroy & Devereaux Private Investment Counsel Inc. Trims Stake in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Deroy & Devereaux Private Investment Counsel Inc. reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG) by 2.9% in the third quarter, selling 3,819 shares and now owning 129,911 shares valued at $31.64 million, making it 1.6% of their portfolio. title: Eagle Global Advisors LLC Cuts Holdings in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Eagle Global Advisors LLC reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. by 20.5% in the third quarter of 2025, selling 44,085 shares, yet Alphabet remains its 17th largest holding. However, insider selling and broader market volatility could temper near-term sentiment for the tech giant.

title: Clarity Wealth Advisors LLC Acquires 2,701 Shares of Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL
summary: Clarity Wealth Advisors LLC increased its stake in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) by 5.1% in Q3, acquiring an additional 2,701 shares, bringing its total holdings to 55,577 shares valued at approximately $13.51 million. Alphabet now constitutes 3.0% of Clarity Wealth Advisors LLC's portfolio and is its ninth-largest holding. Wall Street analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for Alphabet with an average price target of $330.94, even as insiders have recently been net sellers of the stock.

title: Constellation Energy Signs 20-Year Contract, Continues to Dominate U.S. Nuclear Market
summary: Constellation Energy has solidified its position as the leading electricity producer in the U.S. by signing a 20-year agreement with Meta Platforms for its Clinton Clean Energy Center, starting in 2027. This move, alongside its acquisition of Calpine, highlights its significant market dominance in the nuclear energy sector. Wall Street analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for CEG, forecasting a potential rise in stock price over the next 12 months, despite some recent downgrades impacting price targets.

title: Pike County nuclear site experiences cleanup, new development
summary: Oklo Inc. and Meta Platforms, Inc. are partnering to develop a 1.2 GW nuclear power campus on the former Portsmouth Gaseous Diffusion Plant site in Pike County, Ohio, to support Meta's data centers. The project aims to bring new energy infrastructure and thousands of jobs to the community, with the first phase expected by 2030 and full capacity by 2034. Community safety concerns regarding nuclear production and waste management are being addressed by Oklo, Meta, and the Southern Ohio Diversification Initiative, ensuring compliance with regulatory bodies.

title: Gene Munster Mostly Agrees With Leading Apple Analyst About Road Ahead For Apple In Next 8 Months: 'You Can Take This To The Bank'
summary: Gene Munster of Deepwater Asset Management largely agrees with Bloomberg's Mark Gurman regarding Apple's potential stock boost in the next eight months, citing two upcoming Siri updates as key catalysts. The first update, expected with iOS 26.4, will enhance web search and on-screen content analysis, while a more significant update in iOS 27 and macOS 27 will transform Siri into a full chatbot, positioning Apple more competitively in the AI market. This development comes as Apple has lagged behind rivals like Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft in AI investment and recently partnered with Google for its AI features.

title: Sage Geosystems Raises Over $97 Million To Deploy World’s First Commercial Pressure Geothermal Power Generation Facility
summary: Sage Geosystems has secured over $97 million in Series B funding, led by Ormat Technologies and Carbon Direct Capital, to develop its first commercial Pressure Geothermal power generation facility. This innovative technology extracts heat from hot dry rock to provide reliable, carbon-free power and long-duration energy storage. The first facility will be deployed at an existing Ormat power plant, aiming to address the increasing demand for firm power, including for AI data centers.

title: Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ:SMCI) Trading 2.6% Higher - Time to Buy?
summary: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) saw its stock price rise 2.6% to $32.24 on heavy volume, driven by AI demand, an $11B+ backlog, a new $2B credit facility, and potential short-squeeze activity. Despite positive sentiment from some analysts highlighting its undervaluation and growth avenues, the company faces skepticism due to a recent earnings miss, compressed margins, competition, and analyst downgrades leading to a consensus "Hold" rating with an average target price of $46.19. Institutional investors hold a significant portion of the stock.

title: Google stock price jumps after tariff scare cools — here’s what’s next for Alphabet Class C (GOOG)
summary: Alphabet Class C (GOOG) stock climbed 1.9% in after-hours trading after a U.S. tariff threat related to Greenland talks eased. The market rally also saw gains for Nvidia and Meta Platforms, while Microsoft slipped. Investors are now looking beyond policy headlines to company earnings, with Alphabet's Q4 and full-year 2025 results due on February 4th, where advertising revenue, Google Cloud performance, and AI spending will be key focuses.

title: Oklo Inc. Partners with Meta on Nuclear Energy, Price Target Raised to $127
