summary: Oklo Inc. has partnered with Meta on a multi-phase agreement to develop a 1.2 GW advanced nuclear campus, backed by a $25 million prepayment from Meta. This partnership, coupled with strong governmental support for nuclear energy, has led Bank of America to upgrade Oklo's stock from Neutral to Buy, raising the price target from $111 to $127. BofA also projects a significant increase in Oklo's 2036 revenue and deployed capacity, reflecting optimistic growth potential in the nuclear sector.

title: Better AI Chip Stock: Nvidia vs. Navitas Semiconductor
summary: This article compares Nvidia and Navitas Semiconductor as investment opportunities in the AI chip market. While Nvidia dominates the data center GPU space with strong growth projections and a reasonable valuation, Navitas, despite a significant deal with Nvidia for its power chips, faces near-term challenges and has a much higher valuation relative to its projected sales and profitability. The author concludes that Nvidia is the better buy currently due to its market leadership, faster growth, wider moat, and more attractive valuation.

title: Nebius Group Chases Hyperscaler AI Growth As Policy Risks Build
summary: Nebius Group has secured significant pre-sold AI infrastructure contracts with major customers like Meta and Microsoft, driving its rapid global expansion. While these deals provide strong revenue visibility, the company faces growing policy risks, including potential scrutiny over electricity costs, tariffs, and control deficiencies in financial audits. Investors are weighing the benefits of its ambitious growth strategy against these emerging policy and execution challenges.

title: Billionaire Chamath Palihapitiya Says This Is the Best Artificial Intelligence (AI) Investment for 2026 (Hint: It's Not Even a Stock)
summary: Billionaire venture capitalist Chamath Palihapitiya believes copper, not a stock or startup, will be the best Artificial Intelligence (AI) investment for 2026. He argues that the increasing power demands of AI data centers will make copper, a critical conductive material, an invaluable and "parabolic" asset. Investors can gain exposure to copper through mining stocks like Freeport-McMoRan and Southern Copper, or through ETFs such as the iShares Copper and Metals Mining ETF or the United States Copper Index Fund.

title: GOOG stock rises as Greenland tariff jitters ease — what to watch before Alphabet earnings
summary: Alphabet's Class C shares (GOOG) rose 1% as market jitters over Greenland tariffs eased, despite previous threats from President Trump. The focus now shifts to Alphabet's upcoming Q4 and full-year earnings report on February 4th, which will provide crucial insights into advertising and cloud performance for 2026. The article highlights that while geopolitical factors and regulatory concerns continue to influence investor sentiment, the earnings report will be the next major catalyst for GOOG stock.

title: Dave Inc. Appoints Nima Khajehnouri to Board of Directors; Announces Board Leadership Transitions
summary: Dave Inc. (Nasdaq: DAVE) has appointed Nima Khajehnouri, a distinguished leader in AI and data engineering, to its Board of Directors and Audit Committee. This appointment follows a strategic search to enhance the company's technical leadership, with Imran Khan stepping down from the board. Additionally, Mike Pope has been named Lead Independent Director and Andrea Mitchell will chair the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, reflecting planned board evolution and strengthening governance.

title: Hilltop Holdings stock hits 52-week high at 36.24 USD
summary: Hilltop Holdings Inc. (HTH) stock reached a new 52-week high of $36.24, reflecting a strong performance with a 24.27% increase over the last year. This milestone is supported by impressive Q3 2025 earnings, which surpassed analyst expectations, and strategic developments such as an amendment to an executive's employment agreement. The achievement highlights investor confidence, growth, and resilience in the financial market.

title: Analysts Offer Insights on Communication Services Companies: Trade Desk (TTD), Meta Platforms (META) and Take-Two (TTWO)
summary: Analysts have provided new ratings for several Communication Services companies, including Trade Desk (TTD), Meta Platforms (META), and Take-Two (TTWO). Bank of America Securities reiterated a Sell rating on Trade Desk, while UBS maintained a Buy rating on Meta Platforms, and Bank of America Securities also maintained a Buy rating on Take-Two. The report details analyst consensus and price targets for each company.

title: The Rise of Corporate Prediction Markets: Betting on Meta AI, Amazon Layoffs, and Starbucks Strategy
summary: Corporate prediction markets, utilizing platforms like Polymarket and Kalshi, have grown significantly, drawing institutional and retail traders to bet on events concerning major companies such as Meta, Amazon, and Starbucks. These markets are increasingly seen as "truth engines," providing real-time probabilities for everything from tech releases to internal corporate decisions, often ahead of official announcements. Their rise is fueled by the search for alpha, the institutionalization of collective intelligence, and a stable regulatory framework, making them a crucial tool for price discovery and an influential factor in corporate perception.

title: Meta Stock Lost Ground Amid Rising AI Capital Expenditure. Is It a Buy?
summary: Meta Platforms stock has seen a recent pullback due to investor concerns over rising capital expenditures for AI and previous experimental spending missteps, despite its core advertising business remaining healthy and showing strong growth. Morningstar analysts view the stock as underappreciated, highlighting the potential for AI to transform digital advertising for small and midsize businesses and believing Meta will ultimately succeed in its AI endeavors. The company's recent acquisition of Manus AI is seen as a strategic move to accelerate its AI roadmap and foster independence, reinforcing Morningstar's long-term confidence despite near-term margin pressure from AI investments.

title: NextEra Energy Taps AI Power Demand With Google And Meta Nuclear Deals
summary: NextEra Energy has secured significant long-term power purchase agreements with Google and Meta Platforms to supply clean electricity for AI data centers and support nuclear energy projects. These unprecedented deals, including a 25-year commitment for the Duane Arnold nuclear restart, are expected to provide stable, multi-decade cash flows and reinforce NextEra Energy's position as a major clean energy provider. While these agreements offer potential for increased revenue and address future electricity demand, investors should monitor the company's debt coverage and dividend sustainability given the large capital expenditures involved.

title: Telefônica Brasil's (BVMF:VIVT3) three-year earnings growth trails the 25% YoY shareholder returns
summary: Telefônica Brasil (BVMF:VIVT3) has seen its share price rise 68% over three years, with a total shareholder return (TSR) of 94% over the same period due to dividends. However, its earnings per share (EPS) grew at a slower rate of 4.2% annually over three years, indicating increased market optimism without commensurate fundamental growth. The company's recent one-year TSR of 44% suggests improved performance.

title: Stocks To Watch: Bruker Sees Relative Strength Rating Rise To 82
summary: Bruker (BRKR) has seen its Relative Strength (RS) Rating increase from 78 to 82, reaching a key benchmark for market leadership. The RS Rating is a proprietary metric that tracks a stock's price performance over 52 weeks, with scores of 80 or higher indicating strong leadership. This marks another instance of Bruker achieving an elevated RS Rating.

title: Stocks With Rising Relative Price Strength: Modine Manufacturing
summary: Modine Manufacturing (MOD) recently saw its Relative Strength (RS) Rating increase from 78 to 82. This enhancement signifies strengthening market leadership, as the RS Rating gauges a stock's 52-week price performance against other stocks in the database. This upgrade indicates positive technical momentum for the company.

title: Progyny Shows Rising Price Performance With Jump To 82 RS Rating
summary: Progyny (PGNY) has seen its Relative Strength Rating increase from 77 to 82, surpassing the important 80 threshold for strong technical performance. This upgrade indicates improving price action over the last 52 weeks. The stock has been showing a trend of rising technical strength, as indicated by several recent RS rating improvements.

title: How the Next Ethereum Could Help You Retire a Millionaire
summary: This article discusses how investors can potentially become millionaires by identifying the "next Ethereum" rather than relying on Ethereum itself for 1,000-fold returns. The author outlines criteria for selecting potential millionaire-maker cryptocurrencies, focusing on Layer 1 blockchain networks with a market cap of around $1 billion and a low per-unit price, and identifies Aptos as a strong candidate. The piece encourages risk-tolerant investors to seek out these emerging challengers for significant long-term gains.

title: Bubbles, barbells, and inflation risk: November 2025 remix
summary: T. Rowe Price's Asset Allocation Committee is maintaining a neutral risk stance but adjusting its allocation mix due to questions surrounding AI spending and high market concentration. They are shifting capital from core large-cap equities into a barbell strategy of U.S. value and growth, with a modest tilt towards small-cap growth, anticipating a broadening of equity market performance. The committee also favors inflation-linked bonds and a short duration posture to manage asymmetric upside risks to inflation.

title: Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG) Stock Price Down 2.5% - Here's What Happened
summary: Alphabet's (NASDAQ:GOOG) stock fell 2.5% to $322.16 on Tuesday with higher-than-average trading volume. Key drivers include increasing demand for its Gemini AI models and recent positive analyst price target revisions, despite a broader tech selloff and significant insider selling. The company reported strong Q3 earnings and issued a quarterly dividend.

title: Why Advanced Micro Devices Shares Are Climbing Today
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock rose on news that Meta Platforms is reportedly set to purchase AMD's MI455X AI accelerators. This move suggests Meta may reduce its in-house chip development in favor of AMD's hardware, reinforcing a strong partnership between the two companies. AMD, which saw Meta as its top AI GPU customer in 2025, is experiencing increased demand and significant stock performance, with shares up nearly 7% year-to-date and 90% over the last 12 months.

title: TTD vs. MGNI: Which Ad-Tech Stock Is the Smarter Pick Now?
summary: This article compares two ad-tech stocks, The Trade Desk (TTD) and Magnite (MGNI), highlighting their roles in the digital advertising ecosystem. It discusses their respective strengths, challenges, and financial performance, concluding that MGNI is currently a smarter pick based on Zacks Rank, despite both operating in a growing market facing macroeconomic and competitive pressures.

title: Netflix Results to Shine Light on Fundamentals Amid Warner Fight
summary: Netflix is set to report earnings, with investors focused on the company's fundamentals amidst its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. The streaming giant's past earnings report led to a significant stock selloff due to concerns about slowing subscriber growth. While some investors are wary of the Warner Bros. deal's cost and risks, others see the current stock dip as a buying opportunity, emphasizing Netflix's core business strength and potential for future growth.

title: Where Will Constellation Energy Be in 3 Years?
summary: Constellation Energy is set to significantly expand and diversify its operations in the next three years, particularly with the acquisition of Calpine, which will make it a leader in gas power production. The company is also capitalizing on the resurgence of nuclear energy by securing new power purchase agreements with tech giants like Microsoft and Meta Platforms for its nuclear plants. These strategic moves are expected to result in a much larger and more profitable Constellation Energy by 2029, driven by increasing power demand from AI data centers and electrification.

title: First Horizon Corp Invests $17.34 Million in Meta Platforms, Inc. $META
summary: First Horizon Corp has acquired a new stake of 23,610 shares in Meta Platforms, Inc., valued at approximately $17.34 million in the third quarter. This investment comes amidst significant insider selling, with CTO Andrew Bosworth and COO Javier Olivan disposing of shares worth millions. Despite insider sales, Meta Platforms reported strong Q3 earnings, surpassing analyst expectations, and maintains a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating among analysts with a target price of $822.96.

title: Oklo (OKLO) Is Down 7.4% After Meta-Backed Nuclear Campus And DOE Isotope Deal News
summary: Oklo Inc.'s stock experienced a 7.4% drop despite recent announcements of a Meta Platforms-backed nuclear power campus in Ohio and a Department of Energy (DOE) isotope deal. The Meta deal aims to establish a 1.2 GW Aurora nuclear power campus, with Meta prepaying for power and funding development. Concurrently, Oklo's subsidiary, Atomic Alchemy, secured a DOE agreement to develop a radioisotope pilot plant, focusing on domestic production of critical medical and research isotopes. The article highlights that while these deals strengthen Oklo's investment narrative, the company is still pre-revenue, unproven, and faces significant regulatory and capital execution risks, leading to a wide spread in fair value estimates among investors.

title: Meta, Google, Snap veteran joins Dave board as neobank leans on AI
summary: Dave Inc. has appointed Nima Khajehnouri, an experienced engineering leader from Meta, Google, and Snap, to its Board of Directors, effective January 20, 2026. Khajehnouri will serve on the Audit Committee, bringing expertise in AI and data engineering to strengthen Dave's technical leadership. This appointment coincides with Imran Khan stepping down and other board leadership changes, including Mike Pope becoming Lead Independent Director.

title: Artificial Intelligence Needs Nuclear Energy, and Oklo Could Deliver It
summary: The article discusses how the massive power demands of artificial intelligence (AI) necessitate new energy solutions, highlighting advanced nuclear company Oklo (NYSE: OKLO) as a potential provider. Oklo is developing small, fast-spectrum nuclear reactors designed to supply continuous, on-site power for large data centers. Although Oklo faces regulatory hurdles and is not expected to generate significant revenue until 2027 at the earliest, it has strategic partnerships with major data center players like Equinix and Meta, and strong backing from investors and the U.S. government.

title: Oklo's Small Nuclear Reactors Poised to Meet AI Power Demand, Projected 945 TWh Consumption by 2030
summary: Oklo is developing small, fast-spectrum nuclear reactors to address the surging electricity demand from AI data centers, which is projected to exceed 945 TWh by 2030. The company plans to own and operate these powerhouses, selling electricity directly, and is currently advancing through regulatory approval with a target launch for its first commercial plant between late 2027 and early 2028. Despite current operating losses, Oklo is backed by significant funding and analyst upgrades, betting on a strong market for its clean energy solutions.

title: Top Wall Street analysts are confident about these three stocks for the long term
summary: This article highlights three stocks – Broadcom (AVGO), Airbnb (ABNB), and Meta Platforms (META) – that top Wall Street analysts are confident about for long-term investment. Analysts Stacy Rasgon (Broadcom) and Lloyd Walmsley (Airbnb, Meta Platforms) reiterate buy ratings, citing strong demand for AI chips, reaccelerating room nights growth in travel, and potential for revenue upside and AI monetization, respectively. The article emphasizes the analysts' high rankings based on past performance on TipRanks.

title: Jim Cramer on Citigroup: “I Think It’s Just Too, Too Cheap to Ignore”
summary: Jim Cramer discussed Citigroup's recent quarter, highlighting strong revenue and earnings growth, particularly from interest income, despite a "mixed bag" performance in some areas. He noted that while the overall market reaction to bank earnings was subdued, Citigroup's transformation efforts are nearing completion, and he considers the stock "too cheap to ignore" despite its significant rally last year. Cramer expresses curiosity about the stock's future performance once its turnaround story is complete.

title: Here's What Analysts Think About Amazon.com (AMZN)
summary: Analysts are generally positive on Amazon.com (AMZN), with Raymond James, Evercore ISI, and TD Cowen maintaining "Outperform" or "Buy" ratings. Raymond James recently cut its price target slightly but expects a positive Q4 due to strong trends and AI as a primary driver. TD Cowen significantly raised its price target to $315, citing the strong growth potential of Amazon's advertising business, expecting revenues to nearly double by 2030, driven by AI tools and increased advertiser spending.

title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOG Shares Sold by Panoramic Investment Advisors LLC
summary: Panoramic Investment Advisors LLC reduced its stake in Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOG) by 18.9% in the third quarter, selling 4,340 shares but retaining 18,602 shares valued at approximately $4.53 million, representing 2.5% of their portfolio. Despite this sale, Alphabet benefits from strong AI momentum, analysts upgrading its stock, and its near-$4 trillion valuation. However, the company faces potential risks from ongoing antitrust litigation, lawsuits over AI training data, and significant insider selling, including by CEO Sundar Pichai.

title: FSR Wealth Management Ltd. Purchases Shares of 94,717 AllianzIM U.S. Large Cap Buffer10 Sep ETF $SEPT
summary: FSR Wealth Management Ltd. has acquired a new position in the AllianzIM U.S. Large Cap Buffer10 Sep ETF (NYSEARCA:SEPT), purchasing 94,717 shares valued at approximately $3.265 million. This investment now represents 3.9% of FSR Wealth Management Ltd.’s total holdings. Other institutional investors like AdvisorNet Financial Inc., Focus Financial Network Inc., and LifeWealth Investments LLC have also recently invested in SEPT.

title: Takeda’s deal grew 43% yearly after $63B acquisition
summary: A new analysis by Wave Connect identifies mega-deals that delivered extraordinary revenue growth, challenging conventional wisdom about successful acquisitions. Takeda Pharmaceuticals' $63.1 billion acquisition of Shire in 2019 topped the list with a 43.2% annual growth rate, while Salesforce's Slack acquisition and InBev's Anheuser-Busch deal also showed impressive returns. The report highlights the surprising strength of traditional industries like pharmaceuticals and beverages in generating high-growth acquisitions.

title: 1 Reason Why Now Is a Great Time to Buy Vistra
summary: Vistra (NYSE: VST) is presented as a strong buy due to increasing power demand driven by AI and data centers. The company recently secured a 20-year power purchase agreement with Meta Platforms and operates diverse power generation facilities, including nuclear, natural gas, coal, solar, and battery storage. With data centers projected to consume 12% of U.S. electricity by 2028, Vistra's dispatchable generation capabilities position it well for future growth and profitability, alongside its history of offering quarterly dividends.

title: UBS Reiterates Neutral on Oklo (OKLO) After Meta Power Deal
summary: UBS analyst Jon Windham reiterated a Neutral rating on Oklo (OKLO) with a $95.00 price target following the company's clean energy partnership with Meta. The deal, which supports the development of Oklo's advanced reactor projects and involves Meta prepaying for power, is seen as strategically valuable but carries early-stage execution risks and a long development timeline. Oklo, developing advanced nuclear power plants, aims for commercial operation of the first phase by 2030 and expects construction cost data from its Aurora-INL project in 2026.

title: CoreWeave (CRVW) Stock Soars Friday: What's Driving The Action?
summary: CoreWeave (CRVW) shares gained on Friday after CEO Michael Intrator refuted claims of circular financing with Nvidia, emphasizing the company's robust capital structure and risk mitigation strategies. The stock also benefited from TSMC's strong AI chip earnings, which reassured investors about the sustained demand for AI infrastructure, a core component of CoreWeave's business model. Analysis indicates mixed momentum with short-term strength, as the company approaches its next earnings report with analysts split on future price targets.

title: Tanager Wealth Management LLP Has $24.45 Million Stock Holdings in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Tanager Wealth Management LLP recently reduced its stake in Alphabet Inc. by 11.6% in the third quarter, now holding 100,390 shares valued at $24.45 million, representing 2.6% of its total holdings. Despite this, Alphabet faces both positive catalysts like its $4 trillion valuation spurred by AI and challenges from insider selling and legal/regulatory risks concerning data sharing and AI training data. Alphabet recently surpassed analyst estimates with strong Q3 earnings and revenue.

title: Evergreen Capital Management LLC Boosts Stock Holdings in QUALCOMM Incorporated $QCOM
summary: Evergreen Capital Management LLC increased its stake in QUALCOMM Incorporated by 3.2% in the third quarter, holding 114,610 shares valued at approximately $19.07 million. Despite institutional investors owning 74.35% of the company, there has been notable insider selling, with corporate insiders now owning only 0.08% of the stock. QUALCOMM recently reported strong Q3 earnings, beating estimates, announced a quarterly dividend of $0.89, and has a consensus "Hold" rating with a target price of $191.28 from analysts.

title: 607,823 Shares in Hartford Total Return Bond ETF $HTRB Bought by Great Point Wealth Advisors LLC
summary: Great Point Wealth Advisors LLC has acquired a new stake of 607,823 shares, valued at approximately $20.84 million, in the Hartford Total Return Bond ETF (HTRB) during the third quarter. This investment constitutes about 3.9% of Great Point Wealth Advisors LLC's portfolio, making it their sixth largest position. Other institutional investors like Salomon & Ludwin LLC, Smartleaf Asset Management LLC, and Barnes Dennig Private Wealth Management LLC also established new positions in HTRB.

title: Sonoma Allocations LLC Makes New $1.90 Million Investment in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG
summary: Sonoma Allocations LLC has made a new investment of approximately $1.90 million in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOG), acquiring 7,552 shares. This makes Alphabet the 28th largest holding for the fund, representing 0.7% of its portfolio. The investment comes amidst significant insider selling, with top executives selling over 192,000 shares, and strong quarterly earnings where Alphabet beat expectations with $2.87 EPS and $102.35 billion in revenue.

title: QUALCOMM Incorporated $QCOM Shares Sold by First National Advisers LLC
summary: First National Advisers LLC significantly reduced its holdings in QUALCOMM (NASDAQ:QCOM) by 77.9% in Q3, selling over 28,000 shares. This comes amidst mixed analyst sentiment, with some highlighting Qualcomm's push into personal AI and wearables as growth drivers, while others point to potential modem share losses and global handset demand issues. Company insiders have also sold a considerable number of shares, totaling over $9 million in value during the last quarter.

title: A Deep Dive into the Invesco S&P 500 Momentum ETF’s Focused Strategy
summary: The Invesco S&P 500 Momentum ETF (SPMO) focuses on high-conviction equities with strong price momentum, leading to a concentrated portfolio heavily weighted in technology and growth sectors. While its strategy of aggressively weighting top momentum stocks led to outperformance against peer funds and the broader S&P 500 in 2025, this approach carries risks due to higher valuations and market trend shifts. The upcoming March rebalancing will be crucial in determining its future sector allocation.

title: Oklo’s Meta Deal De-Risks the Story—Rebound Setup Emerging
summary: Oklo's recent deal with Meta Platforms is seen as a significant de-risking factor, providing non-dilutive funding and validating their energy technology for data centers. This, combined with a new agreement with the Department of Energy for a radioisotope facility, is accelerating their path to revenue and expediting regulatory approvals. Following a late-2025 stock pullback, early 2026 activity shows firming analyst sentiment, institutional accumulation, and decreasing short interest, setting the stage for a potential stock rebound amidst several upcoming catalysts.

title: Nano Nuclear releases RFI for Loki lunar ambitions -- ANS / Nuclear Newswire
summary: Nano Nuclear has issued a Request for Information (RFI) to seek partners for developing its Loki micro modular reactor, with the goal of deploying it on the lunar surface. This initiative aligns with President Trump’s December 2025 executive order for an American return to the moon by 2028 and the establishment of a lunar outpost by 2030, a goal also supported by NASA and the Department of Energy. The RFI covers various areas from technology development to operations, indicating Nano Nuclear's openness to extensive collaboration for its space-oriented reactor.

title: Andrey Omelchak's Top Picks: Bird Construction, Trisura Group & Electrovaya
summary: Andrey Omelchak, CEO & CIO of LionGuard Capital Management, has shared his top stock picks. His current selections include Bird Construction, Trisura Group, and Electrovaya. The article highlights these companies as his current recommendations for investors.

title: Amazon vs. Oracle: Which Cloud Computing Stock is the Better Buy Now?
summary: This article compares Amazon (AMZN) and Oracle (ORCL) as cloud computing investments, highlighting Amazon's dominant AWS performance, diversified revenue, and strong growth fundamentals. While Oracle shows significant growth in cloud infrastructure and RPOs, the article points out its execution challenges, negative free cash flow, and customer concentration risk. Amazon is ultimately recommended as the superior buy due to its stronger risk-reward profile and more sustainable growth.

title: Where Will Vistra (VST) Stock Be in 1 Year?
summary: Vistra (VST) stock has seen significant growth, surging 655% over three years, driven by the increasing demand for electricity, especially from the cloud, HPC, and AI markets. The company, a major U.S. power generator, is expanding its nuclear and natural gas capacities through acquisitions and has secured a major deal to supply Meta Platforms with nuclear energy for 20 years. Analysts project continued growth, with a potential 13% rise in stock value over the next year, making it a strong contender for market-beating gains.

title: Vistra stock pops again in premarket as VST options heat up around $180
summary: Vistra stock (VST) rose again in premarket trading, following a significant jump on Thursday, driven by heavy options trading around the $180 strike price. The surge is linked to Vistra's nuclear power deals with Big Tech companies like Meta and its debt financing for the Cogentrix acquisition. Investors are closely watching if VST can maintain its position above $180 and the upcoming finalization of its $2.25 billion note sale.

title: Copperleaf Capital LLC Purchases 4,476 Shares of Oracle Corporation $ORCL
summary: Copperleaf Capital LLC significantly increased its stake in Oracle Corporation during Q3, purchasing 4,476 additional shares. Despite this institutional buying, Oracle has seen net selling from insiders, including CEO Clayton M. Magouyrk. The company faces mixed sentiment with strong RPO growth and bullish analyst outlooks, counterbalanced by bondholder lawsuits and elevated short interest.

title: Did Safehold's (SAFE) New 207-Unit LA Ground Lease Quietly Reframe Its Affordable Housing Strategy?
summary: Safehold Inc. has finalized a ground lease for a 207-unit affordable housing development in Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, marking a significant step in its expanding affordable housing strategy established in 2025. This project, expected to be completed by 2028, reinforces Safehold's focus on recurring cash flows and continuous lease origination, aligning with its investment narrative despite potential regulatory and market volatility risks. The company projects substantial revenue and earnings growth by 2028, with an estimated fair value suggesting a notable upside to its current share price.

title: Meta Pulls Back From The Metaverse—These ETFs Watch Closely
summary: Meta Platforms is reportedly planning significant job cuts in its Reality Labs division, signaling a further shift away from its metaverse strategy towards AI and wearables. This move, driven by the metaverse division's substantial losses, has caused Meta's stock to slide and impacted various communication services and broader technology ETFs with significant Meta exposure. While this retreat clouds the future for metaverse-themed ETFs, Meta's increased focus on AI could benefit AI-centric and innovation-focused funds.

title: Rep. Rick Larsen Sells Off Shares of Verisk Analytics, Inc. (NASDAQ:VRSK)
summary: Representative Rick Larsen (D-Washington) recently sold shares of Verisk Analytics, Inc. (NASDAQ:VRSK) from his IRA account on January 7, 2026, alongside other trades including purchases of Darden, Meta, and Waste Management, and sales of Mondelez and Essex. Verisk Analytics reported strong quarterly EPS results ($1.72 vs. $1.70 est.), set optimistic FY2025 EPS guidance, and maintains a "Hold" consensus analyst rating with an average target price of $278.64. The company's stock has a market cap of $30.95 billion, and institutions hold roughly 90% ownership with insiders holding about 0.46%.

title: Rep. Rick Larsen Purchases Shares of Darden Restaurants, Inc. (NYSE:DRI)
summary: Representative Rick Larsen (D-Washington) recently purchased between $1,001 and $15,000 worth of Darden Restaurants (NYSE:DRI) stock on January 7th, as disclosed in a January 14th filing. This purchase was part of several trades by Larsen on that day, including buys in Meta and Waste Management, and sales of Verisk, Mondelez, and Essex. Darden Restaurants recently announced a quarterly dividend of $1.50 per share, and analysts currently hold a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for the company.

title: Meta Platforms, Inc. (META) – TD Cowen Upgrades Valuation Forecast
summary: TD Cowen has raised its 12-month price target for Meta Platforms (META) to $820 from $810, citing the company's strong advertising business and effective cost management. The upgrade is driven by improved ad demand, enhanced by Meta's AI-driven targeting tools, and growing confidence in the company's operating leverage. TD Cowen sees Meta's AI-driven monetization across its platforms as a key factor for margin expansion and sustained earnings.

title: Turn Therapeutics advances atopic dermatitis trial, expands pipeline
summary: Turn Therapeutics announced that its Phase 2 trial for GX-03, targeting moderate-to-severe atopic dermatitis, is on schedule with results expected in the first half of 2026. The company has also expanded its pipeline with an intranasal influenza vaccine candidate and strengthened its balance sheet to extend its operational runway into late 2026. Additionally, the company made several strategic board and leadership appointments and entered into a global partnership with Medline.

title: Gene Munster Says Apple's Move From OpenAI's ChatGPT To Google Gemini Significantly Raises Chances Of New Siri Succeeding: 'Nice Job'
summary: Gene Munster of Deepwater Asset Management believes Apple's decision to partner with Google Gemini instead of OpenAI's ChatGPT for the new Siri significantly boosts its chances of success, calling it a "nice job" by Tim Cook. This strategic shift is seen as Apple taking a more serious approach to fix Apple Intelligence shortcomings and move beyond reliance on OpenAI. The partnership is a major catalyst for Apple's AI strategy, according to analysts, though Elon Musk has voiced concerns about Google's increased influence.

title: Warby Parker’s Gilboa sells $2.36 million in shares By Investing.com
summary: Warby Parker Co-Chief Executive Officer David Abraham Gilboa sold 80,094 shares of Class A Common Stock for $2.36 million on January 13, 2026, while also acquiring an equal number of shares through conversion of Class B stock. Following these transactions, Gilboa holds 37,247 Class A shares directly and 1,656,770 Class B shares indirectly through a family trust. The company recently announced a partnership with Google to develop AI-powered glasses, leading to increased price targets from analysts and aligning with broader industry interest in smart eyewear.

title: UBS Raises Price Target on Vistra (VST) to $233 After Meta Nuclear Power Deal
summary: UBS analyst William Appicelli raised the price target for Vistra Corp. (VST) to $233, maintaining a "Buy" rating, following Vistra's 20-year power purchase agreement with Meta Platforms Inc. The deal involves supplying 2,609 MW of carbon-free electricity from Vistra's nuclear plants, offering robust cash accretion and long-term cash flow visibility. UBS highlights that 48% of Vistra's nuclear fleet remains uncontracted, suggesting further growth potential, and emphasizes the overlooked value of Vistra’s long-term contracts despite investor concerns about margin uplift.

title: Meta Stock Rises: What's Going On Behind The Scenes?
summary: Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) shares are under observation following recent news of layoffs in its Reality Labs division, impacting approximately 1,000 employees. This strategic shift moves away from heavy reliance on virtual reality and metaverse projects, instead focusing on AI-powered wearables and mobile solutions. Despite the market uplift, Meta faces bearish indicators including trading below key moving averages and a "death cross" in December, suggesting a possible longer-term downtrend.

title: Michael Burry Bets Against Nvidia, Says'I Do Not See How That Math Works' Amid AI Chip Boom Fears
summary: Investor Michael Burry, known for predicting the 2008 housing crash, is now shorting Nvidia, arguing that the AI-driven chip boom is unsustainable. He stated that Nvidia's projected $400 billion in chip sales vastly outweighs the less than $100 billion in application layer use cases, calling the company "the purest play" on AI and dangerously reliant on hyperscaler spending. Burry also cautioned Meta about its expanding AI capacity and advocated for a massive nuclear power and grid expansion to meet the surging electricity demands from AI.

title: West Bancorporation Inc. Acquires 1,076 Shares of Meta Platforms, Inc. $META
summary: West Bancorporation Inc. significantly increased its stake in Meta Platforms, Inc. by 127% in Q3, purchasing an additional 1,076 shares. This acquisition brings their total holdings to 1,923 shares, valued at $1.412 million, making Meta their 27th largest position. The article also highlights Meta's efforts to secure baseload power for data center expansion and mentions recent institutional trading activity, analyst ratings, and insider transactions for the company.

title: Top Analyst Says AMD's 2026 Success Depends On These 3 Factors— And It Doesn't 'Need To Beat' Nvidia
summary: Shay Boloor, Chief Market Strategist at Futurum Equities, identified three critical factors for AMD's success in 2026: strong performance of their data center CPUs, the adoption of their Helios platform by major customers, and securing procurement rules that promote multi-vendor AI infrastructure instead of relying on a single supplier like Nvidia. Boloor emphasizes that AMD doesn't need to "beat" Nvidia directly but rather integrate into the default AI architecture of key clients like Microsoft and Meta. This analysis comes amidst new tariffs on high-end AI chips and AMD's ongoing efforts to challenge Nvidia's market dominance.

title: These Funds Hold the Largest Stakes in Alphabet Stock
summary: Alphabet's stock surge, driven by AI enthusiasm and the release of Gemini 3, has significantly impacted funds heavily invested in the company. The Provident Trust Strategy Fund and Fidelity OTC Portfolio hold the largest stakes, with several ESG-focused funds also appearing on the list of top holders. This performance has propelled Alphabet to become the world's second-largest company, highlighting the strong returns for funds with major allocations to its stock.

title: TASKUS ALERT: Bragar Eagel & Squire, P.C. is Investigating TaskUs, Inc. on Behalf of Long-Term Stockholders and Encourages Investors to Contact the Firm
summary: Bragar Eagel & Squire, P.C., a shareholder rights law firm, is investigating potential claims against TaskUs, Inc. on behalf of long-term stockholders. This investigation follows a class action complaint filed in 2022, alleging that TaskUs made exaggerated and inflated business claims, particularly after a Spruce Point Capital Management report in January 2022 highlighted issues with the company's financials and relationship with its largest customer. The firm encourages affected investors to contact them for more information.

title: Unpacking the Latest Options Trading Trends in Arista Networks
summary: Deep-pocketed investors have taken a largely bearish stance on Arista Networks (NYSE: ANET), with 24 extraordinary options activities observed. While 16% of these investors are bullish, 54% are bearish, primarily targeting a price range of $100.0 to $160.0 over the next three months. The article also notes Arista Networks' current trading volume and price, along with recent analyst ratings and price targets.

title: 史上最快暴富！中国人，创造了AI神话！
summary: Meta has acquired the Chinese AI startup Manus for over $2 billion, marking a significant development in the AI sector with Chinese innovation. Manus, backed by Tencent and other investors, achieved over $100 million in annual recurring revenue faster than any other startup, thanks to its AI agent technology. This acquisition highlights Meta's aggressive investment in AI, while the article also touches upon the volatile performance of China's A-share market.

title: 5 Must-Read Analyst Questions From WD-40's Q4 Earnings Call
summary: WD-40's Q4 results were met with a negative market reaction due to flat sales and a decline in GAAP profit, which management attributed to timing-related factors in its distributor network, particularly in Asia-Pacific. Despite this, CEO Steven Brass noted resilience in direct markets and emphasized that the softness was not due to a drop in end-user demand. Analysts focused on questions regarding projected second-half rebounds, the timing of Asia-Pacific market recovery, share buyback strategy, supply chain cost reductions, and the sustainability of gross margins.

title: Broadcom: Margin Concerns Are Overblown (NASDAQ:AVGO)
summary: Broadcom's stock is reiterated as a buy, driven by strong AI-fueled growth and improved fundamentals, with concerns about margins being overblown. The company reported record Q4 revenues, a surge in AI semiconductor revenue, and strong Q1 FY2026 guidance. The valuation has contracted, making the risk/reward attractive, especially with long-term AI opportunities like Meta's planned TPU adoption.

title: Guardant Health Announces Strong 2025 Preliminary Revenue Growth
summary: Guardant Health announced strong preliminary, unaudited revenue growth for 2025, with total revenue reaching approximately $981 million, a 33% increase from 2024. This growth was driven by a significant rise in oncology and screening test volumes, including a rapid expansion of its Shield colorectal cancer screening franchise. Despite top-line momentum, the company remained cash-flow negative for the year but ended with a substantial cash reserve.

title: Meta Platforms (META) Announces That Commitments to Oklo and TerraPower Help Next Generation of Developers
summary: Meta Platforms (META) announced its commitment to Oklo and TerraPower, aiming to support the development of safer, advanced nuclear reactors and accelerate nuclear technologies. This initiative involves financial backing for nuclear power plants in Ohio and Pennsylvania, anticipating job creation and energy production increases. Despite a reduced price objective from Guggenheim due to increased investment assumption, Meta's project is set to add reliable clean energy to the grid by 2035.

title: Tech Voices: DeSantis vs. AI, Tesla's FSD, smart glasses market
summary: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has called for increased regulation of AI and data centers, citing them as a threat to the U.S. economy. This statement is part of Seeking Alpha's roundup of significant announcements and remarks affecting the technology sector. The article also touches upon Tesla's Full Self-Driving (FSD) technology and the smart glasses market.

title: QCOM vs. AMD: Which Semiconductor Stock is the Smarter Buy in 2026?
summary: This article compares Qualcomm (QCOM) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) as semiconductor investment options for 2026, focusing on their competitive strengths in AI, mobile, PC, and data center markets. While AMD has shown stronger recent price performance and growth projections, Qualcomm presents a more attractive valuation and has a diversified revenue stream, particularly in the intelligent edge sector, despite competition in AI PCs and smartphones. The analysis concludes that Qualcomm currently holds a slight edge due to its valuation and VGM Score.

title: Vistra Outperforms Industry in the Past Month: How to Play the Stock?
summary: Vistra Corp. (VST) has outperformed its industry in the past month, driven by its acquisition of Cogentrix Energy and a 20-year power purchase agreement with Meta. The company's focus on expanding its clean energy capacity, strong asset base, and positive earnings estimates make it an attractive stock. However, VST is currently trading at a premium valuation, suggesting new investors might want to wait for a more favorable entry point.

title: Gelteq Limited stock jumps in premarket after CBD gel study; what’s next for GELS
summary: Gelteq Limited shares surged in premarket trading after new preclinical data showed its oral gel delivery platform increased CBD bioavailability by over 22% compared to an FDA-approved oil-based product. This finding could accelerate plans for a medicinal cannabis launch in Australia. Investors are watching to see if this premarket rally holds and what commercialization timelines the company will provide.

title: Why Is AMN Healthcare Services (AMN) Stock Soaring Today
summary: AMN Healthcare Services (AMN) stock surged 17.2% after the company presented a positive outlook and strategic growth plans at the J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference. Management highlighted leadership in healthcare talent solutions, plans for technology integration and acquisitions, and long-term demand drivers, boosting investor confidence. Despite recent volatility and some declines in specific segments, AMN's year-to-date performance is positive, though it remains below its 52-week high.

title: Microsoft Pledges To Bear Own Data Center Power Costs Amid Trump Pressure Over Surging Energy Bills
summary: Microsoft has committed to covering the power costs for its data centers to prevent local electricity bills from rising, a move made amid growing scrutiny of tech companies' environmental impact and direct pressure from former President Donald Trump. The company plans a "community-first" approach, collaborating with utilities and creating jobs, while also specifically addressing concerns about water usage and the financial burden posed by its AI infrastructure expansion. This pledge follows a contentious data center project in Michigan and reinforces Microsoft's earlier commitment to investing heavily in AI.

title: Oklo Inc. $OKLO Shares Sold by Citizens Financial Group Inc. RI
summary: Citizens Financial Group Inc. RI reduced its stake in Oklo Inc. (NYSE:OKLO) by 57.3% in Q3, selling nearly 30,000 shares, though institutional investors still collectively own about 85.03% of the company. The article notes significant insider selling, with the CEO and CFO recently offloading shares, resulting in insiders owning 18.9% of the company. Despite a Meta partnership improving long-term demand visibility, Oklo shares fell after an EPS miss and a negative outlook, with analysts holding an average "Hold" rating and a $102.13 price target.

title: Power Struggle: Why Big Tech Is Buying Nuclear Stocks
summary: The surge in AI development has shifted the bottleneck from computing power to energy, driving Big Tech companies like Meta, Microsoft, and Amazon to invest heavily in nuclear power. This has created investment opportunities in both the immediate need for uranium fuel, exemplified by Uranium Energy Corp (UEC), and the long-term infrastructure development of advanced nuclear reactors and Small Modular Reactors (SMRs) through companies like Oklo and NuScale. For more stable investments, Cameco Corporation (CCJ) offers a defensive play with long-term contracts and dividend payouts.

title: Meta’s new nuclear deals with Oklo and TerraPower: The details -- ANS / Nuclear Newswire
summary: Tech giant Meta is significantly investing in nuclear energy through new deals with TerraPower and Oklo, aiming to secure clean power for its AI operations. The partnership with Oklo could lead to up to 1.2 GW of new nuclear capacity from as many as 16 Aurora reactors in Ohio by 2030, while the less developed deal with TerraPower anticipates the deployment of up to eight Natrium reactors, with the first units expected online by 2032. Both collaborations leverage existing support from the Department of Energy and private sector partnerships to bolster the nuclear industry's supply chains and workforce.

title: CoreWeave CEO Calls Nvidia Circular Financing Claims 'Ridiculous,' Says Stake Too Small To Prop Up $42 Billion Company
summary: CoreWeave CEO Michael Intrator has strongly refuted claims of "circular financing" with Nvidia, calling the allegations "ridiculous." He argues that Nvidia's $300 million investment is a "de minimis" amount compared to CoreWeave's $25 billion capital raise and $42 billion valuation, emphasizing that demand for compute, not financial engineering, drives their relationship. Intrator also defended CoreWeave's aggressive use of debt through "box" strategies and highlighted the longevity of older AI hardware, citing renewed contracts for Nvidia A100 chips at near original value.

title: TD Cowen Initiates Coverage on Constellation Energy (CEG) With $440 Price Target
summary: TD Cowen has initiated coverage on Constellation Energy (CEG) with a $440 price target, citing the company's Calpine integration and potential for contracting. Analyst Eli Mingos foresees continued deal-making above forward curve prices and sees gas Power Purchase Agreement deals as an intriguing upside. Despite a positive outlook, the firm cautions about elevated regulatory risks for the stock.

title: Shutterstock celebrates 15th birthday by sharing posters of important events - iPhone, Facebook, Pokémon Go, and more
summary: Shutterstock is celebrating its 15th birthday by releasing 15 digital posters, each commemorating a significant event from one of its years in business. These events include major technological milestones like the launch of Facebook and the first iPhone, as well as global happenings such as Angela Merkel becoming Chancellor and the #MeToo movement. The company's founder and CEO, Jon Oringer, highlighted Shutterstock's growth and its future focus on enhancing its creative platform with AI technology.

title: Vistra stock in focus as VST prices $2.25 billion notes; analysts cite Meta nuclear deal
summary: Vistra (VST) shares saw a slight increase after pricing $2.25 billion in senior secured notes to fund its acquisition of Cogentrix and manage long-term contracts with Meta Platforms. Analysts like Scotiabank and UBS raised price targets due to strong Meta nuclear contracts, while Fitch assigned a 'BBB-' rating to the new notes. The debt issuance and Meta's commitment to nuclear power are reshaping Vistra's outlook, though Jefferies maintains a cautious stance due to PJM uncertainty.

title: A ação da AMD dispara 7% após ligação otimista de analistas: veja o que a atualização do KeyBanc significa
summary: A ação da Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) subiu 7% após o analista do KeyBanc, John Vinh, elevar a classificação da fabricante de chips para "sobreponderar" e aumentar a meta de preço para US$ 270. A atualização é impulsionada pela escassez de CPUs de servidor da AMD, quase esgotadas até 2026, e pela maior demanda por aceleradores de IA. A empresa pode considerar um aumento de preço de 10-15% para suas CPUs de servidor no 1º trimestre, e projeta um crescimento de 50% em CPUs para servidores e US$ 14-15 bilhões em receita de IA até 2026.

title: Jim Cramer Recently Looked At These 16 Stocks
summary: This article highlights some of the 16 stocks recently analyzed by Jim Cramer, focusing on Radiant Logistics, Inc. (NYSE:RLGT). Cramer recommends FedEx over Radiant Logistics for logistics plays due to its established infrastructure. The article provides details on Radiant Logistics' services and lists other stocks mentioned by Cramer.

title: Metaverse – the next e-commerce revolution
summary: This article from Deutsche Bank discusses the metaverse as the next e-commerce revolution. It covers the opportunities, risks, technology, and legal/regulatory environment, noting the increasing investment despite the cryptocurrency market contraction. The white paper aims to guide readers through the metaverse, exploring its definition, benefits for individuals and corporates, technological maturity, and strategies for risk mitigation.

title: Gordon Reid's Top Picks: Meta, Morgan Stanley & RTX Corp
summary: This article highlights Gordon Reid's top stock picks: Meta, Morgan Stanley, and RTX Corp. It also features Darren Sissons, partner and portfolio manager at Campbell, Lee & Ross Investment Management, who shares his own stock picks and market outlooks. The content includes a series of videos from other financial experts discussing their top picks and market insights from the past few days.

title: Microsoft vows to ‘pay its way’ as it seeks to defuse data centre backlash
summary: Microsoft is pledging to pay higher electricity rates and replenish water used by its AI data centers to address public backlash over rising energy costs and environmental concerns. This move comes as the Trump administration faces criticism for increased electricity bills despite prioritizing AI development. Other utilities, like Georgia Power, are also reassuring customers that data center energy demands will not impact their rates.

title: Form 424B2 BANK OF NOVA SCOTIA
summary: This Form 424B2 filing from The Bank of Nova Scotia details a new Senior Note Program, Series A, offering Equity Linked Securities. These auto-callable securities with a contingent coupon and memory feature are linked to the performance of the common stock of Broadcom Inc., Alphabet Inc. (Class A), Meta Platforms, Inc., and NVIDIA Corporation, due January 25, 2029. The securities offer potential monthly contingent coupon payments at an annual rate of at least 19.35% if the lowest performing underlying stock meets a specified threshold, but also carry principal at risk if performance falls below a downside threshold.

title: Penguin Solutions’ (PENG) Growth Outlook Remains Intact, Rosenblatt Says
summary: Rosenblatt analyst Kevin Cassidy reiterated a Buy rating for Penguin Solutions (PENG) with a $30.00 price target after better-than-expected revenue and earnings. The firm noted significant year-over-year growth in Advanced Computing and Integrated Memory segments, which are the primary drivers for owning Penguin stock. Despite a softening in the LED segment, Rosenblatt maintains a positive growth outlook for the company, particularly as it expands its enterprise customer base.

title: RWC Asset Management LLP Sells 44,621 Shares of Vistra Corp. $VST
summary: RWC Asset Management LLP reduced its stake in Vistra Corp. by 31.2% in the third quarter, selling 44,621 shares and now holding 98,343 shares worth $19.27 million. Despite this sale, analysts maintain a "Buy" consensus rating for Vistra with a target price of $239.40, partially due to positive sentiment surrounding Vistra's involvement in Meta's energy pipeline for data centers. The company also recently announced increased dividend payments and issued senior secured notes, a move that sparked some credit/interest-cost scrutiny.

title: The Biggest Loser: Tim Cook of Apple
summary: The article argues that Apple CEO Tim Cook has fallen behind in the artificial intelligence race, failing to launch a proprietary state-of-the-art AI product. Instead, Apple has partnered with Alphabet to use Gemini AI software, despite Cook's prior assurances of Apple's leadership in AI. This move places Apple at a disadvantage compared to other tech giants who have developed their own advanced AI technologies.

title: Vivid Wealth Management LLC Takes $2.80 Million Position in Vistra Corp. $VST
summary: Vivid Wealth Management LLC has acquired a new position in Vistra Corp. (NYSE:VST), purchasing 14,283 shares valued at approximately $2.80 million in the third quarter. Despite the company's high debt-to-equity ratio of 5.74 and a recent $2.25 billion senior secured note offering, analysts maintain a "Buy" rating with a consensus price target of $239.40, partially due to Vistra's involvement in Meta's energy pipeline for data centers. The company also recently increased its quarterly dividend to $0.227 per share.

title: Major layoffs extend into 2026 as Citi, Meta, and BlackRock cut jobs
summary: Several major corporations, including Citigroup, Meta Platforms, and BlackRock, have announced significant job cuts, indicating that the trend of layoffs observed in 2025 is continuing into 2026. These companies attribute the reductions to cost control, operational restructuring, and a strategic shift towards areas like artificial intelligence and alternative assets. The layoffs highlight a cautious corporate environment prioritizing efficiency and targeted investment over workforce expansion.

title: META Stock Price, Forecast & Analysis | META PLATFORMS INC-CLASS A (NASDAQ:META)
summary: This article provides a comprehensive analysis of META Platforms Inc. (NASDAQ:META), covering its stock price, forecast, and various financial metrics. It includes key statistics, short and long-term performance overviews, technical and fundamental analysis ratings from ChartMill, financial highlights, and analyst estimates for future growth. The article also provides details about the company's segments, products, ownership structure, and lists its competitors in the Interactive Media & Services sector.

title: AlphaTON Capital (ATON) stock rips after-hours on $46 million Nvidia B300 AI deal — what to watch next
summary: AlphaTON Capital (ATON) shares surged by 186.8% in after-hours trading following the announcement of a $46 million deal to acquire 576 Nvidia B300 chips for AI compute infrastructure. The company plans to deploy these at atNorth’s data center in Sweden for Telegram’s Cocoon AI network, expecting revenue to start in March 2026. Investors are now focused on execution, delivery schedules, and the company's ability to cover outstanding equity payments.

title: 2026 Investment Perspectives
summary: Blackstone's 2026 Investment Perspectives report highlights five key dynamics shaping markets: AI investment and productivity gains, solid but uneven growth, a cooling labor market, moderating inflation, and declining global cost of capital. The firm believes these factors create an attractive environment for investors who can adapt and act with conviction, especially within private markets. The report delves into opportunities across private equity, real estate, credit, and infrastructure, emphasizing their potential for growth, durability, and downside protection amidst market shifts.

title: IBD Rating Upgrades: TAL Education Group ADR Shows Improved Technical Strength
summary: TAL Education Group (TAL) ADR has received a positive adjustment to its Relative Strength (RS) Rating, moving from 65 to 79. This upgrade indicates improving technical performance for the stock. IBD's proprietary RS Rating measures a stock's price movement over 52 weeks to identify market leadership.

title: Investors back energy providers over big tech for 2026 AI bets, says BlackRock
summary: BlackRock's recent survey indicates that investors focused on Artificial Intelligence opportunities for 2026 are shifting their preference from traditional big tech companies to energy and infrastructure providers. This move is driven by concerns over uncertain returns and higher borrowing costs associated with the data center race among tech giants. The survey of EMEA-based clients revealed that more than half favor power providers for data centers, reflecting a desire to risk-manage megacap and AI exposure while seeking diversified upside opportunities, despite only 7% believing the AI theme is a market bubble.

title: Social Networking Stocks Q3 Recap: Benchmarking Yelp (NYSE:YELP)
summary: This article provides a Q3 recap for social networking stocks, highlighting Yelp, Reddit, Pinterest, Meta, and Snap. It details each company's revenue performance against analyst expectations, user growth, and stock movement post-earnings. While Reddit showed strong growth and stock performance, Yelp and Pinterest delivered slower growth and weaker performance against estimates, respectively.

title: Ziff Davis (ZD) Raises Guidance After Fifth Straight Quarter of Revenue Growth – What’s the Signal?
summary: Ziff Davis (ZD) recently reported its fifth consecutive quarter of revenue growth and strong free cash flow, slightly missing analyst revenue expectations but raising its full-year guidance. This indicates management's confidence, despite a mixed quarter, and is amplified by an ongoing share repurchase program. The company's investment narrative relies on its ability to convert digital media reach into steady cash while managing industry shifts and dependence on acquisitions for growth, with a projected fair value presenting a 20% upside.

title: Oklo stock slips as insiders sell shares and traders reassess Meta nuclear deal
summary: Oklo Inc. (OKLO) shares declined 2.7% after reports of insider share sales and a reassessment of its nuclear energy deal with Meta Platforms. While the Meta agreement to develop small modular reactors in Ohio offers long-term potential including a "multi-billion-dollar" investment and customer prepayment, traders are wary due to potential regulatory hurdles, a previous license denial, and recent insider selling by COO Caroline Cochran. The company's timeline for power generation is years away, and its success hinges on navigating permitting and site preparation.

title: Trump says Microsoft, peers, to make ’major changes’ in AI data center power bills
summary: Donald Trump announced that his administration is collaborating with major American technology firms, starting with Microsoft, to address the rising utility costs associated with running AI data centers. The goal is to prevent these higher costs from being passed on to household bills, ensuring companies "pay their own way." Trump emphasized that while more data centers are crucial for U.S. dominance in AI, concerns about increased electricity and water costs for American consumers must be mitigated.

title: Trump Touts New Microsoft Data-Center Pledges After Local Backlash
summary: President Trump announced that Microsoft has pledged to cover higher utility bills for all its U.S. data centers powering AI models, addressing local concerns about rising electricity prices. This move by Microsoft is part of a broader effort by the tech industry and the administration to assuage fears among consumers and local governments, with other tech giants like Meta, Amazon, and Google taking similar steps. Trump indicated that further announcements regarding collaborations with top tech companies are expected.

title: Why International Stocks Still Matter: Diversifying Beyond US Winners in 2026
summary: This article argues for the importance of international stocks in a diversified portfolio, especially after a decade of US market dominance ended with international stocks outperforming in 2025. Author Allan Roth explains the reasons for past US outperformance, such as the rise of mega-cap tech, and presents three key arguments for owning international stocks: high concentration risk in US markets, sector shifts, and concerns about US financial discipline. He recommends investing in low-cost, broadly diversified international stock index funds like VXUS or IXUS, suggesting a portfolio allocation of two-thirds US and one-third international stocks.

title: What META's 1.2 GW Deal Means for OKLO's Ohio Nuclear Build
summary: Oklo Inc.'s recent agreement with Meta Platforms is a significant step towards developing a 1.2-gigawatt advanced nuclear power campus in Pike County, Ohio, tailored for Meta's expanding data center needs. Meta's upfront funding will support early project development and fuel procurement, reducing initial risks. This initiative is part of Meta's broader strategy to secure both near-term and long-term power, encompassing agreements with existing nuclear plants like Vistra Energy and new advanced reactor technologies such as TerraPower's Natrium reactor.

title: Sonos adds three directors to board as company refines strategy By Investing.com
summary: Audio technology company Sonos, Inc. (NASDAQ:SONO) has appointed three new directors, Carmine Arabia, Mandy Fields, and Joe Kennedy, to its Board of Directors to support its next growth phase and refine its platform-driven "Sonos System" strategy. This announcement comes amid significant stock volatility and follows strong financial performance in Q4 2025, with analysts expecting a return to profitability this year. The company is actively buying back shares and maintains a solid financial position with ample liquidity.

title: CVRx Issues 2026 Outlook and Expands Loan Facility
summary: CVRx announced its preliminary unaudited Q4 2025 and full-year 2025 revenue, showing growth and a strong cash position. The company also provided 2026 guidance, forecasting increased revenue and gross margins, benefiting from new CPT codes. Additionally, CVRx expanded its loan facility for greater financial flexibility and is making a significant clinical investment with the FDA-approved BENEFIT-HF trial design, aiming to enlarge the addressable market for its Barostim device.

title: Oklo Stock Rises as DOE Approves Radioisotope Pilot Using Recycled Nuclear Fuel
summary: Oklo Inc. (NYSE: OKLO) shares rose significantly after the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) approved an Other Transaction Agreement (OTA) for a radioisotope pilot plant. This agreement allows Oklo to move forward with the design, construction, and operation of a facility for domestic production of critical medical and research isotopes, utilizing recycled nuclear fuel. The development highlights federal confidence in private nuclear innovation and positions Oklo for future commercial deployments, contributing to a strategic reduction in dependence on foreign isotope sources.

title: Alphabet hits $4 trillion valuation as AI refocus lifts sentiment
summary: Alphabet achieved a $4 trillion market valuation, driven by its intensified focus on artificial intelligence, following a deal for Apple's AI models to be based on Google's Gemini. The company's stock has surged about 65% in 2025, outperforming peers, and it has also seen significant growth in its Google Cloud unit and a stable advertising business. This milestone makes Alphabet the fourth company to reach this valuation, reflecting a significant shift in investor sentiment.

title: 'Big Short' Investor Michael Burry Bets Against Oracle—Here's His Advice
summary: Michael Burry, known for his "Big Short" bet against the 2008 housing market, has disclosed he owns put options on Oracle Corporation (NYSE:ORCL) and has previously shorted the stock. Burry believes Oracle's significant debt from expanding into cloud computing services presents a strategic vulnerability. Despite his bearish stance on Oracle, he remains hesitant to short larger tech companies like Meta, Alphabet, and Microsoft, believing their diverse businesses will weather potential challenges.

title: 5 takeaways from Xcel CEO Bob Frenzel’s talk at the Minneapolis Fed
summary: Xcel Energy CEO Bob Frenzel discussed the dramatic impact of data center growth on electric utilities at the Minneapolis Fed, highlighting multiple drivers of demand growth, degrading supply chains, and the need for alternative rate structures. He also advocated for nuclear energy as a preferred source for data centers and noted the significant rise in engineering, procurement, and construction costs due to competition from hyperscalers. The utility is adapting its strategies to manage this evolving landscape, including long-term contracts and advocating for national initiatives in nuclear power.

title: How Investors May Respond To Vistra (VST) Supplying Meta’s AI Data Centers With Long-Term Nuclear Power
summary: Vistra (VST) recently announced a 20-year agreement with Meta to supply 2,600 megawatts of zero-carbon nuclear energy to its AI data centers, significantly bolstering Vistra's position as a key energy provider for the burgeoning AI sector. This deal, along with Vistra's acquisition of Cogentrix Energy, aims to solidify its role as a scaled supplier for AI power needs. While strengthening the company's earnings visibility, the strategy also introduces risks related to elevated leverage and execution challenges for large-scale projects, with fair value estimates for Vistra's stock varying widely among analysts.

title: Vistra (VST) Soars 10.5%: Is Further Upside Left in the Stock?
summary: Vistra (VST) shares surged 10.5%, driven by a 20-year power purchase agreement with Meta and the acquisition of Cogentrix Energy. Despite expected earnings growth of 114.9% year-over-year and a revenue increase of 27.8%, the consensus EPS estimate for the quarter has been revised 3.5% lower over the last 30 days, leading to a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). Investors are advised to monitor whether the recent stock jump can sustain growth given the negative trend in earnings estimate revisions.

title: Oracle Draws Short Bet From 'Big Short' Investor Michael Burry
summary: Michael Burry, known for predicting the 2008 housing crash, has taken a short position on Oracle (ORCL) through put options, citing concerns about its investment plan and increasing debt. Burry believes Oracle, along with Nvidia and Palantir, is overexposed to AI hype, contrasting with his view on larger companies like Meta, Alphabet, and Microsoft whose core businesses remain strong. Oracle's stock has seen significant volatility, with a cloud projection boost followed by a decline due to concerns over its $95 billion debt and high data center costs.

title: Vistra launches private offering of senior secured notes
summary: Vistra Corp. announced a private offering of senior secured notes due in 2031 and 2036 to fund its acquisition of Cogentrix Energy and repay existing debt. The energy company, with a market valuation of $56.37 billion, has raised its dividend for seven consecutive years but is considered overvalued by InvestingPro data. Recent developments include 20-year power purchase agreements with Meta Platforms Inc., leading to mixed analyst sentiments regarding the company's prospects.

title: ’Big Short’ investor Burry opens put position against Oracle By Investing.com
summary: Michael Burry, known for "The Big Short," has opened a put option position against Oracle Corp. He criticized Oracle's recent strategy and also shorted the company directly. Burry has previously taken bearish stances on Nvidia and Palantir due to AI concentration.

title: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones, S&P 500 Futures Tumble As DOJ Serves Federal Reserve—Vistra, Tempus AI, Alibaba In Focus
summary: U.S. stock futures declined on Monday, influenced by rising tensions between the Department of Justice and the Federal Reserve regarding Chairman Jerome Powell's testimony, and a slight miss on nonfarm payrolls. Despite the market dip, several individual stocks including Vistra, Alibaba, Tempus AI, and Xpeng saw premarket gains due to positive company-specific news. Upcoming economic data releases and analyst insights, particularly from Mohamed El-Erian, suggest continued market volatility and a focus on inflation trends and the geopolitical landscape.

title: Wells Fargo Maintains Outperform on Microsoft (MSFT) Despite Lowered Target
summary: Wells Fargo maintained its "Outperform" rating on Microsoft (MSFT) but lowered its price target from $700 to $665, citing AI as the key driver for 2026. Jefferies also reiterated its "Buy" rating and $675 price target, emphasizing Microsoft's AI integration efforts. Both firms anticipate significant opportunities in the AI landscape, with Microsoft positioned as a top pick among mega-cap stocks.

title: Vistra Energy stock price target raised to $244 from $230 at BMO Capital
summary: BMO Capital has increased its price target for Vistra Energy (NYSE:VST) to $244 from $230, maintaining an Outperform rating, following Vistra's 20-year power purchase agreements with Meta for approximately 2,600 MW of power. This deal, along with revised share repurchase and debt paydown assumptions, is expected to boost Vistra's adjusted EBITDA and free cash flow per share. Despite a high P/E ratio, the company remains profitable, and management has been actively buying back shares.

title: Tripadvisor (TRIP) Valuation Reassessed As Shares Trade Sideways And Earnings Multiple Stands Out
summary: Tripadvisor's shares are being re-evaluated by investors following mixed short-term returns, with the stock currently trading at US$14.80. While Simply Wall St suggests Tripadvisor is 18.5% undervalued based on growth expectations and its experiences marketplace, its P/E ratio of 21.9x is higher than the industry average, implying the market has already factored in significant future earnings. This premium P/E ratio means that any future profit setbacks could negatively impact returns more severely.

title: Alphabet (GOOG) stock week ahead: Washington pressure hits Google Play as earnings loom
summary: Alphabet (GOOG) stock faces pressure as Democratic Senators demand Google and Apple remove X and Grok from their app stores due to policy violations, just as the company prepares for its upcoming earnings report on February 4th. Investors are also watching the EU antitrust regulators' decision by February 10th regarding Alphabet's $32 billion acquisition of Wiz, which is crucial for Google Cloud. The week ahead will also see the release of the U.S. Consumer Price Index for December 2025, which could impact interest rate expectations and high-multiple tech stocks like GOOG.

title: The Truth About Alphabet Inc. (Class C): Is This Tech Giant Still Worth Your Money?
summary: This article examines whether Alphabet Inc. (Class C) remains a worthwhile investment despite market volatility and increasing competition, particularly in the AI space. It delves into the company's business fundamentals, its significant bets on AI with Gemini, the enduring power of its advertising platform, and its valuation relative to its potential. The piece concludes with a "cop or drop" verdict, suggesting it's a solid long-term anchor for those who believe in tech dominance but not for short-term traders.

title: Assessing Ziff Davis (ZD) Valuation After Guidance Upgrade And Fifth Straight Quarter Of Revenue Growth
summary: Ziff Davis (ZD) recently upgraded its full-year guidance following its fifth consecutive quarter of revenue growth and strong free cash flow, leading to a 7.2% post-earnings share price increase. Despite a recent rebound, the stock has experienced significant declines over the past one and three years, but current analyst narratives suggest it is undervalued with a fair value of US$43.43 compared to its trading price of US$36.18. Investors are encouraged to assess the underlying assumptions and risks, especially concerning acquisition-driven growth and potential impacts from AI-powered content aggregation.

title: Oregon Public Employees Retirement Fund Increases Stock Position in Electronic Arts Inc. $EA
summary: The Oregon Public Employees Retirement Fund has increased its stake in Electronic Arts Inc. (NASDAQ:EA) by 30.7%, acquiring an additional 6,033 shares to hold a total of 25,692 shares valued at approximately $5.18 million. Despite this increase in institutional holdings, EA recently missed quarterly earnings expectations and saw its revenue decline year-over-year. The company's stock trades near its 52-week high, while analysts maintain a consensus "Hold" rating with an average price target of $181.21.

title: RELX PLC stock: buyback rolls on as investors brace for Feb. 12 results
summary: RELX PLC continues its share repurchase program, buying back 305,052 shares for approximately £9.6 million on Friday as part of a non-discretionary plan to repurchase up to £250 million by February 6th. This strategy aims to boost earnings per share ahead of RELX's full-year 2025 results, due on February 12th. Investors will focus on the company's ability to sustain organic growth, maintain margins, and convert cash, especially as broader market factors like interest rates and consumer price data could overshadow the buyback's impact.

title: The Truth About WPP plc: Why This Old-School Ad Giant Is Suddenly Back on Your Radar
summary: WPP plc, a legacy advertising giant, is attempting a comeback by pivoting towards AI-powered, data-heavy marketing. The article explores whether WPP, despite its traditional image, represents a value play for long-term investors due to its AI initiatives, global reach, and current valuation, contrasting it with both traditional ad rivals and big tech platforms. It suggests WPP could be a "quiet must-have" for patient investors rather than a high-hype stock.

title: AXT (AXTI) Receives a Rating Update from a Top Analyst
summary: AXT (AXTI) has received updated analyst ratings, with Craig-Hallum maintaining a Buy rating and Northland Securities also issuing a Buy. Conversely, B. Riley Securities downgraded AXT to a Hold. The company recently reported a quarterly revenue of $27.96 million and a net loss of $1.91 million, and insider sentiment is negative due to increased share selling.

title: HP Inc shares fall as company says it will cut up to 6,000 employees
summary: HP Inc. announced plans to cut up to 6,000 employees, representing about 10% of its global workforce, over the next three years. This restructuring is part of a broader "Future Ready" plan aimed at achieving significant gross annual cost savings. Following the announcement, HP's shares experienced a decline.

title: Vistra assina acordos de energia nuclear de 20 anos com a Meta para fornecimento de 2.609 MW
summary: Vistra Corp. (VST) anunciou acordos de compra de energia de 20 anos com a Meta Platforms Inc. para fornecer 2.609 MW de eletricidade e capacidade livre de carbono de suas usinas nucleares. A entrega está prevista para começar no final de 2026 com conclusão total até o final de 2034, com a Vistra esperando um aumento de 8% a 10% no fluxo de caixa livre ajustado dos acordos operacionais e um adicional de 5% a 7% da capacidade de expansão. Esta notícia segue a recente aquisição significativa da Cogentrix Energy pela Vistra, expandindo sua capacidade no mercado de energia.
source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

title: Jim Cramer on Microsoft: “Stock’s Been Punished By the Fact That Management Wants to Spend a Fortune on AI”
summary: Jim Cramer commented on Microsoft's stock performance, noting its recent decline despite the company's strong fundamentals. He attributes the stock's punishment to management's significant investments in AI, particularly a $250 billion commitment to Azure from OpenAI, and concerns about OpenAI's financial stability. Despite these issues, Cramer remains optimistic about Microsoft, especially if OpenAI achieves a rumored $800 billion valuation.

title: Vistra Corp Buys 2 More PA Natural Gas Power Plants; Facebook/Meta Buys 20 Years Of Power From Beaver Valley Nuclear Plant; 18 PA Power Plants Now Locked Up To Feed A.I. Data Centers
summary: Vistra Corp has acquired two more natural gas power plants in Pennsylvania, and Facebook/Meta secured a 20-year power purchase agreement for supply from nuclear plants, including Beaver Valley. These deals are part of a trend where existing Pennsylvania power plants are being dedicated to supplying energy for AI data centers, raising concerns among consumer advocates about potential electricity price increases for regular ratepayers and grid reliability issues. Currently, power from 18 Pennsylvania power plants is allocated to AI data centers, impacting a mix of natural gas, nuclear, hydroelectric, and coal waste-fired facilities.

title: Cofundadora da Oklo, Cochran vende US$ 32,4 milhões em ações OKLO
summary: Caroline Cochran, cofundadora e COO da Oklo Inc. (NASDAQ:OKLO), vendeu US$ 32,4 milhões em ações ordinárias Classe A nos dias 7 e 8 de janeiro, conforme um plano de negociação 10b5-1. A empresa também anunciou acordos com o Departamento de Energia dos EUA para uma usina piloto de radioisótopos e testes de reator, além de uma parceria com a Meta para um campus de energia nuclear de 1,2 GW em Ohio. Analistas da Seaport Global Securities e Wedbush reiteraram classificações positivas para a Oklo, citando o progresso da empresa.
source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

title: Oklo jumps 20% in pre-market as Meta unveils nuclear deals to power data centers
summary: Oklo Inc. saw a 20% jump in pre-market trading after Meta announced a deal to power its AI infrastructure with nuclear energy from Oklo, Vistra, and Terrapower. The agreement with Oklo involves building a 1.2 GW nuclear power campus in Ohio, with Meta prepaying for power and providing upfront funding to accelerate reactor technology deployment. This move by Meta highlights the growing demand for reliable, carbon-free nuclear power to support the energy-intensive AI sector, fueling a "Nuclear Renaissance."

title: Oklo, Meta Announce Agreement in Support of 1.2 GW Nuclear Energy Development in Southern Ohio
summary: Oklo Inc. and Meta Platforms, Inc. have announced an agreement to develop a 1.2 GW nuclear power campus in Pike County, Ohio, to support Meta's data centers.
