Meta will prepay for power and provide funding to secure nuclear fuel and advance Phase 1 of Oklo's Aurora powerhouse deployment. The project is expected to create jobs, expand Ohio's clean energy workforce, and bring significant tax revenues, with the first phase targeted to come online as early as 2030 and full 1.2 GW capacity by 2034.

title: Meta se associa à Oklo para desenvolver campus de energia nuclear de 1,2 GW em Ohio
summary: Meta Platforms, Inc. (Nasdaq:META) e Oklo Inc. (NYSE:OKLO), uma empresa de tecnologia nuclear avançada, anunciaram um acordo para desenvolver um campus de energia nuclear de 1,2 gigawatt no condado de Pike, Ohio. O projeto visa fornecer energia para os centros de dados da Meta na região, com operações iniciais previstas para 2030 e capacidade total a ser atingida até 2034. A Meta fará pagamentos antecipados e fornecerá financiamento para o projeto, que também é esperado para criar milhares de empregos e gerar novas receitas fiscais.
source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

title: Meta aposta em energia nuclear avançada e se associa à Oklo para campus de 1,2 GW nos EUA
summary: Meta Platforms has partnered with Oklo Inc. to develop a 1.2 GW nuclear energy campus in Ohio, US, aimed at powering Meta's data centers and AI supercluster. This project highlights a growing trend of major tech companies investing in advanced nuclear solutions, such as small modular reactors (SMRs), for clean, reliable, and scalable power. The initiative is expected to boost local employment and economic development while supporting Meta's expanding AI operations.

title: (AMZN.O) | Stock Price & Latest News
summary: This page provides a comprehensive overview of Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN.O), including its stock price, key financial data, recent news, and company information. It features various news articles related to Amazon and the broader market, covering topics such as regulatory fines, technological advancements, and financial performance. The financial section presents annual and quarterly income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow data for the years 2022-2024.

title: Fidelity Has a Pure Play ETF You Should Look at for 2026
summary: The Fidelity MSCI Communication Services Index ETF (FCOM) offers a diversified alternative to highly concentrated "Magnificent Seven" investments for investors heading into 2026. FCOM balances exposure to tech giants like Meta and Alphabet with traditional communications infrastructure companies such as Verizon and AT&T, providing a blend of growth potential and higher dividend yields. While FCOM's diversification may lead to underperformance during pure growth rallies, its 0.084% expense ratio and a 240% ten-year total return make it an attractive option for those seeking broader tech exposure with reduced concentration risk.

title: Senator Dumps Apple, Google, Microsoft To End 2025—But Refuses To Sell This Mag 7 Underperformer
summary: Senator Shelley Moore Capito (R-W.Va.) sold shares of Apple, Alphabet, and Microsoft in December 2025, according to recent disclosures. Despite divesting from these major Magnificent Seven stocks, Capito chose to retain her Meta Platforms shares, which she bought multiple times throughout 2025. This decision is noteworthy given Meta's second-worst performance among the Magnificent Seven in 2025, suggesting a long-term belief in the company perhaps due to undervaluation.

title: Meta agreement advances plan for large nuclear power site in Ohio
summary: Meta has signed an agreement with nuclear technology company Oklo for a power plant project in Ohio. This nuclear facility is intended to support Meta's data centers in the region. The move comes amidst growing concerns about the power grid's capacity to meet the surging demand from data centers.

title: California firm to bring nuclear reactors to Ohio to power Meta
summary: Oklo, a California-based nuclear energy company, has partnered with Meta Platforms, Inc. to establish a 1.2-gigawatt power campus in Pike County, Ohio, using 16 advanced nuclear reactors to power Meta's data centers. This project aims to address the significant demand for electrical energy from power-hungry data centers and is expected to create numerous jobs. While proponents hail it as a "new era" for Ohio's energy sector, some local residents express concerns about environmental safety and lack of information.

title: Vistra Corp. Strikes $4 Billion Deal, Agrees to Separate Deal With Meta
summary: Vistra Corp. has acquired Cogentrix Energy for $4 billion, adding 5,500 MW of natural gas generation capacity to its portfolio. Additionally, Vistra has entered into a 20-year power purchase agreement with Meta to provide over 2,600 MW of zero-carbon energy from its nuclear plants in the PJM region. The article also covers KKR's acquisition of Dallas-based sports PE firm Arctos Partners for $1 billion and PMG's acquisition of Digital Voices.

title: Meta strikes deals with Vistra, Oklo, TerraPower
summary: Meta announced three agreements with Vistra, Oklo, and TerraPower aiming to support both uprates at existing nuclear power plants and the development of new advanced reactor projects. These deals could finance up to 6.6 GW of new and existing energy by 2035 to meet Meta's growing data center and AI-driven energy needs. The partnerships include funding for TerraPower's Natrium units, development of an advanced nuclear technology campus with Oklo, and support for uprates at Vistra's existing nuclear plants.

title: Google, Meta, Amazon, Netflix And Microsoft Escape Tough New European Rules: Report
summary: Google, Meta, Amazon, Netflix, and Microsoft are expected to avoid mandatory obligations under the EU's new Digital Networks Act. Instead, the proposal will invite these tech giants to participate in a voluntary cooperation system rather than facing strict regulations. This decision comes despite lobbying from European telecom operators and aims to boost investment in broadband infrastructure.

title: Meta signs nuclear energy deals to power Prometheus AI supercluster
summary: Meta has announced agreements with three nuclear power providers—Vistra, TerraPower, and Oklo—to power its Prometheus supercluster AI computing system being built in New Albany, Ohio. These deals are crucial for supporting Meta's ambitious AI development, with a goal to add 6.6 gigawatts of power by 2035. The move reflects a broader trend among tech giants investing in nuclear energy to meet the massive power demands of AI infrastructure.

title: Stocks Start First Full Week of 2026 Strong
summary: The Dow, Nasdaq, and S&P 500 all posted significant gains, marking their best weekly performance since early November, fueled by investor optimism for 2026. Homebuilding stocks surged after President Trump ordered mortgage giants to purchase $200 billion in mortgage bonds, leading to a sharp decline in mortgage rates. Oil and gold also recorded weekly gains amidst geopolitical developments and increased demand.

title: Vistra and Meta Announce Agreements to Support Nuclear Plants in PJM and Add New Nuclear Generation to the Grid
summary: Vistra and Meta have entered into 20-year power purchase agreements (PPAs) totaling over 2,600 megawatts (MW) from three Vistra nuclear plants in the PJM region to support Meta's operations. The agreements include 2,176 MW of existing generation and an additional 433 MW from nuclear uprates, marking the largest nuclear uprates supported by a corporate customer in the United States. This partnership ensures the continued operation of Vistra's Beaver Valley, Davis-Besse, and Perry nuclear power plants, extending their licenses for another 20 years, and is expected to drive economic growth, create jobs, and enhance grid reliability with carbon-free energy.

title: AI company ServiceNow hires former Microsoft CLO as next legal head
summary: ServiceNow, an AI company, has appointed Hossein Nowbar, former CLO at Microsoft, as its new chief legal officer and president. He replaces Russ Elmer, who will transition to a special counsel role. Nowbar will oversee global legal, ethics, governance, compliance, risk, and government affairs functions, bringing over three decades of experience relevant to AI.

title: ASP Isotopes Stock Surged Over 13% Today – Why The Company Stands To Gain From Meta’s Nuclear Energy Deal With TerraPower
summary: ASP Isotopes (ASPI) stock surged over 13% after Meta Platforms (META) announced a long-term agreement with TerraPower to secure nuclear energy. ASP Isotopes had previously finalized agreements with TerraPower in 2025 to finance and supply fuel for advanced nuclear projects. The company's proprietary Aerodynamic Separation Process and focus on High-Assay Low-Enriched Uranium (HALEU) position it favorably for the growing demand for nuclear energy.

title: Why Vistra (VST) stock is jumping premarket: Meta signs 20-year nuclear power deals
summary: Vistra (VST) stock surged approximately 8% in premarket trading after Meta Platforms signed 20-year agreements to purchase nuclear power from three Vistra plants in Ohio and Pennsylvania. These deals aim to secure reliable, zero-carbon electricity for Meta's surging data center demand and AI buildout. The agreements involve over 2,600 megawatts of energy, including existing generation and output increases, with Meta's purchases starting in late 2026.

title: First Trust Has an ETF That Might Be Better Than the Nasdaq and QQQ
summary: The First Trust Dow Jones Internet Index Fund (FDN) offers an equal-weight alternative to the Nasdaq and QQQ by focusing on pure internet companies. However, FDN has significantly underperformed QQQ over the past one and five years, primarily due to its lack of exposure to mega-cap tech stocks like Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. For investors seeking broad tech exposure or those focused on the "Magnificent Seven," QQQ or the Direxion NASDAQ-100 Equal Weighted Index Shares (QQQE) might be better options.

title: Vistra (VST) Stock Soars in Premarket on Major Nuclear Power Deal With Meta
summary: Vistra (NYSE: VST) stock surged over 13% in premarket trading after announcing a 20-year nuclear energy agreement with Meta. This landmark deal involves Vistra supplying over 2,600 megawatts of zero-carbon energy from three nuclear plants to Meta and includes significant capacity expansion and license renewals. The agreement is poised to boost Vistra's long-term growth and address the increasing power demands of AI operations, while also bringing substantial economic benefits to local communities.

title: Why Constellation Energy Stock Popped Today
summary: Constellation Energy (CEG) stock rose by 4% due to two positive news items. Investment bank TD Cowen initiated coverage with a buy rating and a $440 price target, and Meta Platforms announced an expanded commitment to nuclear energy, indirectly securing Constellation's future revenue. Despite the positive news, the stock is considered expensive at 37 times trailing earnings compared to its 15% long-term earnings growth forecast.

title: AMD in 2026: The Systems-Led Challenger in the AI Super-Cycle
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has transformed into a leading challenger in the AI semiconductor market, largely due to its strategic shift towards high-performance computing and data center AI under CEO Lisa Su. With the release of its MI350 and MI400 series accelerators, and significant improvements in its ROCm software, AMD is fiercely competing with Nvidia, despite notable risks like supply chain concentration and market cyclicality. The company's strong financial performance, innovative products like the 2nm MI455X, and growing analyst confidence position it as a foundational pillar in the global AI infrastructure.

title: Here's What the Street Thinks About Amazon.com (AMZN)
summary: Wolfe Research recently lowered Amazon's (AMZN) price target to $275 from $305, while Evercore ISI maintained a Buy rating with a $335 target, citing the potential of its AI-powered shopping assistant, Rufus. Evercore anticipates Rufus and agentic commerce could significantly boost Amazon's advertising revenue and retail GMV by 2028. The article suggests that while Amazon has investment potential, other AI stocks might offer greater upside and less risk.

title: Kenvue Appoints Madhav Nayak as Vice President and CMO for Asia-Pacific
summary: Kenvue has appointed Madhav Nayak as Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer for Asia-Pacific. He will lead brand strategy and commercial performance for Kenvue's brands across the region, including Johnson's, Neutrogena, and Listerine. Nayak brings over two decades of FMCG and consumer marketing expertise, having previously held leadership roles at KFC Asia, Meta, and Unilever.

title: Break market concentration with global stocks
summary: This article argues for diversifying portfolios with global stocks to mitigate the risks associated with market concentration in a few large US tech and AI firms. It highlights that the "AI trade" is becoming more nuanced, requiring careful selection of companies embedding AI meaningfully, rather than just experimenting. The authors advocate for an active, fundamentals-driven investment approach to capture global opportunities and ensure more resilient portfolios.

title: Why Constellation Energy Rallied Nearly 60% in 2025
summary: Constellation Energy's shares rallied nearly 60% in 2025 due to its position as a key player in the AI buildout and increasing electricity demand. The company announced a major acquisition of Calpine, adding significant natural gas and geothermal capacity to its nuclear fleet. Additionally, Constellation secured new power purchase agreements with AI hyperscalers and benefited from a more favorable regulatory environment.

title: Jim Cramer Says He Is "Looking for Amazon to Put Up Much Bigger Gains in 2026"
summary: Jim Cramer is optimistic about Amazon's performance in 2026, citing strong growth in its web services business, significant investment in AI through Anthropic, and continued double-digit growth in its retail sector. Despite heavy AI infrastructure spending, Cramer believes these investments will directly generate revenue, leading him to anticipate substantial gains for AMZN stock this year. The stock has already shown a nearly 5% increase over the past three sessions, reflecting positive sentiment.

title: The Truth About International Business Machines: Why Everyone Is Suddenly Paying Attention
summary: This article examines International Business Machines (IBM) as a potential AI dark horse, arguing that while it lacks the social media hype of other tech giants, its focus on enterprise AI, hybrid cloud, and automation makes it an attractive investment for those seeking long-term value and dividends. The piece contrasts IBM's "grown-up tech" stability with the high-volatility, meme-stock plays, positioning it as a steady alternative for a diversified portfolio.

title: Callan JMB director Dial buys shares worth $2409
summary: Callan JMB Inc. director Gerald Dial recently purchased 2,000 shares of the company's common stock for $2,409. The purchases were made at prices between $1.20 and $1.22 per share, which is below the stock's Fair Value according to InvestingPro data. The company has also announced strategic initiatives including a preliminary agreement for manufacturing equipment at its Texas facility and an expansion into food sampling logistics.

title: Stock market today: Dow rises as defense stocks jump, Nvidia leads Nasdaq down as all eyes turn to jobs report
summary: US stocks closed mixed on Thursday, with the Dow rising due to a jump in defense stocks after President Trump's statements on military spending, while the Nasdaq fell, led by Nvidia, as investors reacted to fresh labor market data. All eyes are now on Friday's highly anticipated December jobs report, which will be crucial for the Federal Reserve's policy decisions. Geopolitical issues, including US strategy on Venezuela's oil and a potential Supreme Court decision on Trump-era tariffs, also remained key concerns for investors.
authors: Rian Howlett, Karen Friar, Ines Ferré

title: Samson Rock Capital LLP Acquires New Position in CyberArk Software Ltd. $CYBR
summary: Samson Rock Capital LLP has acquired a new position in CyberArk Software Ltd. (NASDAQ:CYBR), purchasing 30,000 shares valued at approximately $14.49 million, making it their second-largest holding. The stock holds an average analyst rating of "Hold" with a price target of $462.63.

title: Microsoft's (MSFT) AI Strategy Reinforces Its Position as a Long-Term Winner, Analyst Says
summary: Jefferies analyst Brent Thill reiterated a Buy rating on Microsoft (MSFT) with a $675 price target, highlighting its AI strategy as a key growth driver and a reason to consider it a long-term winner. The firm identifies Microsoft as a top mega-cap pick due to strong AI tailwinds and anticipates significant growth as the company integrates AI across its businesses. Wall Street analysts maintain a consensus Buy rating, with an average price target of $630.

title: Alphabet overtakes Apple as world's second-most valuable company behind Nvidia
summary: Alphabet has surpassed Apple to become the world's second most valuable company, with a market capitalization of $3.89 trillion, marking the first time since 2019. This shift is attributed to Google's reassertion of leadership in AI with cutting-edge software and custom hardware like TPUs, which threaten Nvidia's dominance. While Alphabet continues to gain, Apple is grappling with executive departures and the need to prove its AI capabilities to investors, despite currently trailing Nvidia's $4.5 trillion market cap.

title: Should You Hold Oracle Stock Despite Debt-Fueled AI Data Center Bet?
summary: Oracle is heavily investing in AI data centers, reflecting a significant bet on the future of AI infrastructure as evidenced by strong cloud infrastructure revenue growth and substantial remaining performance obligations. Despite increased capital expenditures leading to negative free cash flow in the short term, the company expects significant revenue conversion from its backlog and maintains an aggressive multicloud strategy. While current valuations appear stretched, and the stock has underperformed, long-term holders may find the AI infrastructure strategy promising, though new investors might wait for more clarity on capacity utilization.

title: 7 Top-Performing Large Growth Funds
summary: This article identifies seven top-performing large growth funds by screening for the best one-, three-, and five-year returns, focusing on open-ended and exchange-traded funds with Morningstar Medalist Ratings of Bronze, Silver, or Gold. Fidelity funds dominate the list, securing four out of seven spots, with Vanguard and Victory Capital also featured. Each fund is reviewed for its performance, strategy, and Morningstar ratings.

title: ‘Coming for the King,’ Says Investor About Alphabet Stock

Alphabet's strong Q3 2025 revenues, advancements in its Gemini 3 LLM, and potential acquisition of Intersect's data centers indicate its growing presence in the AI revolution. Despite a higher Forward P/E, the investor believes Alphabet will grow into its valuation and rates GOOG a Strong Buy, a sentiment largely shared by Wall Street analysts.

title: Intel Stock Climbs After Trump Praises Company Post Meeting With CEO
summary: Intel's stock rose nearly 2% in after-market trading following former President Donald Trump's positive remarks on the company's new Core Ultra Series 3 processors, which are designed, built, and packaged in the U.S. Trump highlighted the government's 10% stake in Intel, making it the largest shareholder, and praised the company's manufacturing efforts in the U.S. Amid market share losses to rivals, Intel replaced its CEO in March 2025, and retail sentiment regarding INTC shares remains 'extremely bullish' on Stocktwits.

title: Here's What Lifted Oracle (ORCL) in Q3
summary: Oracle Corporation's strong Q3 performance was driven by its rapidly expanding cloud business and a significant increase in its order backlog. The company secured multi-billion dollar deals with major tech entities like OpenAI, xAI, Meta, Nvidia, and AMD, leading to an almost four-fold increase in its backlog over the past year. Despite the fund's overall underperformance compared to the Russell 1000 due to its focus on lower-risk, high-quality factors, Oracle's contribution was a highlight.

title: Defiance’s XMAG ETF, the First ETF Offering Exposure to the S&P 500 Excluding the “Magnificent Seven,” Surpasses $100 Million in AUM
summary: Defiance ETFs announced that its Defiance Large Cap Ex-Magnificent Seven ETF (XMAG) has surpassed $100 million in assets under management since its launch in October 2024. XMAG offers investors exposure to the S&P 500 while explicitly excluding the "Magnificent Seven" tech giants, addressing concerns about market concentration. This milestone highlights strong investor demand for diversified large-cap equity strategies that avoid overexposure to a small group of mega-cap stocks.

title: Exploring Analyst Estimates for JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM) Q4 Earnings, Beyond Revenue and EPS
summary: Analysts expect JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM) to report Q4 earnings of $5.01 per share on $45.71 billion in revenue, representing year-over-year increases. The stock has seen a 5.4% increase in the past month and holds a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold).

title: The Truth About Alphabet Inc. (Class A): Is This Stock Still a No-Brainer or Totally Overhyped?
summary: This article examines whether Alphabet Inc. (Class A) is still a worthwhile investment, considering the hype around big tech and AI. It analyzes the company's strong product grip in search, YouTube, and Android, its position in the AI war, and its price-performance relative to rivals. The author concludes that Alphabet is a foundational long-term investment rather than a short-term hype stock.

title: Constellation Closes Deal for Calpine, Creating Biggest Electricity Generator
summary: Constellation Energy has finalized its acquisition of Calpine, making it the largest owner of power plants in the U.S. This strategic move is a response to the anticipated increase in American electricity demand, fueled by the growth of data centers, electric vehicles, and domestic manufacturing.

title: Alphabet Trades Near Highs as Earnings Power and AI Spend Justify a Premium
summary: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) is trading near its 52-week highs, driven by strong earnings growth and significant strategic investments in AI infrastructure, including custom Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) and large-scale energy acquisition for data centers. The company's core advertising business remains robust, complemented by rapid expansion in Google Cloud and other segments, justifying its premium valuation despite market concerns about AI competition and regulatory pressures. The article argues that Alphabet's comprehensive AI strategy, from chip design to power generation, positions it as a foundational layer for future AI and cloud growth, making it a compelling "Buy" despite current high multiples.

title: The Memory Storm: Apple Faces Margin Compression as Component Costs Surge Ahead of Earnings
summary: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) is experiencing margin compression due to surging memory component costs, specifically DRAM and NAND flash, ahead of its Q1 2026 earnings report. This has led to a stock slide and a temporary market capitalization shift to Alphabet Inc., as Apple chooses to absorb these increased costs to maintain stable product pricing. Investors are keenly watching the upcoming earnings call for guidance on gross margins and the growth of its Services segment to assess the company's ability to navigate this "AI tax" on hardware.

title: Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) in Chatbots Global Market Analysis Report 2025 Featuring Major Players - Amazon, Google, Microsoft, Meta, IBM, Salesforce - Long-term Forecast to 2029 and 2034
summary: The generative AI in chatbots market is experiencing rapid growth, driven by demand for personalization, cloud integration, and automation in customer service, with projections to reach $35.68 billion by 2029. Key players like Amazon, Google, and Microsoft are leading advancements, including API-driven integration and strategic acquisitions, while factors like global trade relations and ethical AI investments influence the market landscape. North America currently leads, with Asia-Pacific poised for the fastest growth.

title: Penguin Solutions Surpasses Q1 Expectations, Analyst Notes Reduced Reliance on Meta
summary: Penguin Solutions Inc (NASDAQ: PENG) exceeded Q1 earnings and revenue expectations, driven by strong performance in Advanced Computing and Integrated Memory segments. Management reaffirmed full-year guidance, projecting approximately 6% revenue growth.

title: Penguin Solutions Beats Q1 Consensus, Shifts Away From Meta - Penguin Solutions (NASDAQ:PENG)
summary: Penguin Solutions Inc. (NASDAQ:PENG) exceeded Q1 revenue and earnings expectations, driven by strong growth in its Advanced Computing and Integrated Memory segments. Jefferies highlights Oracle as a top large-cap pick, expecting meaningful AI revenue by fiscal 2027, despite concerns about investment costs and project delays.

title: Meta Names C.J. Mahoney Chief Legal Officer | 2026 Leadership - News and Statistics
summary: Meta Platforms has appointed C.J. Mahoney as its new chief legal officer, effective Wednesday, January 7. title: Garmin and Meta announce automotive OEM proof of concept with Garmin Unified Cabin and Meta Neural Band

The collaboration aims to enhance convenience and situational awareness within vehicles.

The collaboration highlights advancements in digital cockpits and gesture control, extending Garmin's focus on innovative automotive OEM solutions.

The company, which emerged from bankruptcy in 2016, also has a diverse asset mix that supports its growth strategy.

summary: The S&P 500 recently pulled back from an intraday all-time high, as a rally in Alphabet lost momentum despite ongoing optimism surrounding AI-driven growth. Investors are also looking forward to upcoming earnings reports from companies like Constellation Brands and monitoring oil price movements tied to international events.

North America is the dominant region, with Asia Pacific showing the fastest growth. Major players in this market include YouTube, Spotify, Meta Platforms, Apple Inc., and Amazon Music.

Meanwhile, CES highlights AI chip advancements and autonomous driving, with Waymo remaining a key industry player.

summary: Alphabet Inc.'s 'TorchTPU' initiative, with Meta as a key partner, directly challenges Nvidia in both hardware and software. Despite a rising forward P/E, the author believes GOOG's growth trajectory, especially as a direct competitor to Nvidia, justifies its premium valuation.

title: Why We Highly Rate JPMorgan Large Cap Growth
summary: JPMorgan Large Cap Growth R6 (JLGMX) receives a Gold Morningstar Medalist Rating due to its highly experienced lead manager, Giri Devulapally, and a solid team of sector analysts. The fund's strategy combines robust fundamental research with a momentum component, enabling early identification and long-term holding of market-winning companies like NVIDIA and Tesla. Devulapally's tenure has resulted in impressive performance, consistently outperforming peers and the Russell 1000 Growth Index while effectively managing market volatility.

summary: Goldman Sachs projects the S&P 500 to reach 7,600 by 2026, driven by strong earnings growth and AI adoption, expecting a 12% total return. However, the firm highlights elevated market valuations as a significant risk that could lead to substantial volatility if corporate performance disappoints. The investment bank also points out concentration risk in the S&P 500, with a few mega-cap stocks heavily influencing index returns.

title: How Investors May Respond To Pure Storage (PSTG) Emerging As An AI-Optimized Storage Partner For NVIDIA
summary: Pure Storage (PSTG) is gaining recognition as a key AI-optimized storage provider, partnering with companies like NVIDIA and Meta. Investors are monitoring whether AI-driven demand will justify rising R&D and infrastructure spending, with varying fair value estimates reflecting different perspectives on its long-term profitability.

title: New in-car tech lets you talk, gesture and share screens from any seat
summary: Garmin unveiled Unified Cabin 2026 at CES, featuring an AI/LLM-based virtual assistant that is conversational, multi-intent, and multi-lingual. This next-generation automotive domain controller runs on a single SoC and one Android Automotive OS instance, offering advanced features like UWB digital key, seat-scoped personalization, and per-seat private audio/video chats. The system aims to provide a premium, immersive in-cabin experience for drivers and passengers by unifying displays, sensors, lighting, audio, and RF.

title: Garmin introduces Unified Cabin 2026, headlined by an AI/LLM-based conversational, multi-intent, multi-lingual virtual assistant
summary: Garmin has unveiled its Unified Cabin 2026 at CES, featuring a next-generation AI/LLM-based virtual assistant that is conversational, multi-intent, and multi-lingual. This system, running on a single SoC, integrates various cabin functionalities like seat-aware audio/video, digital key, and AI-generated environments across a six-screen display surface. The company emphasizes its co-development approach with OEMs to deliver an immersive in-cabin experience.

title: How Investors May Respond To Nebius Group (NBIS) Multibillion-Dollar AI Cloud Deals With Microsoft And Meta
summary: Nebius Group recently secured significant AI infrastructure contracts with Meta and Microsoft, totaling over $20 billion, coinciding with the launch of its AI Cloud 3.1 platform. These deals reinforce the company's focus on large-scale AI workloads but also introduce execution risks related to data center buildouts. Investors are weighing Nebius's revenue forecasts and potential upside against the crucial need for timely GPU capacity deployment.

title: AI-First Hyperscalers: 2026’s Sprint Meets the Power Bottleneck
summary: In 2026, hyperscalers are aggressively expanding their AI-first infrastructure, with a projected doubling of total data center capacity within twelve quarters and capital expenditures exceeding $600 billion. However, this rapid growth is encountering significant challenges, including power constraints, long equipment lead times, local opposition, and the need to address growing sustainability pressures. The shift towards AI-optimized data centers, requiring tens of gigawatts of power, is driving innovative strategies across major players like AWS, Microsoft, Google, Meta, and Oracle, while also pushing the industry to prioritize renewable energy and advanced cooling solutions amidst increasing grid pressure and geopolitical regulations.

title: Can Surging AI Cloud Orders Power Ciena's FY26 Revenue Expansion?
summary: Ciena Corporation is entering fiscal 2026 with strong momentum, driven by increasing demand for high-speed connectivity solutions due to the rapid expansion of AI workloads. The company reported record financial results in fiscal 2025, with significant growth in revenue fueled by surging cloud and service provider orders. Ciena anticipates continued robust growth in fiscal 2026, supported by a substantial backlog and expanding opportunities in data centers.

title: Nvidia's new AI computing platform makes leap with new TSMC-made chips
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced the company's new "Vera Rubin" AI computing platform during a keynote speech at CES 2026. This platform features six new chips produced by Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) using their advanced 3-nanometer process and marks a strategic shift from Nvidia's previous chip development cadence due to the accelerating growth of AI models. The flagship system for this platform, the Nvidia Vera Rubin NVL72, is a liquid-cooled supercomputer designed to significantly reduce inference costs and GPU requirements for training AI models, with major tech companies expected to adopt it.

title: META PLATFORMS INC-CLASS A (NASDAQ:META) Passes the Peter Lynch GARP Filter
summary: META PLATFORMS INC-CLASS A (NASDAQ:META) has passed the Peter Lynch Growth at a Reasonable Price (GARP) filter, indicating it is a well-run, expanding company available at a sensible price. The analysis highlights Meta's strong earnings growth, low PEG ratio, high return on equity, and sound financial condition with low debt. While fitting the quantitative criteria, investors are advised to also consider non-quantitative factors like Meta's metaverse investments and regulatory environment.

(ESP), and NeurAxis, Inc. (NRXS). It provides an overview of each company's recent performance, growth drivers, and potential risks, based on analyses by Zacks Equity Research. The guide aims to help brands combat declining search referral traffic and enhance their presence where potential buyers and AI models are gathering information. It covers the evolving B2B buying journey, the impact of AI, and practical advice on utilizing Reddit's communities and ad tools for maximum impact.

title: Why Adobe Stock Is Falling Today

KeyBanc also previously downgraded Adobe, citing rising competition from companies such as Alphabet, Meta, OpenAI, Figma, and Canva.

summary: Arm Holdings (ARM) is gaining attention due to a new AI partnership with Meta and plans to acquire DreamBig Semiconductor, intended to enhance its AI efficiency and networking capabilities. summary: AMD has unveiled its Instinct MI450 accelerator and Helios server rack platform, aiming to disrupt NVIDIA's dominance in the high-end generative AI market. This move, backed by partnerships with Meta, Oracle, and OpenAI, emphasizes open standards and massive memory capacity to address the "memory wall" in AI scaling.

title: 5 AI and Robotics ETFs for 2026’s Investment Supercycle
summary: The article highlights five AI and robotics ETFs poised to benefit from the ongoing investment supercycle into AI, automation, and robotics in 2026. The author emphasizes that while these are not income plays, they offer significant capital appreciation potential in the fastest-growing sectors.

summary: Pure Storage (PSTG) is gaining attention due to its high-density, power-efficient storage platforms and its role in AI data centers, as recognized by Gartner. title: Why Upwork (UPWK) Stock Is Trading Up Today

title: The Truth About Criteo SA (CRTO): Ad-Tech Underdog That Might Be Seriously Underpriced

Investors view CRTO as a potentially underestimated infrastructure play in the ad-tech space, presenting a risk-reward opportunity for long-term holders willing to navigate industry volatility.

title: Microsoft CEO Nadella: AI as Cognitive Amplifier to Transform 2026

title: Could Utility Stocks Be the Next Big AI Winners?

(NASDAQ:GOOGL) by 26.3% in the third quarter, making it their 5th largest holding valued at approximately $8.30 million. summary: Micron's strong earnings and guidance have significantly boosted the S&P 500, rekindling the AI trade. The company beat EPS and revenue expectations, and Bank of America upgraded Micron shares to a buy rating with a $300 price target. Additionally, lower-than-expected November CPI data suggests cooling inflation, which could lead the Federal Reserve to continue cutting interest rates, further supporting the market rally.

title: Meta Platforms (META) director reports 580-share planned stock sale
summary: A Meta Platforms, Inc. director sold 580 shares of Class A common stock on December 15, 2025, at $646 per share, as part of a pre-arranged Rule 10b5-1 trading plan adopted on August 15, 2025. Following this transaction, the director beneficially owns 6,167 Meta Class A shares. The sale was reported in an SEC Form 4 filing.

title: Osprey Private Wealth LLC Has $4.24 Million Holdings in Cisco Systems, Inc. $CSCO
summary: Osprey Private Wealth LLC increased its stake in Cisco Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ:CSCO) by 28.4% in the third quarter, holding 61,985 shares valued at $4.241 million. Despite significant insider selling, including CEO Charles Robbins and EVP Deborah Stahlkopf disposing of shares worth millions, analysts remain generally bullish. Several firms have raised price targets, contributing to a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating with an average target of $84.55 for CSCO.

title: After Earnings, Is Broadcom Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Broadcom (AVGO) experienced strong fiscal fourth-quarter results, prompting Morningstar to raise its fair value estimate to $480 per share due to accelerating AI chip business growth. The company secured impressive AI chip orders and is expected to see significant momentum continuing into 2027, making its stock moderately undervalued. Despite some concerns regarding gross margin dilution and a high uncertainty rating, Broadcom maintains a wide economic moat and strong financial health with robust cash generation.

title: IAC (IAC): Buy, Sell, or Hold Post Q3 Earnings?
summary: This report analyzes IAC (IAC) following its Q3 earnings, suggesting caution due to flat long-term revenue growth, declining EPS, and negative returns on invested capital. The authors advise investors to be careful with IAC given its current valuation and recommend exploring other high-quality stock opportunities.

title: JOYY Inc. (JOYY): A Bull Case Theory
summary: This article summarizes a bullish thesis on JOYY Inc., highlighting the company's strong capital return program through dividends and share repurchases, along with its cash-rich balance sheet providing downside protection. Despite being undervalued, JOYY's AdTech and SaaS initiatives show accelerating momentum, particularly BIGO Ads, which could drive a significant rerating for the stock. The author points out that while the core live-streaming business is mature, innovations in AI-driven ad models are improving advertiser ROI.

title: Arm Holdings Stock (NASDAQ: ARM) News Today: Goldman Downgrade, AI Momentum, and Fresh 2026 Forecasts (Dec. 18, 2025)
summary: Arm Holdings (NASDAQ: ARM) stock experienced a downdraft after Goldman Sachs downgraded it to "Sell," citing limited direct leverage to the AI cycle compared to other hardware plays. Despite this, the company reported strong Q2 fiscal 2026 revenue growth driven by increased royalties and licensing. Investors are now focused on Armv9 adoption, data center penetration, and the company's strategic shifts into more complete chip solutions, while also weighing geopolitical risks and the rise of RISC-V.

title: Why Oracle stock is crashing over 4% today
summary: Oracle's stock dropped over 4% after a report revealed that Blue Owl Capital would not be backing a proposed $10 billion data center deal for an AI infrastructure project, raising concerns about financing for the Michigan facility. This news contributed to an ongoing selloff for Oracle, which has fallen almost 40% in the last three months, despite some analysts maintaining a bullish outlook on the stock. The event highlights investor sensitivity to financing and execution risks in the AI infrastructure boom.

title: New Cognyte Report Examines How Gen Z & Alpha Are Reshaping Crime
summary: Cognyte Software Ltd. has released a new report titled "Crime Goes Digital Native: The Impact of Gen Z & Alpha on Law Enforcement." This report explores how younger generations, including Gen Z and Gen Alpha, are fundamentally changing the nature of crime and public safety through their digital fluency and use of unmonitored online spaces. It emphasizes the need for law enforcement to adapt investigations, prevention strategies, and digital preparedness to address these evolving threats.

title: TD Cowen Maintains Buy Rating on Meta Platforms (META) Stock
summary: TD Cowen analyst John Blackledge has reiterated a "Buy" rating on Meta Platforms (META) stock with an $810 price objective, citing strategic cost management through reduced Metaverse expenses and potential for earnings growth. The company plans to cut Metaverse-related costs by approximately 30% by 2026, saving $5 billion-$6 billion, which could offset increased AI infrastructure spending. While Morgan Stanley adjusted its price objective downwards, it maintained an "Overweight" rating, recognizing Meta's ability to leverage data, distribution, and AI investments for future earnings and technological leadership.

title: Meta Platforms, Inc. (META) Boasts Significant Upside Potential Despite Morgan Stanley Price Target Cut
summary: Morgan Stanley cut its price target for Meta Platforms Inc. (META) to $750 from $820, while reiterating an "Overweight" rating. Despite concerns over revenue durability and operating expenses, the new target still implies significant upside potential for Meta. The company is pivoting to a closed, monetizable AI model called "Avocado," expected next spring, departing from its previous open-source approach with Llama 4.

title: Hut 8 Selects Southeast Louisiana as Site of $10 Billion Artificial Intelligence Data Center
summary: Hut 8 is developing the River Bend artificial intelligence (AI) data center campus in Southeast Louisiana, representing a potential $10 billion investment in its first phase and an estimated 268 new job opportunities. This project, supported by Fluidstack and Entergy Louisiana, aims to establish Louisiana as a hub for high-performance computing. Construction has begun, with operations anticipated to start by the second quarter of 2027.

title: Alphabet (GOOG) Stock After Hours Today (Dec. 17, 2025): Google’s AI-Chip Push, Gemini 3 Flash Rollout, and What to Watch Before Thursday’s Market Open
summary: Alphabet's Class C shares (NASDAQ: GOOG) saw a volatile session, closing sharply lower amidst broader tech pullbacks driven by anxiety over AI infrastructure costs. Despite this, Google made significant announcements regarding its AI chip development (TorchTPU), the global rollout of Gemini 3 Flash, and long-term strategic moves like Waymo fundraising talks and YouTube securing Oscars streaming rights. Investors are advised to watch Thursday's CPI and Philadelphia Fed Manufacturing Survey for potential market movements.

title: Arista Networks Stock (ANET) News Today: Fortinet AI Data Center Partnership, Morgan Stanley Target Cut, and Wall Street’s 2026 Forecasts
summary: Arista Networks (ANET) is experiencing a dynamic trading day driven by a new "secure AI data center" partnership with Fortinet, a Morgan Stanley price target reduction despite an Overweight rating, and positive forecasts from Zacks regarding its AI prospects into 2026. The stock was down roughly 3% on Wednesday, with investors grappling with its AI networking demand, valuation, and technical analysis suggesting cooled but not broken momentum. Arista’s strong Q3 2025 performance and ambitious AI-center growth targets for 2026 underpin investor debate, balancing its strategic positioning in AI infrastructure against valuation concerns and competitive pressures.

title: Constellation Energy (CEG) Stock News Today: NRC Extends Key Nuclear Licenses, Calpine Deal Nears Closing, and Analysts Refresh Price Targets (Dec. 17, 2025)
summary: Constellation Energy (CEG) stock is under scrutiny due to recent nuclear license renewals by the NRC for Illinois plants and progress on the Calpine acquisition, which included DOJ-mandated divestitures. Despite strong fundamental news, the stock experienced a sharp drop, influenced by a broader "risk-off" trend in AI-linked investments. Analysts have largely maintained positive outlooks, with refreshed price targets ranging from $410 to $481, reflecting the company's long-term strategic relevance amid increasing AI power demand.

title: Has the AI boom turned into a bubble?
summary: This article addresses concerns about whether the current AI boom constitutes a market bubble similar to the dot-com era. The author argues that despite soaring valuations and increased capital expenditures by hyperscalers, the underlying fundamentals are stronger today, with profitability rising alongside valuations for many AI companies. The T. Rowe Price Asset Allocation Committee maintains a neutral stance between U.S. growth and value equities, advocating for a balanced approach to participate in AI's potential without overexposure.

title: Is Rising Institutional Ownership And An Analyst Upgrade Altering The Investment Case For Winmark (WINA)?
summary: Institutional investors and an analyst upgrade are boosting sentiment for Winmark (WINA), despite its mature business model and financial challenges like high debt and negative equity. While fundamentals remain unchanged, the increased institutional backing and upgrade may support the stock after a recent pullback. However, differing valuations among investors highlight varying perspectives on Winmark's risk and reward balance.

title: Hut 8 selects Entergy, Southeast Louisiana for $10 billion artificial intelligence data center
summary: Hut 8 announced it will develop the River Bend artificial intelligence (AI) data center campus in Southeast Louisiana, representing an investment of up to $10 billion in Phase I. This project is expected to create at least 75 direct new jobs, with the potential for an additional 193 indirect jobs, and will leverage Entergy Louisiana to provide initial utility capacity. Fluidstack will be a key tenant, and the facility positions Louisiana as a significant hub for high-performance computing, with construction already underway and operations planned for Q2 2027.

title: Arista Networks (ANET) Teams Up with Fortinet for AI Data Center Solution
summary: Arista Networks (ANET) and Fortinet have collaborated to launch a new SecureAI Data Center solution, enhancing AI infrastructure with integrated security and high performance. This partnership aims to provide organizations with a robust framework for scaling AI capabilities securely and efficiently. Arista Networks demonstrates strong financial health with significant revenue growth and profitability, though its valuation metrics indicate premium market pricing.

title: FTI Consulting (FCN) Expands with Expert in AI and Digital Platf
summary: FTI Consulting has enhanced its digital economy capabilities by adding Dr. Xi Chen, an expert in AI, machine learning, and quantitative economics, to its subsidiary, Compass Lexecon. This strategic hire is expected to deepen the firm's engagement with complex digital market issues, including competition, advertising, pricing, and the economic implications of new technologies like blockchain and generative AI. Despite recent challenges, FTI Consulting maintains strong financial health and a low-volatility risk profile.

title: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL): An In-Depth Analysis of the AI Powerhouse Amidst Regulatory Crosswinds (December 17, 2025)
summary: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) remains a dominant force in technology, driven by its "AI-first" strategy, substantial investments in AI with projected capital expenditures of $91-$93 billion in 2025, and the rapid growth of Google Cloud. The company achieved a historic $100 billion revenue quarter in Q3 2025, with strong performance across its advertising and cloud segments, and its stock has seen exceptional gains over the past year. Despite facing significant regulatory scrutiny and antitrust investigations globally, Alphabet's strategic focus on AI integration and diversification through "Other Bets" positions it for continued influence and financial growth.

title: Park National Corp OH Increases Holdings in Meta Platforms, Inc. $META
summary: Park National Corp OH has increased its stake in Meta Platforms, Inc. (META) by 7.6% in the third quarter, now owning 62,149 shares valued at $45,641,000, making META its 12th largest holding. Meta recently beat earnings expectations with $7.25 EPS and $51.24 billion in revenue, also declaring a quarterly dividend of $0.525 per share. Analysts generally rate the stock as a "Moderate Buy" with a consensus price target of $819.46.

title: Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights: First Solar, Arista Networks, Microsoft and Meta
summary: This article from Zacks Investment Research highlights First Solar (FSLR) and Arista Networks (ANET) as top AI-boosted stocks to consider buying in 2026.
