It details why these companies are poised for significant growth, with First Solar benefiting from the energy boom and domestic manufacturing, and Arista Networks playing a crucial role in AI infrastructure through partnerships with tech giants like Meta and Microsoft.

title: Navigate Meta Platform's Crosscurrents With Direxion's METU And METD ETFs
summary: This article discusses the investment prospects of Meta Platforms (META) and how investors can navigate its volatility using Direxion's leveraged ETFs, METU (2x Bull) and METD (1x Bear). While Meta has shown strong historical performance and recent earnings beats, concerns about increased AI spending and recent stock underperformance exist. The article details the performance and risks associated with these Direxion ETFs for both bullish and bearish investors.

title: KULR Technology Group Enters Joint Development
summary: KULR Technology Group (NYSE American: KULR) has entered a joint development collaboration with a leading global battery-cell manufacturer to co-develop a next-generation KULR ONE® MAX Battery Backup Unit (BBU) product line for AI-scale data centers. This initiative aims to establish a commercial program with a projected value of up to $100 million, leveraging KULR's expertise in design, safety engineering, and UL certification. The BBU system will be optimized around an ultra-high-power 21700 cell architecture to support demanding AI server workloads and will meet Meta Open Compute Project (OCP) ORV3 standard and NVIDIA GPU roadmap requirements.

title: NACCO Industries amends retirement plan and ends consulting agreement with Rankin
summary: NACCO Industries (NYSE:NC) has announced significant changes to its executive compensation and consulting agreements. The company amended its Excess Retirement Plan to allow separate deferral elections and terminated its consulting agreement with Alfred M. Rankin, Jr. These moves follow a strong year for NACCO Industries, marked by a 70% stock surge and recent financial developments including increased revenue, a new stock repurchase program, and dual stock listing.

title: Amazon to invest $10B in OpenAI and provide chips for ChatGPT maker: report
summary: OpenAI is reportedly in discussions with Amazon for a $10 billion investment, which could also involve OpenAI adopting Amazon’s in-house Trainium chips. This potential deal would value OpenAI at over $500 billion, deepening ties between the ChatGPT maker and Amazon. It also signifies Amazon's strategy to challenge Nvidia's dominance in AI chips and AWS's efforts to attract more AI developers amidst fierce competition.

title: Alphabet Seizes Mag 7 Crown With 62% Stock Surge — But Amazon's Bargain Is The Plot Twist
summary: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ: GOOG, NASDAQ: GOOGL) has significantly outpaced its fellow "Magnificent 7" stocks this year with a 62.26% surge, making it the top performer and solidifying its position among mega-cap companies. Conversely, Amazon.com Inc (NASDAQ: AMZN) has lagged dramatically with only a 1.05% year-to-date gain, but its consequently lower valuation metrics, like a price-to-sales ratio of 3.48, suggest it might be a bargain compared to its more expensive peers. This creates a contrasting narrative within Big Tech, where Alphabet wears the performance crown while Amazon quietly offers a potential deal.

title: Constellation Energy secures 20-year license extensions for two nuclear plants
summary: Constellation Energy has received 20-year license renewals for its Clinton and Dresden nuclear power plants from the U.S. nuclear regulator, allowing them to operate through 2047, 2049, and 2051 respectively. The company plans to invest over $370 million for these relicensing efforts to boost efficiency and reliability. These extensions support the growing demand for nuclear power driven by AI data centers and industrial electrification, preserving over 2,200 jobs and significant tax revenue.

title: Tripadvisor Valuation Check After Strategic Repositioning And Modest 10.7% Share Price Gain
summary: Tripadvisor (TRIP) has seen a modest 10.7% share price gain over the last year, remaining largely flat year-to-date, indicating market uncertainty despite strategic repositioning. A Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests the stock is undervalued by 53.1%, with an estimated fair value of $31.86 per share. However, its Price-to-Earnings (PE) ratio of 22.1x is above industry averages, with a Fair Ratio indicating it might be slightly overvalued based on earnings multiples.

title: Site work begins at Oracle, OpenAI data-center campus in Port Washington
summary: Site work has commenced on the $15 billion Vantage Data Center campus in Port Washington, which will serve Oracle and OpenAI. The project is expected to employ thousands of people, with work ramping up significantly next year. This development is part of a larger trend of increased data center investment in Wisconsin.

title: Amgen (AMGN) Price Target Trimmed at Morgan Stanley as Policy Risks Ease
summary: Morgan Stanley trimmed its price target for Amgen (AMGN) from $329 to $304, maintaining an Equal Weight rating, citing easing policy risks for the biopharma industry in 2026. This comes after Amgen announced a 6% increase in its quarterly dividend, marking 15 consecutive years of increases, and reported strong Q3 2025 results with a 12% revenue jump and 14% volume growth. The company is also expanding in its main therapeutic areas and investing heavily in US manufacturing.

title: NRC Renews Operating Licenses for Clinton & Dresden; Constellation Investing $370 Million in State-of-the-Art Upgrades to Keep These Illinois Nuclear Facilities Online, Meet Rising Power Demand and Support Economic Growth
summary: The NRC has renewed operating licenses for Constellation's Clinton and Dresden Clean Energy Centers for 20 years, preserving over 2,200 jobs and generating $8.1 billion in tax revenues. Constellation is investing more than $370 million in state-of-the-art upgrades to these facilities, ensuring their continued safety, reliability, and efficiency. This renewal supports Illinois's clean energy future and economic growth by guaranteeing a continued supply of carbon-free power for decades.

title: 3 Insider Moves You Shouldn't Ignore Heading Into 2026
summary: This article examines three significant insider trading activities that offer insights into market confidence ahead of 2026. A Salesforce board member made a substantial $25 million purchase, signaling long-term confidence despite recent stock pressure. Conversely, SoftBank Group trimmed its stake in Symbotic for the first time after a major rally, potentially indicating a shift in risk tolerance. Finally, four Blue Owl Capital executives purchased company shares despite weak performance, suggesting they see untapped upside.

title: Why Procter & Gamble stock may be a better pick than AI hyperscalers for 2026
summary: Famed investor Jim Cramer suggests Procter & Gamble (PG) might be a better investment than AI hyperscalers for 2026. He emphasizes PG's strategy of leveraging AI for efficiency and cost-cutting without massive R&D expenditure. Cramer believes this approach offers more consistent returns compared to AI giants facing immense spending and intense competition.

title: Instagram Debuts Dedicated Television App for Amazon Fire TV
summary: Instagram has launched its first dedicated TV app, allowing users to watch Reels on larger screens. The app will initially be available on Amazon Fire TV, with plans to expand to other television platforms subsequently. This move aims to broaden Instagram's reach and enhance the viewing experience for its short-form video content.

title: Unassuming Evergy Energy: The AI Boost Your Income Portfolio Needs
summary: Evergy Energy (NASDAQ: EVRG), an electrical utility serving the Kansas City region, provides an indirect way for income investors to gain exposure to AI due to its critical location amidst numerous hyperscalers. Analysts are bullish on EVRG, citing a significant project backlog and potential for a bullish upgrade cycle in earnings and stock price targets. Despite institutional selling and elevated short interest creating near-term headwinds, the technical outlook suggests a potential uptrend, driven by strong dividend growth and the company's position to eventually become a Dividend Aristocrat.

title: META PLATFORMS INC-CLASS A CMN CLASS A - Ro Khanna Congressional Trade on Nov. 07, 2025
summary: This article details a congressional trade made by Ro Khanna involving META PLATFORMS INC-CLASS A CMN CLASS A stock on November 07, 2025, with the transaction amount between $15,001 and $50,000. The trade was disclosed on December 08, 2025. It also provides the price change of the stock and the SPY change since the trade.

title: Video gamers score in $1.57M Meta data leak settlement — how to know if you’re eligible
summary: Video game players may be eligible to receive a portion of a $1.57 million class action settlement involving DirectToU and Alliance Entertainment. The companies are accused of sharing consumer information with third parties, including Facebook, through the use of Facebook Pixel technology, violating the federal Video Privacy Protection Act. Eligible class members can claim between $60 and $145 by submitting a claim form by January 20, 2026.

title: IAS LAUNCHES 'IAS AGENT' ENABLING MARKETERS TO SURFACE DEEP CAMPAIGN INSIGHTS IN REAL-TIME AND INCREASE AD PERFORMANCE
summary: Integral Ad Science (IAS) has launched 'IAS Agent,' an AI-powered assistant designed to help marketers activate campaigns faster, uncover insights instantly, and optimize performance. This tool, powered by extensive proprietary data, offers transparent, explainable AI recommendations directly integrated into the IAS user interface. IAS Agent aims to enhance brand governance, campaign insights, and workflow efficiency, expected to roll out globally in early Q1 2026 at no additional cost.

title: Worried About an AI Crash? Here’s How to Diversify Your Portfolio
summary: The article discusses strategies for investors to diversify their portfolios and mitigate risks associated with the volatility of AI stocks. It suggests practices like regular rebalancing, considering equal-weighted funds, looking beyond large-cap growth stocks to small and mid-caps, and broadening exposure to sectors like financials and healthcare. Despite potential pullbacks, the article emphasizes that tech will likely remain a good place to invest, but managing exposure is crucial.

title: Alibaba Poised To Win Big In China's AI Boom: Analyst
summary: Nomura analysts are optimistic about Alibaba's position in China's accelerating AI sector, citing its strategic investments and the scaling of its Qwen models. Alibaba's AI ambitions are also gaining international traction, with Meta Platforms adopting its open-source Qwen models. Despite a recent dip in adjusted net income due to increased spending, the company's Q2 earnings surpassed expectations, driven by growth in e-commerce, international commerce, and cloud intelligence.

title: Utility watchdogs accuse PGE of skirting new law meant to make data centers pay for rising demand
summary: Oregon's largest electrical utility, Portland General Electric (PGE), is accused by utility watchdogs of attempting to circumvent a new law, the POWER Act, which mandates that data centers bear the costs of their growing energy demands. PGE's proposed "Peak Growth Modifier" plan would only directly charge data centers for the first three years of infrastructure investment costs, leaving residential and other customers to fund the remaining 47 years of typical infrastructure investments, despite data centers being the primary driver of demand growth. Critics from the Citizens' Utility Board label this approach as "twisted logic" and advocate for direct assignment of costs to data centers for the entire lifespan of assets primarily serving them.

title: Evaluating Constellation Energy (CEG) Stock's Actual Performance
summary: Constellation Energy (CEG) has demonstrated strong financial performance since its 2022 spinoff from Exelon, driven by a resurgence in demand for nuclear energy. The company boasts impressive total returns that have significantly outpaced the S&P 500, fueled by strategic power purchase agreements with major tech companies like Microsoft and Meta. Its acquisition of Calpine is set to further boost earnings, positioning CEG for continued growth.

title: Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META) Passes Peter Lynch's GARP Investment Screen
summary: Meta Platforms (NASDAQ:META) has successfully passed Peter Lynch's Growth at a Reasonable Price (GARP) investment screen, making it a potential candidate for long-term investors. The company demonstrates strong earnings growth within Lynch's preferred range, a favorable PEG ratio, sound financial health with minimal debt, and high profitability. This comprehensive analysis suggests Meta aligns well with Lynch's criteria for a disciplined investment approach.

title: Constellation Energy (CEG) Stock Today: Calpine Deal Nears Close as Nuclear Data‑Center Contracts Shape 2026 Outlook (Dec. 15, 2025)
summary: Constellation Energy (CEG) is in focus due to its nearing Calpine acquisition, federal support for nuclear power, and momentum in "24/7 carbon-free" power contracts for AI data centers. The article details recent news including a positive Zacks/Nasdaq feature, government initiatives for nuclear-powered data centers, and an "Energy Deal of the Year" award for its Microsoft PPA. The strategic importance of the Calpine deal and long-term nuclear contracts with major tech companies like Microsoft and Meta are highlighted as key drivers for Constellation's future earnings.

title: Jim Cramer makes the case for buying Procter & Gamble stock
summary: Jim Cramer advocates for investing in Procter & Gamble, highlighting its effective use of technology to cut costs and innovate. He distinguishes these "business-to-business users of technology" from "tech hyperscalers" who spend heavily on AI to compete. Cramer suggests P&G is a strong buy due to its efficient operations, current valuation, and dividend yield, contrasting it with increasingly competitive and costly big tech stocks.

title: Tesla board made $3 billion via stock awards that dwarfed tech peers
summary: Tesla's board of directors has collectively earned over $3 billion through stock awards, significantly exceeding the compensation of their peers at other major U.S. technology firms. This discrepancy, highlighted by an Equilar analysis, shows Tesla directors' awards were disproportionately large at the time they were paid, leading to massive windfalls as the company's stock price appreciated. Despite a suspension of new stock grants since 2020 due to a shareholder lawsuit, the existing awards have generated substantial wealth, sparking criticism over director independence and the structure of their compensation.

title: Has the catalyst for stock diversification arrived?
summary: Improving global economic growth and Federal Reserve easing of interest rates could be the long-awaited catalyst for investors to diversify beyond mega-cap technology stocks. While the AI trade continues, the environment is becoming more favorable for broader market participation, including smaller capitalization and value stocks, as evidenced by recent market activity and record highs in small-cap indexes. This shift aligns with Invesco's 2026 annual investment outlook of "Resilience and rebalancing."

title: Comscore (SCOR) Enhances Reporting with New Streaming and Social Capabilities
summary: Comscore (SCOR) has introduced new streaming audio and social reporting capabilities, including campaign-level metrics from Meta platforms, to enhance cross-platform measurement for advertisers. Despite these advancements in interactive media analytics, the company faces significant financial challenges, as indicated by a negative Altman Z-Score and an inability to cover interest expenses, suggesting potential bankruptcy risk. Insider ownership is notably high at 64.13%, yet the stock's valuation metrics reflect its current market challenges.

title: Comscore Expands Cross-Platform Campaign Measurement to Include Audio and Social
summary: Comscore has expanded its cross-platform reporting suite to include streaming audio measurement and enhanced social reporting with campaign-level metrics from Meta's platforms. These new capabilities offer advertisers a more comprehensive view of campaign performance across various digital and linear formats. The company also rebranded its Comscore Campaign Ratings (CCR) to Cross-Platform Campaign Results (CCR) to better reflect its aim of providing a single, deduplicated view of campaign performance.

title: Nvidia Becomes a Major Model Maker With Nemotron 3
summary: Nvidia, traditionally a chipmaker, has released Nemotron 3, a series of open-source AI models, data, and tools, marking its entry into serious model making. This move is strategic, as other AI companies are developing their own chips, potentially reducing their reliance on Nvidia's technology. By embracing open innovation and transparency, Nvidia aims to provide developers with the resources needed to build scalable AI agents, especially important given the rising popularity of open models from Chinese firms.

title: Silicon Valley Capital Partners Sells 17,540 Shares of Intuitive Surgical, Inc. $ISRG
summary: Silicon Valley Capital Partners significantly reduced its stake in Intuitive Surgical, selling 17,540 shares, yet institutional investors still hold approximately 83.64% ownership. Despite insider selling, Intuitive Surgical reported strong Q2 earnings, surpassing analyst estimates for both EPS and revenue. Analysts currently maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for ISRG with a price target of $608.79.

title: Zacks Investment Ideas feature highlights: GE Vernova, Constellation Energy, Nvidia, NextEra and Meta
summary: This article highlights five stocks—GE Vernova, Constellation Energy, Nvidia, NextEra Energy, and Meta—based on their significant roles and potential in the AI-driven energy sector. It emphasizes the soaring demand for electricity due to AI, positioning GE Vernova, Constellation Energy, and NextEra Energy as key players in powering this growth, including through nuclear and renewable energy initiatives. The piece suggests these stocks offer strong investment opportunities with significant growth potential, robust earnings, and dividend payments, particularly those contributing to AI infrastructure.

title: Gavin Newsom saved California’s last nuclear plant. But do we really need it?
summary: Governor Gavin Newsom reversed course and extended the operating life of Diablo Canyon, California's last nuclear power plant, until 2030, despite earlier plans for its closure. This decision, backed by a well-funded campaign and nearly $1.4 billion in state funds, was justified by Newsom as necessary to prevent blackouts, though critics argue some state energy forecasts projected adequate supplies without the plant. The move signifies a broader resurgence of interest in nuclear power, with PG&E now exploring the possibility of keeping Diablo Canyon running until 2045.

title: WPP Crashes 60%--But a Shock AI Twist Could Flip the Ad Game
summary: Shares of WPP Plc have plummeted by 60% this year, largely due to concerns that AI automation will reduce demand for traditional agency services. However, a counter-narrative suggests that AI might not fully disintermediate the advertising industry, as increased media channels could make agencies more valuable for strategic coordination and budget allocation. Despite the current market skepticism reflected in valuations, lower production costs from AI and potential industry consolidation could shift the outlook.

title: IAC stock rating downgraded to Perform by Oppenheimer on valuation concerns
summary: Oppenheimer downgraded IAC/InterActiveCorp (NASDAQ:IAC) from Outperform to Perform due to valuation concerns and limited upside potential, despite the stock's recent strong return. The firm highlighted that IAC's valuation discount is narrowing and its stock is increasingly tied to MGM Resorts, raising questions about Chairman Barry Diller's strategy. Various other analysts have offered mixed perspectives on IAC following its recent Q3 2025 results.

title: CXO Moves: Exec movements across Meta, Omnicom Media Group, OpenAI and more
summary: This article details recent executive movements across major companies including Meta, Omnicom Media Group, OpenAI, Nippon Paint India, and Hinge. Key appointments include Aman Jain as Meta India's Head of Public Policy and Denise Dresser as OpenAI's Chief Revenue Officer. The report also highlights leadership changes at Nippon Paint India, Hinge, and Milton, along with Jeff Williams' nomination to Disney's board.

title: AI infrastructure selloff continues on Wall Street as Broadcom, Oracle shares slide
summary: Shares of Broadcom, CoreWeave, and Oracle have experienced significant declines recently, signaling a shift in investor sentiment regarding AI infrastructure. Despite the AI boom, concerns are growing about the return on investment justifying the massive spending in the sector, particularly as Oracle increases its debt for data center development and Broadcom faces lower gross margins from AI chip production. Analysts highlight Oracle's high debt-to-equity ratio compared to its cloud computing peers, contributing to investor apprehension.

title: NextEra Energy (NEE) Stock: AI Data Center Boom and 8% EPS Growth Target Power December 2025 Outlook
summary: NextEra Energy (NEE) is positioning itself as a key power provider for the AI boom, securing multi-gigawatt partnerships with Google Cloud and Meta Platforms, and targeting 8%+ adjusted EPS growth through 2035. The company is actively expanding its generation, transmission, and natural gas marketing capabilities to meet surging AI data center demand. Wall Street analysts largely rate NEE as Buy/Strong Buy, with consensus price targets suggesting a 12-14% upside, despite a premium valuation and modest increase in short interest.

title: Mag 7 Face AI Monetization Year — JPMorgan Says Google, Amazon, Meta Rise Above
summary: JPMorgan predicts that 2026 will be the "AI Monetization Year" for the Magnificent 7 tech giants, a period when their significant AI investments must translate into revenue. Despite massive spending across the group, JPMorgan believes only Google, Amazon, and Meta are positioned to successfully monetize their AI initiatives. The report highlights Google's full-stack AI acceleration, Amazon's unexpected AWS comeback, and Meta's strong revenue growth driven by AI-boosted ads.

title: หุ้น Airbnb Inc | ราคาหุ้น ABNB
summary: บทความนี้ให้ข้อมูลราคาหุ้น ABNB ของ Airbnb Inc. รวมถึงข้อมูลย้อนหลัง กราฟ ข้อมูลบริษัท การวิเคราะห์ทางเทคนิค และข่าวล่าสุด นอกจากนี้ยังมีการวิเคราะห์สุขภาพทางการเงิน การประมาณการราคาแท้จริง และคำแนะนำจากนักวิเคราะห์ ซึ่งแสดงให้เห็นว่านักวิเคราะห์ส่วนใหญ่แนะนำให้ "ถือหุ้นไว้" โดยมีเป้าหมายราคาเฉลี่ยที่สูงกว่าราคาปัจจุบันเล็กน้อย

title: Constellation Energy (CEG) Stock: Calpine Deal Milestones, Nuclear Restart Momentum, and What to Watch Next Week (Updated Dec. 13, 2025)
summary: Constellation Energy (NASDAQ: CEG) experienced a volatile week ending December 12, 2025, with its stock closing down 7% on Friday, despite a modest weekly decline. The company is navigating significant events including progress on its $16.4 billion Calpine acquisition with DOJ agreement and FERC approval, and continued momentum in the nuclear energy sector bolstered by awards and federal support. Upcoming catalysts include a FERC meeting on data center co-location in PJM and further updates on Calpine deal mechanics, all contributing to a strong narrative but volatile trading environment for CEG.

title: Meta Platforms price target lowered to $750 from $820 at Morgan Stanley
summary: Morgan Stanley lowered its price target on Meta Platforms (META) to $750 from $820, while maintaining an Overweight rating. The firm reduced its FY26 and FY27 EPS estimates by approximately 8% due to higher operating expense expectations, now modeling $33 for FY27 EPS. Despite negative investor sentiment, the analyst believes Meta's revenue growth and innovation are "underappreciated," citing a $1,000 per share "bull case" for the stock.

title: Jim Cramer Calls Booking Holdings the "Superior Operator" Compared to Expedia
summary: Jim Cramer favors Booking Holdings Inc. (BKNG) over Expedia, citing its resilience and superior operational capabilities. He believes both online travel agencies will perform well due to stronger-than-anticipated consumer resilience. Wedgewood Partners also praised Booking Holdings' strong revenue growth, focus on direct bookings, and differentiated approach in ex-U.S. markets.

title: Why Analysts Think Five9 Could Climb Over 60% From Current Levels
summary: Analysts project Five9, Inc. (NASDAQ:FIVN) could see over 60% upside from its current share price, with a consensus Moderate Buy rating and an average 12-month price target of $34-$35. The company recently launched "Genius AI" upgrades to enhance contact center automation and customer experience. While Five9 shows potential, the article also highlights other AI investment opportunities with potentially higher returns.

title: Analysts’ Opinions Are Mixed on These Communication Services Stocks: Meta Platforms (META), Netflix (NFLX) and IMAX (IMAX)
summary: Analysts have presented mixed opinions on several Communication Services stocks. Meta Platforms (META) received a Strong Buy consensus, with analyst Mark Shmulik maintaining a Buy rating. Netflix (NFLX) was downgraded to Hold by Rosenblatt Securities, resulting in a Moderate Buy consensus. IMAX (IMAX) maintained a Buy rating from Rosenblatt Securities and has a Strong Buy consensus among analysts.

title: Top metaverse platforms in 2026, rise of spatial computing
summary: This article identifies the top 15 metaverse platforms for 2026, highlighting their evolution into "spatial computing" and expansion into various sectors, including consumer, enterprise, and industrial applications. It discusses how AI is becoming the new UI for spatial computing and the future direction of hardware towards lighter, AI-enhanced devices. The piece also touches on privacy, security, and challenges for businesses adopting these technologies.

title: Wall Street Analysts See Unity Software (U) as a Buy: Should You Invest?
summary: Wall Street analysts currently have an average brokerage recommendation (ABR) of 2.00, or a "Buy," for Unity Software (U), based on 22 brokerage firms. Despite this, investors are cautioned against solely relying on ABRs due to potential positive biases from brokerage firms. The article suggests validating this information with tools like the Zacks Rank, which for Unity Software, is currently a #3 (Hold) due to unchanged earnings estimates.

title: Broadcom Earnings: Buy the Dip Before the Rocket Takes Off
summary: Broadcom reported strong fiscal fourth-quarter results, surpassing guidance, with impressive artificial intelligence revenue forecasts. The company secured an $11 billion AI chip order from Anthropic and announced a new custom AI chip customer for 2026. This significant growth in its AI chip business has led Morningstar to raise its fair value estimate for Broadcom from $365 to $480 per share, viewing a recent 5% after-hours selloff as a buying opportunity.

title: Mizuho Securities Sticks to Their Buy Rating for Alphabet Class A (GOOGL)
summary: Mizuho Securities has reiterated its "Buy" rating for Alphabet Class A (GOOGL) with a price target of $365.00, following a similar bullish stance from Piper Sandler. However, Cantor Fitzgerald recently maintained a "Hold" rating for the company. Alphabet reported strong Q3 earnings with revenues of $102.35 billion and a net profit of $34.98 billion.

title: Entergy (ETR) Breaks Ground on Louisiana Power Plants
summary: Entergy Corporation (ETR) has broken ground on two new natural gas power plants in Louisiana, which will add approximately 1.5 GW of generation capacity to support Meta's hyperscale campus. These facilities are expected to come online by late 2028 and deliver significant customer savings. The company has also updated its capital plan, targeting $41 billion in spending from 2026 to 2029, driven by growing data center demand.

title: Fear of Missing Out on data center boom leads Arkansas officials to ignore hard questions
summary: Arkansas officials are enthusiastically pursuing data center projects, offering tax breaks and utility concessions due to "Fear of Missing Out" (FOMO) on the AI boom. However, this article questions whether the modest job gains justify the significant infrastructure costs, potential environmental impact, and secretive negotiation tactics that shift financial burdens to consumers and lack public scrutiny. The author points to Virginia's experience with data centers, where initial enthusiasm has given way to regret over high utility rates and environmental concerns, suggesting Arkansas might be making similar mistakes.

title: Google's 'secret weapon' in AI race against OpenAI is what has been giving nightmares to Nvidia
summary: Google's Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) are emerging as a significant challenger to Nvidia's dominance in AI hardware, with reports suggesting Meta is evaluating their use. Google is now actively offering these custom chips to external cloud providers to broaden their adoption and overcome deployment limitations. While Nvidia acknowledges Google's innovations, it reasserts its leading position in the industry, even as Google's moves prompt a re-evaluation of the AI hardware landscape.

title: Criteo (CRTO): Reassessing Valuation After Strong Q3 Beat and Confident Analyst Outlook
summary: Criteo (CRTO) significantly beat Q3 2025 expectations, leading to a bounce in its share price, although it remains down significantly year-to-date. Despite past struggles and a steep discount to analyst targets, the market views Criteo as 41.5% undervalued with a fair value of $35.92, driven by anticipated boosts from AI-powered ad targeting and Agentic AI solutions leveraging its commerce data. Investors are now evaluating if Criteo is undervalued after its reset or if the market is already factoring in future growth.

title: Is a wide moat better than a well-managed company? Here’s what the data says
summary: This article compares the impact of economic moats versus management quality on stock performance, concluding that a strong economic moat generally outweighs exceptional management teams. The author supports this by analyzing recent stock performance data and the mixed track record of mergers and acquisitions. It also cautions investors about dual share classes and their implications for shareholder influence and valuation.

title: Oracle's lease commitments jump by almost 150% as company builds out to meet AI demand
summary: Oracle is significantly increasing its capital expenditures and lease commitments to meet the surging demand for cloud infrastructure driven by artificial intelligence. The company reported $248 billion in lease commitments as of November 30, a 148% increase from August, with $10 billion allocated specifically for cloud capacity. This expansion includes partnerships with major AI players like OpenAI, as Oracle aims to compete with industry giants like Amazon and Microsoft in providing critical computing power.

title: Broadcom Turned In Strong Earnings. But Will They Revive the AI Trade?
summary: Broadcom (AVGO) reported better-than-expected earnings driven by AI demand, projecting continued momentum and a 10% dividend increase. Despite strong results, the news failed to immediately reignite the broader AI trade, which had been shaken by Oracle's disappointing earnings. Investors were hoping Broadcom's performance could restore confidence in AI-exposed stocks after a recent tech sell-off.

title: Micron (MU) After Hours: What to Know Before the Stock Market Opens on December 12, 2025
summary: Micron Technology (MU) closed Thursday down 2% but rebounded slightly after hours. The stock, which is up over 200% year-to-date, saw weakness due to Oracle's disappointing earnings, which affected other AI-linked tech stocks. Despite this, analysts have raised price targets for Micron, underscoring strong demand for its AI memory products and a strategic shift towards higher-margin data center business.

title: SPY ETF at $688: AI Earnings And S&P 500 8,100 Target
summary: The SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (NYSEARCA:SPY) trades at $688.39, driven by AI-fueled profit margins, softer Fed policy, and strong earnings expectations for 2025 and 2026. Despite being at record highs, the article suggests the SPY ETF could reach price targets between $730 and $812 by 2026, implying an 11-18% upside, if macro conditions remain supportive and earnings continue to grow as projected. While acknowledging valuation and volatility risks, the overall verdict is a "Buy" due to sustained earnings growth, favorable macro conditions, and strong investor flows.

title: META PLATFORMS INC-CLASS A CMN CLASS A - Ro Khanna Congressional Trade on Nov. 24, 2025
summary: This article details a congressional stock trade made by Representative Ro Khanna involving META PLATFORMS INC-CLASS A CMN CLASS A stock. The transaction, a purchase valued between $1,001 and $15,000, occurred on November 24, 2025, and was disclosed on December 8, 2025. Since the trade, the stock has shown a slight increase of 0.47%, underperforming the SPY, which increased by 1.94%.

title: After Nvidia’s White House ‘coup,’ China may not be buying
summary: Despite initial reports that the White House approved sales of Nvidia's H200 chips to China, new information suggests China may not be interested in purchasing a significant number of them. The Chinese government, led by President Xi Jinping, is reportedly planning to restrict imports of the H200s, preferring domestically-made chips from companies like Huawei and expressing security concerns. This move could hinder Nvidia's potential earnings from the Chinese market, even with the approved conditional sales.

title: Sam Altman Sounds Alarm As ChatGPT Explodes Globally: 'Rate Of Change' Sparks AI Anxiety, Job Fears
summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has raised concerns about the accelerating pace of AI development, particularly with ChatGPT's rapid global adoption, stating that society is struggling to keep up with the rate of change. He acknowledges the potential for job disruption but expresses confidence in humanity's ability to adapt and create new roles, even as other tech leaders like Sundar Pichai and Geoffrey Hinton voice differing views on AI's impact on employment and the economy.

title: Guggenheim Initiates Coverage of Amazon.com (AMZN) with "Buy" Rating and $300 Price Target
summary: Guggenheim has initiated coverage of Amazon.com (AMZN) with a "Buy" rating and a $300 price target, acknowledging the retail sector's resilience despite perceived weaknesses and strong gross margins. Rosenblatt Securities also reiterated a "Buy" rating with a $305 target, citing strong enterprise adoption, Amazon's growing role in AI and cloud markets, and undervalued cash flow potential. The company's recent launch of faster and more energy-efficient Graviton5-based EC2 M9g instances further highlights its technological advancements.

title: Ex-Dividend Reminder: Meta Platforms, Wyndham Hotels & Resorts and Dominos Pizza
summary: Meta Platforms Inc (META), Wyndham Hotels & Resorts Inc (WH), and Dominos Pizza Inc. (DPZ) are set to trade ex-dividend on December 15, 2025. These companies will pay quarterly dividends of $0.525, $0.41, and $1.74 respectively. Dominos Pizza is also noted as a "future dividend aristocrats contender" with over 15 years of dividend increases.

title: Is It Too Late To Consider VeriSign After Its Recent 18% Year To Date Surge
summary: VeriSign (VRSN) has surged 18.1% year to date and 22.2% over the last year, reflecting strong momentum and investor refocus on its core internet infrastructure role and contract-based revenue. Despite recent minor dips, the stock is considered undervalued by Simply Wall St's valuation framework, particularly its discounted cash flow (DCF) analysis, which prices it very close to its calculated fair value of $243.75 per share compared to the current $242. Its P/E ratio of 27.7x is also below the broader IT industry average, suggesting a relative discount despite solid fundamentals.

title: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL): Navigating the AI Frontier Amidst Regulatory Headwinds
summary: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL) remains a dominant force in the tech industry, driven by its aggressive leadership in AI, robust growth in Google Cloud, and the enduring strength of its core advertising businesses. The company faces significant regulatory challenges, particularly antitrust lawsuits in the U.S. and EU, but its strategic investments in AI infrastructure and diverse portfolio position it for continued long-term growth. Investors are largely bullish, though they remain cautious about ongoing capital expenditures and intense competition in the AI space.

title: Meta Turns To Alibaba's Qwen To Train Its Next AI Model
summary: Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) is reportedly leveraging Alibaba Group Holding Limited's (NYSE: BABA) Qwen open-source AI model, along with systems from Alphabet Inc.'s (NASDAQ: GOOGL) Google and OpenAI, to develop its new AI model, code-named Avocado. This move signals a strategic shift in Meta's AI ambitions, focusing on higher-return AI initiatives and reallocating resources from metaverse projects. The Avocado model, likely to be available only through an API, is being developed in Meta's TBD Lab and is part of a broader effort to contain Reality Labs losses and strengthen EPS growth.

title: Intel pursued deals that boosted CEO Lip-Bu Tan's fortune, sources say
summary: Intel's CEO, Lip-Bu Tan, has been involved in deals that have financially benefited him due to his existing investments in venture capital, raising concerns about potential conflicts of interest. Despite these concerns and board interventions, Tan's extensive network is viewed by Intel's board as crucial for the company's innovation and growth, especially as Intel navigates a challenging AI chip market and a significant investment in U.S. manufacturing. Tan's tenure has also seen Intel's share price double, outpacing market leaders.
authors: Jeffrey Dastin, Max A. Cherney and Milana Vinn

title: Disney Hits Google With AI Copyright Infringement Cease-and-Desist Letter
summary: Disney has issued a cease-and-desist letter to Google, accusing the tech giant of massive copyright infringement by using Disney's copyrighted works to train its AI models. Disney claims Google's AI services like Veo, Imagen, and Nano Banana, embedded in products such as Google Workspace and YouTube, are generating pristine images of Disney characters in response to user prompts. This action comes shortly after Disney announced a partnership with OpenAI and invested in the Google rival, highlighting a growing legal battle over AI and intellectual property.

title: StoneX Group Inc. Increases Holdings in Meta Platforms, Inc. $META
summary: StoneX Group Inc. significantly increased its stake in Meta Platforms, Inc. by 6.9% in Q2, bringing its total holdings to 13,043 shares valued at approximately $9.63 million. Other institutional investors like Kingstone Capital Partners Texas LLC and Norges Bank also made substantial new investments in Meta. Despite recent price-target cuts from some analysts, the company maintains a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating with a target price of $821.63, driven by strong quarterly earnings that surpassed expectations.

title: AI chip and tech stocks are falling again after gloomy Oracle earnings reignite bubble fears. Here's the latest
summary: AI chip and tech stocks are falling after Oracle reported disappointing Q2 2026 earnings, renewing fears of an AI bubble fueled by "circular spending." Despite Oracle's non-GAAP EPS beating expectations, its total revenue fell short, causing investors to question the sustainability of current AI investments. This slump is impacting major tech companies and chip makers, with Oracle's stock alone down over 12%.

title: Best Metaverse Stocks To Add to Your Watchlist – December 9th
summary: This article highlights three metaverse stocks—Robot Consulting (LAWR), Everbright Digital (EDHL), and Global Mofy AI (GMM)—as top contenders for investors' watchlists. These companies are involved in providing technology, platforms, and services essential for the development of virtual and augmented reality environments. The article emphasizes that while metaverse stocks offer exposure to significant growth potential, they also come with inherent speculative and long-term risks.

title: Ciena Jumps On Strong Earnings, Guidance Amid Data Center Order Growth
summary: Ciena (CIEN) stock saw a significant jump after reporting strong fiscal fourth-quarter earnings and revenue, surpassing consensus estimates. The growth was primarily driven by robust data center orders, especially from Meta Platforms (META). Furthermore, the company's fiscal 2026 revenue guidance exceeded expectations, contributing to the positive market reaction.

title: Broadcom (AVGO) Stock After Hours on December 10, 2025: AI Rally, Fed Cut and What to Watch Before the December 11 Open
summary: This article examines Broadcom (AVGO) stock performance after hours on December 10, 2025, highlighting its near-record highs driven by AI spending and a recent Federal Reserve rate cut. It delves into the company's strong Q3 2025 results, its pivotal role in AI infrastructure through custom chips and networking, and the successful integration of VMware, which has transformed it into an AI and software hybrid. The article also outlines Wall Street's expectations for Broadcom's Q4 2025 earnings, emphasizing the critical importance of AI revenue and 2026 guidance, while acknowledging the stock's demanding valuation and potential for volatility.

title: META PLATFORMS INC-CLASS A (NASDAQ:META) Stands Out as a Modern Peter Lynch-Style Investment
summary: META Platforms Inc. (NASDAQ: META) is presented as a strong "Growth at a Reasonable Price" (GARP) investment, aligning with Peter Lynch's investment philosophy. The article highlights Meta's excellent profitability, robust financial condition, consistent earnings growth within Lynch's preferred range, and attractive valuation metrics like a PEG ratio below 1.0. It concludes that Meta's fundamentals make it a compelling long-term investment, despite considering potential challenges in its evolving business environment.

title: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan Faces Scrutiny Over Multi-Billion Dollar AI Deals That Boosted His Own Venture Portfolio: Report
summary: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan is facing scrutiny over multi-billion dollar AI deals that appear to have boosted his personal venture portfolio. Concerns have been raised regarding Intel's acquisition of AI chip startup Rivos, in which Tan held a stake, and his dual roles in Intel and his own investment firms. Corporate governance experts are highlighting potential conflicts of interest, though Intel defends Tan's industry connections as crucial for innovation.

title: Shares of Oracle slide 10% on revenue miss and rising capital expenditures
summary: Oracle's shares dropped over 10% in extended trading after the company missed revenue expectations despite a strong performance in earnings per share. While cloud revenue performed well and remaining performance obligations soared, investors are concerned about rising capital expenditures for AI infrastructure and its impact on profitability. New co-CEOs highlighted customer wins to address market nervousness about over-reliance on AI plays.

title: Why Microsoft Stock Tumbled Today
summary: Microsoft's stock declined by nearly 3% following a letter from a bipartisan group of state attorneys general expressing concerns about AI chatbots. The letter warned major tech companies, including Microsoft, about "sycophantic and delusional outputs" and child safety issues, calling for immediate action and independent auditing. Despite this regulatory pressure, the article suggests Microsoft will likely find a way to operate effectively, as it has with past regulatory challenges.

title: Microsoft Stock Slips After Hours as AI Scrutiny Rises: What MSFT Investors Should Know Before the December 11 Open
summary: Microsoft Corporation (NASDAQ: MSFT) experienced a slight dip on December 10, 2025, closing down 2.7% and trading marginally lower after hours, primarily due to increased regulatory scrutiny on AI and concerns over monetizing its substantial AI investments. This comes as state attorneys general warned tech companies about "delusional outputs" from AI chatbots and Microsoft announced $23 billion in new AI data center investments. Despite these near-term pressures, Wall Street analysts maintain a broadly bullish outlook on Microsoft's long-term prospects, with price targets suggesting significant upside, though some quantitative models show mixed signals and long-term caution on valuation.

title: Why Alibaba Stock Inched Higher Today
summary: Alibaba Group's stock closed higher after a report indicated its AI model, Qwen, is being used to train a proprietary, for-pay AI model ("Avocado") by a major U.S. tech company, Meta Platforms. This collaboration, while not significantly impactful for immediate revenue, enhances Alibaba's reputation as a key player in the AI revolution. Investors responded positively, pushing shares almost 2% skyward.

title: Paul Tudor Jones Reduces Stake in SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust by 0.72%
summary: Billionaire investor Paul Tudor Jones's Tudor Investment Group submitted its 13F filing for Q3 2025, revealing significant portfolio adjustments. While making substantial new investments in Meta Platforms, Broadcom, and CyberArk Software, and increasing stakes in INVESCO QQQ Trust and NVIDIA Corp, Jones also reduced his position in the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) by 0.72%. The article highlights the strategic shifts in his portfolio, including complete exits from holdings like Enstar Group Ltd and TransDigm Group Inc.

title: Why is Microsoft Rolling Back its DEI Commitments?
summary: Microsoft is rolling back its diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) commitments by removing diversity metrics from employee assessments and discontinuing its annual inclusion report in 2025. This shift means that while employees can still engage in DEI activities voluntarily, these efforts will no longer be formally tracked or impact performance scores. This decision aligns with a broader trend seen among major technology firms like Google and Meta, which are also reassessing their formal DEI initiatives and reporting methods.

title: Nebius Group N.V. (NBIS) Stock Outlook for 2026: How Microsoft and Meta Deals Are Shaping This AI Infrastructure High‑Flier
summary: Nebius Group N.V. (NBIS) has become a prominent AI infrastructure stock in 2025, driven by significant deals with Microsoft and Meta Platforms worth billions. While the company exhibits hypergrowth, aiming for $7-$9 billion ARR by 2026, it faces substantial risks including rapid cash burn, high capital intensity, and customer concentration. The article analyzes Nebius's financial status, growth projections, risks, and market sentiment as it navigates its ambition to be a leading "neocloud" provider.

title: Elon Musk's X Says 'Not Our Choice' Even As Australia's Prime Minister Calls It A 'Proud Day' After Imposing Under 16 Social Media Ban
summary: Australia has become the first country to ban children under 16 from major social platforms, effective midnight Wednesday, requiring companies like X, TikTok, YouTube, Instagram, and Facebook to block underage users or face significant fines. Prime Minister Anthony Albanese lauded the move, while Elon Musk's X complied, stating it was "not our choice." Other countries are reportedly watching Australia's model closely for potential similar implementations.

title: Meta signs 2.5GW of clean energy contracts with NextEra Energy across US
summary: Meta has signed 2.5GW of clean energy contracts with NextEra Energy across the US, involving 11 Power Purchase Agreements and two Energy Storage Agreements. These projects, primarily solar and battery storage, are intended to support Meta's data center operations and are expected to come online between 2026 and 2028. This collaboration aims to advance energy infrastructure and storage solutions, reinforcing America's energy independence and technological progress.

title: Meta signs a new round of clean energy agreements totaling 2.5 GW with NextEra Energy Resources
summary: Meta and NextEra Energy Resources have signed new clean energy agreements totaling approximately 2.5 gigawatts (GW) through 11 power purchase agreements and two energy storage agreements. These projects, including solar and battery storage across several US markets, are expected to come online between 2026 and 2028, creating jobs and supporting Meta’s goal of 100% clean energy for its operations. This expands on nearly 500 MW of existing operational projects between the two companies.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on why despite being the CEO of world's most-valuable company, sense of uncertain
summary: Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia, despite leading a $5 trillion company, lives in constant anxiety, a fear stemming from a near-bankruptcy experience in the 1990s. This anxiety is validated by recent market turmoil, including a $250 billion drop in Nvidia's market value after reports of Meta potentially buying Google's AI chips. Huang's unwavering work ethic and belief that the company is "30 days from going out of business" highlight his drive to avoid failure, shaping his leadership and Nvidia's trajectory.

title: Does the Job of C.E.O. or Private Investor Come First? Intel’s Chief Is Juggling That Question.
summary: Lip-Bu Tan, Intel's CEO since March, is also a long-time venture capitalist, leading firms like Walden International, Celesta Capital, and Walden Catalyst. His dual roles have stirred controversy, particularly as Intel considered acquiring companies like Rivos and SambaNova Systems, firms in which Mr. Tan and his venture funds had significant investments. This situation has led to concerns about potential conflicts of interest within the chip industry and Intel itself, prompting some employees to leave.

title: When AI Meets Water Scarcity: Data Centers in a Thirsty World
summary: The rapid expansion of data centers, driven by AI and cloud computing, is exacerbating global water stress, with nearly one-third of new facilities projected to face higher scarcity risks by 2050. Managing the water/energy trade-off for data center cooling is becoming a material operational and reputational risk for operators, increasing investor scrutiny of location-specific climate risks and resource constraints. Operators are adopting innovative cooling solutions and facing increased regulatory oversight and stakeholder pressure to address the environmental impact of their water consumption.
authors: Tom Leahy, Yoon Young Chung, Federico Darakdjian

title: Diretora da ECB Bancorp compra ações no valor de US$ 58.976
summary: Maura Ellen Sullivan, diretora da ECB Bancorp, Inc. (ECBK), comprou US$ 58.976 em ações ordinárias da empresa em 8 e 9 de dezembro de 2025. A aquisição de 3.500 ações, a preços entre US$ 16,65 e US$ 17,05, foi realizada indiretamente "Pelo Cônjuge". Dados do InvestingPro indicam que a ECBK, negociada a US$ 16,84 com uma capitalização de mercado de US$ 148 milhões, teve um ganho de 13,2% no ano e possui um baixo índice PEG de 0,21, sugerindo possível subvalorização.
source: Investing.com Brasil - Finanças, Câmbio e Investimentos

title: NextEra Signs Big Google, Meta Deals. Why the Stock is Falling.
summary: NextEra Energy announced significant deals to supply power, primarily from clean energy sources, to Meta and Google data centers. Despite raising its earnings guidance, the company's stock experienced a decline. This suggests that Wall Street was not favorably impressed by the news.

title: Why Microsoft Has Scaled Back DEI in its Performance Reviews
summary: Microsoft has eliminated diversity and inclusion (DEI) metrics from employee performance reviews and will no longer publish an annual DEI report. This shift reflects a broader trend among tech giants, like Google and Meta, to scale back formal DEI commitments amidst changing legal landscapes and internal pressures. While Microsoft states its commitment to inclusion remains, the move away from mandatory goals and reporting raises questions about accountability and sustained progress in diversity initiatives.

title: RCS - ACCESS Newswire Inc. - Majority of Parents Support Social Media Ban
summary: A new FOSI study reveals a significant generational divide on social media bans for under-16s, with most parents supporting restrictions while children fear losing crucial online connections. The research, surveying 4,000 individuals in the U.S. and Australia, also highlights concerns from both groups about children bypassing bans and a strong consensus for creating safer, age-appropriate teen accounts as an alternative to an outright ban.

title: Nvidia, SoftBank Target 'Robot Brain' Maker In Potential $14 Billion Deal - NVIDIA (NASDAQ:NVDA)
summary: SoftBank Group Corp. and NVIDIA Corp are reportedly in talks to lead a significant funding round for Skild AI, a robotics artificial intelligence company. This investment could value Skild AI at approximately $14 billion, nearly tripling its earlier valuation. Skild AI aims to develop universal software that acts as a central "brain" for robots, addressing a key barrier to widespread robot deployment.

title: Uber Technologies (UBER) Receives a Buy from Evercore ISI
summary: Evercore ISI analyst Mark Mahaney maintained a Buy rating on Uber Technologies (UBER) with a $150.00 price target, following the company's strong Q3 earnings report. Uber reported $13.47 billion in revenue and $6.63 billion in net profit for the quarter ending September 30. Despite positive ratings, corporate insider sentiment for UBER is negative, with an increase in insider selling.

title: S&P Global Energy Releases Key Clean Energy+ Trends for 2026 as AI Growth and Geopolitical Shifts Reshape Global Energy Markets
summary: S&P Global Energy has released its Top Trends report for 2026, highlighting pivotal developments shaping clean energy, sustainability, and global energy markets. The report emphasizes the impact of AI's surging power demand on grids and sustainability goals, alongside geopolitical shifts and China's growing leadership in clean energy technologies. Key trends include a temporary peak in solar installations, the critical need for grid modernization, evolving power purchase agreements, and the increasing urgency of climate adaptation.

title: Nebius Group N.V. (NBIS) Stock on December 8, 2025: Latest News, Price Targets and AI Cloud Growth Forecasts
summary: Nebius Group N.V. (NBIS), an AI infrastructure company, is trading just under $100 per share, up over 200% year-to-date despite a recent 30% pullback from October highs. The company has secured multi-billion dollar AI infrastructure contracts with Microsoft and Meta, targeting $7–9 billion in annualized revenue by the end of 2026. However, opinions on valuation vary widely among analysts, with some seeing significant upside and others, like Morningstar, expressing caution due to high capital expenditure, current losses, and a "no moat" rating.

title: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights Meta Platforms, SAP SE, Booking Holdings and Willis Lease Finance
summary: This Zacks Analyst Blog highlights recent research reports on Meta Platforms (META), SAP SE (SAP), Booking Holdings Inc. (BKNG), and Willis Lease Finance Corp. (WLFC). It details each company's recent performance, key growth drivers, and challenges, based on analyses from Zacks Equity Research.

title: Sirius XM Holdings Inc. Stock Outperforms Competitors Despite Losses On The Day
summary: Sirius XM Holdings Inc. (SIRI) shares dropped 1.36% to $21.73 on Monday, despite a general market decline, snapping a four-day winning streak. The stock closed 25.53% below its 52-week high, yet still outperformed competitors like Alphabet Inc. and Meta Platforms Inc.

title: Tech ETF XLK on Its Way for Longest Rally Since 2020: Here's How
summary: The SPDR S&P Information Technology ETF (XLK) has achieved its longest daily winning streak since September 2020, driven not by mega-cap tech but by chipmakers and software stocks like NVIDIA, SanDisk, and Salesforce. This rally reflects broad-based strength in the tech sector, with strong growth forecasts for semiconductors and software segments anticipated to continue into 2026. Consequently, ETFs such as VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH) and State Street SPDR S&P Software & Services ETF (XSW) are identified as strong plays.

title: BlackRock bets on ‘pick and shovel’ trade, singling out clear winners in AI spending spree
summary: BlackRock's chief investment strategist for APAC, Ben Powell, argues that the "picks and shovels" suppliers to the AI industry, such as chipmakers, energy producers, and copper-wire manufacturers, are the clearest winners in the ongoing AI spending spree. He notes that the capital expenditure in AI infrastructure is far from peaking as tech giants continue to invest heavily. Powell believes that durable gains from the AI boom will likely come from hardware, energy, and infrastructure, rather than just model developers.
authors: Anniek Bao, Dan Murphy, Steve Sedgwick

title: Arm Holdings: The Engine Powering Behind Efficient AI Computing
summary: Arm Holdings is becoming a crucial player in energy-efficient AI computing, providing the architectural foundation for AI across various devices and data centers. Its focus on performance per watt and a consistent instruction framework gives it a strong competitive edge against rivals like NVIDIA and Intel. With planned ventures into AI chip divisions, Arm aims to deepen its influence and control over AI performance economics.

title: United Bankshares stock holds steady as KBW reiterates Market Perform rating
summary: Keefe, Bruyette & Woods (KBW) has reiterated its Market Perform rating and a $40.00 price target for United Bankshares Inc. (NASDAQ:UBSI), following a marketing session with the company. KBW projects increased capital deployment in 2026 for United Bankshares, driven by improved loan growth and buyback activity. Despite the stock remaining flat for the year, KBW maintains its neutral stance due to a rebound in share valuation and increased earnings estimates for future years.

title: Allison Worldwide Expands Global Leadership with New Europe CEO
summary: Allison Worldwide, part of Stagwell (STGW), has appointed Jeremy Lucas as CEO, Europe, to integrate and grow the agency's presence across the region. Lucas brings over 20 years of experience, previously serving as UK CEO at Hotwire and holding senior positions at other major agencies. His role will involve C-suite-level client support and expanding the agency's offerings in reputation, stakeholder engagement, crisis, influencer, analytics, and marketing.

title: Analysts Are Betting on Broadcom Stock for 2026. Should You Load Up on Shares Now?
summary: Broadcom (AVGO) stock has seen significant growth, up 120% since last December and over 2,500% in a decade, driven by its pivotal role in the expanding AI market. Analysts are optimistic, with some raising price targets, as Broadcom supplies crucial networking gear and custom processors for hyperscalers building AI infrastructure, notably securing over $10 billion in AI rack orders for fiscal 2026. CEO Hock Tan anticipates a sixfold increase in AI revenue to over $120 billion by 2030, powered by a focus on a small, lucrative customer base investing heavily in AI compute, and the company's advanced networking solutions like next-gen optical networking.

title: Bulls Bet on Alphabet Stock as AI Race Tightens
summary: Alphabet stock (GOOGL) has seen significant bullish activity, fueled by reports of talks with Meta Platforms to produce custom AI chips. The stock recently achieved its eighth consecutive positive month and is approaching a new record high, highlighting strong investor confidence despite general tech volatility. Options traders have also shown a preference for call options, suggesting expectations of continued upward momentum.

title: Schwab Trading Activity Index™: STAX Score Continues Upswing for Sixth Consecutive Month
summary: The Schwab Trading Activity Index (STAX) rose for the sixth consecutive month in November, reaching 48.75. Schwab clients were net buyers of equities for the third straight month, particularly in Information Technology and Consumer Discretionary sectors, demonstrating a "buy the dip and sell the rip" strategy. Despite a slow start to the month influenced by economic data and concerns about rate cuts, the market rebounded strongly after a signal from the New York Federal Reserve President John Williams regarding a potential December rate cut.

title: Johnson Controls Stock Prediction: Where Analysts See the Stock Going by 2028
summary: Analysts project Johnson Controls (JCI) stock to reach approximately $125/share by 2028, representing a modest annualized return of about 3%. This outlook is driven by consistent operational execution, growing demand for energy-efficient HVAC systems, and the adoption of its digital solutions, rather than significant valuation re-ratings. While the company benefits from trends in green buildings and improved efficiency, it faces challenges from slow revenue growth and intense competition, suggesting steady but not accelerated performance.

title: Constellation Energy (CEG) Stock: Calpine Deal Gets Final DOJ Approval
summary: Constellation Energy (CEG) has received final Department of Justice approval for its $26.6 billion acquisition of Calpine, expected to close in early 2026. This merger will diversify Constellation's energy portfolio, especially with Calpine's natural gas and geothermal assets, and position it to meet the growing demand for power from AI infrastructure. The stock has seen significant gains, and analysts remain largely positive, anticipating strong earnings growth driven by strategic contracts and clean energy projects.

title: Alphabet Stock Hits Record Highs as Gemini AI and Cloud Growth Drive Momentum, GOOGL Stock
summary: Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ: GOOGL) stock reached record highs driven by strong growth in its cloud and AI divisions, particularly the Gemini suite. The company reported over $100 billion in revenue for the third quarter, with Google Cloud revenue up 34% year-over-year. Despite regulatory challenges and fierce competition in AI, Wall Street remains optimistic for future growth.

title: Oklo Stock Rockets After Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang Backs Nuclear for AI Data Centers
summary: Oklo (NYSE: OKLO) stock surged almost 24% after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang advocated for nuclear power to support the growing energy demands of AI data centers, stating it's becoming the "bottleneck" for AI development. Oklo, which develops fast-neutron microreactors, also has a historic deal with data-center giant Switch to deploy 12 gigawatts of its reactors. Although Oklo is still in the pre-revenue stage, investor enthusiasm and major industry backing highlight nuclear power's pivotal role in the AI energy transition.

title: NextEra Energy Resources (NYSE: NEE) and Meta reach 2.5 GW in U.S. clean energy PPAs
summary: NextEra Energy Resources and Meta have deepened their partnership, reaching a milestone of approximately 2.5 GW in clean energy contracts across 13 projects. These agreements include 11 power purchase agreements and two energy storage agreements, primarily solar, in ERCOT, SPP, MISO, and New Mexico. The projects, scheduled to come online between 2026 and 2028, will create up to 2,440 construction jobs and contribute to Meta's goal of 100% clean energy operations, building on nearly 500 MW of existing collaborations.

title: BlackRock Reveals Where the Real AI Money Is Going
summary: A BlackRock strategist indicates that the significant investment opportunity in AI lies within the foundational infrastructure, not primarily in AI model developers. Companies providing hardware, energy, and materials are expected to see more stable and substantial gains as tech giants funnel massive capital into building out the necessary infrastructure. This "picks and shovels" approach to AI investment highlights the accelerating demand for chips, power grids, and raw materials.

title: Evaluating IAC (IAC) After People Inc.’s New Meta AI Partnership and Expanding Tech Distribution Deals
summary: IAC (IAC) is being re-evaluated after People Inc.'s new multi-year content partnership with Meta, which places several IAC lifestyle brands into Meta AI products. Despite this AI momentum and a recent share price increase, IAC's long-term returns have been weak, and its valuation is debated, with a narrative fair value suggesting undervaluation while a DCF model points to overvaluation. Investors are questioning whether this new partnership signifies a genuine growth opportunity or if the market is already pricing in future growth.

title: Alphabet Stock Wins a New Street-High Price Target as AI Momentum Accelerates
summary: Alphabet (NASDAQ:GOOGL) has received a new Street-high price target of $400 from Pivotal's Jeffrey Wlodarczak, up from $350, due to its strong position in the AI transition. The bullish outlook is driven by Google's resilient search business, the advanced Gemini AI, and the significant partnership with Apple, which is expected to boost margins and market share. Wlodarczak anticipates that Google's TPUs and dominant position on handsets will further solidify its AI leadership, despite potential market consolidation driven by issues faced by competitors like OpenAI.

title: What Every Constellation Energy Investor Should Know Before Buying
summary: Constellation Energy's stock has performed strongly, surging over 40% in the past year. The company operates as a competitive energy supplier, primarily focusing on low-carbon nuclear energy, and generates revenue through long-term power purchase agreements rather than regulated utility services. Constellation Energy is poised for significant expansion through its pending acquisition of Calpine, which will diversify its power generation portfolio and enhance its growth prospects by meeting surging demand from technology companies.

title: WeRide price target lowered to $17 from $21 at JPMorgan
summary: JPMorgan analyst Alex Yao has lowered the price target for WeRide (WRD) to $17 from $21, while maintaining an Overweight rating. This adjustment reflects the firm's belief that WeRide's monetization will scale more slowly in China due to policies catching up with robotaxi technology. Despite cutting near-term estimates, JPMorgan largely keeps its longer-term earnings power assumptions unchanged for the company.

title: NextEra Energy Resources and Meta Strengthen American Energy Leadership
summary: NextEra Energy Resources and Meta have reached approximately 2.5 gigawatts (GW) of clean energy contracts through 11 power purchase agreements and two energy storage agreements. These projects, scheduled to come online between 2026 and 2028, will create up to 2,440 construction jobs and support Meta's goal of matching its operations with 100% clean energy. The collaboration highlights a shared commitment to strengthening American energy infrastructure and driving innovation.

title: Georgia Power Says It Needs a Huge Increase in Power Capacity to Meet Data Center Demand
summary: Georgia Power Co. is seeking approval to spend over $15 billion to increase its electricity capacity by 50% in the next six years, primarily to meet the huge demand from data centers flooding into the state. This proposal, aimed at boosting the state's economy and supporting AI development, faces scrutiny from utility regulators and public opposition concerned about rising electricity bills and whether other ratepayers will subsidize the technology giants. The decision by the Public Service Commission is anticipated on December 19th, amidst political controversy and debates over who will bear the costs if data center demand is overestimated.

title: Key facts: Apple Invests in AI; Faces Leadership Changes and Competition
summary: Apple Inc. (AAPL) is actively investing in AI infrastructure and data centers, aligning with other major tech companies in the AI race. The company is experiencing significant leadership changes, including resignations of key executives in AI and design, which are impacting CEO Tim Cook's management team. These changes, coupled with talent poaching by rivals and product delays, have led to negative market reactions.

title: Nebius Group NV (NBIS) Stock on December 6, 2025: Price, Microsoft & Meta Megadeals, Q3 Results and 2026 Forecasts
summary: Nebius Group N.V. (NASDAQ: NBIS) has seen significant growth in 2025, driven by multi-billion dollar AI infrastructure deals with Microsoft and Meta Platforms, despite a recent 30% pullback from its October peak. The company reported 355% year-on-year revenue growth in Q3 2025 but also heavy losses and a raised capital expenditure target of $5 billion for the year. Wall Street maintains a "Strong Buy" consensus, projecting substantial upside, though analysts highlight risks related to capital intensity, profitability, and customer concentration.

title: Meta Platforms (META) Receives a Buy from RBC Capital
summary: RBC Capital analyst Brad Erickson has maintained a Buy rating on Meta Platforms (META) with a price target of $810.00. This follows similar positive sentiment from Evercore ISI, despite Needham maintaining a Hold rating. The company reported quarterly revenue of $51.24 billion and positive insider sentiment with a recent 10,200 share purchase by CTO Andrew Bosworth.

title: Apple Chip Chief Johny Srouji 'Seriously Considering' Exit, Raising Alarms Over Future Of iPhone, Mac Silicon
summary: Johny Srouji, Apple's senior vice president of hardware technologies, is reportedly considering leaving the company. This potential departure, alongside other executive changes, raises concerns about Apple's leadership stability and its artificial intelligence ambitions. Srouji has been instrumental in developing Apple's custom silicon for iPhones, iPads, and Macs.

title: Meta AI Becomes Real-Time News Hub With New Media Partnerships
summary: Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) is expanding Meta AI to incorporate real-time news, entertainment, and lifestyle content by partnering with major media outlets like CNN and USA TODAY. This initiative aims to provide users with timely, relevant information and drive traffic to partner sites, addressing past content reimbursement issues. Meta is also shifting its investment strategy by scaling back metaverse spending to prioritize AI development and infrastructure.

title: CoreWeave Hits Profitability While Applied Digital Burns Cash Building Data Centers
summary: CoreWeave and Applied Digital, two companies in the AI infrastructure space, show contrasting financial performances. CoreWeave reported significant profitability and revenue growth, along with a massive backlog, by operating a cloud platform for AI workloads. In contrast, Applied Digital, which builds data centers, showed impressive revenue growth but continued operational losses, despite securing major leases.

title: Direxion Daily META Bull 2X Shares Target of Unusually High Options Trading (NASDAQ:METU)
summary: Direxion Daily META Bull 2X Shares (METU) experienced unusually high options trading, with stock traders purchasing 6,101 call options, a 39% increase over typical daily volume. This surge in interest coincides with the ETF (which provides 2x leveraged exposure to Meta Platforms Inc Class A stock) rising 7.5% to $33.10 on heavy trading volume. Institutional investors also significantly modified their holdings in METU during the second quarter, indicating growing attention to the fund.

title: People Inc. (IAC) becomes Meta AI's first lifestyle content partner
summary: People Inc. has announced a multi-year content partnership with Meta, making it the first lifestyle publisher to provide real-time content across various categories to Meta AI users. This agreement includes major People Inc. brands such as PEOPLE, Better Homes & Gardens, Allrecipes, and Investopedia, and follows similar deals with OpenAI and Microsoft as part of an accelerated AI partner strategy. The financial terms of the deal were not disclosed.

title: Invesco CurrencyShares Australian Dollar Trust (NYSEARCA:FXA) Share Price Pass Above 200-Day Moving Average – Should You Sell?
summary: Invesco CurrencyShares Australian Dollar Trust (FXA) experienced its share price moving above its 200-day moving average, reaching a high of $65.58 and closing at $65.47.
