title: Microsoft laid her off. A layoff support group helped her bounce back — and she got a job at Meta 2 months later. - Business Insider
summary: Deborah Hendersen, a former Microsoft employee, quickly landed a job at Meta two months after being laid off from Microsoft's Xbox division, where she had worked for 14 years. This network, combined with financial preparation and leveraging her connections, helped her secure a new user experience researcher role at Meta without formally applying for it.

summary: Oracle projects significant growth, expecting cloud infrastructure revenue to hit $166 billion by fiscal 2030, making up nearly 75% of total sales. title: Salesforce sued by authors over artificial intelligence software - businessinsurance.com
summary: Salesforce is facing a proposed class action lawsuit from authors Molly Tanzer and Jennifer Gilmore, who allege the company used their copyrighted books without permission to train its xGen AI models. The lawsuit claims Salesforce infringed copyrights by utilizing thousands of pirated books for its AI software, despite CEO Marc Benioff's previous criticisms of companies using "stolen" training data. This case is part of a larger trend of authors and content creators suing tech companies over the uncompensated use of their material in AI development.

title: State AGs probe Big Tech’s use of renewable energy certificates - ESG Dive
summary: A coalition of 16 Republican state attorneys general has sent letters to Amazon, Google, Meta, and Microsoft, questioning their claims of 100% renewable energy usage and emissions reductions through the use of renewable energy certificates (RECs). The AGs, led by Montana AG Austin Knudsen, argue that purchasing unbundled RECs may be deceptive as they don't guarantee actual renewable energy use or emissions reductions, especially given the tech sector's rising energy demands. The companies are asked to provide detailed information on their REC usage and energy consumption without considering these certificates.

title: Advanced Micro Devices Gets Price Target Hike From BofA After OpenAI Partnership - TradingView

This deal is expected to significantly increase AMD's AI accelerator market share and position it as a key competitor to Nvidia and Broadcom in the AI chip market.

title: Booming Netflix ready to raise a glass to jump in subscribers

Despite concerns about the impact of live sports on margins and competition, the company's stock has outperformed major tech firms this year.

This development positions AMD as a growing competitor to Nvidia and Broadcom in the AI chip market.

title: Meta strikes $30 billion deal with Blue Owl to finance Hyperion data center - Sherwood News
summary: Meta has secured a $30 billion financing deal with asset management company Blue Owl Capital to fund its Hyperion data center, which will be one of the largest data centers globally. This financing arrangement, potentially the largest private capital deal ever, involves Blue Owl and Meta co-owning the site, with PIMCO serving as the anchor lender. The Hyperion data center is designed to house approximately 2 million GPUs and scale up to 5.5 gigawatts.

title: DoubleVerify, Microsoft Boost Measurement Authentication
summary: DoubleVerify has expanded its partnership with Microsoft Advertising to enhance measurement authentication across Microsoft's platforms, including Bing, Outlook, and casual games. This collaboration enables media quality analysis for ad suitability, fraud, and viewability for Microsoft's in-market audience campaigns. A new tool, "DV Campaign Automator," has been introduced to streamline campaign management for advertisers.

title: Oracle Stock Slips Despite Meta Partnership, Weighed Down by Execution Fears - Tokenist
summary: Oracle shares fell over 7% despite announcing an ambitious long-term growth outlook and a major cloud computing deal with Meta Platforms. Investors focused on rising execution risks, significant capital expenditure requirements for AI infrastructure, and near-term profitability concerns, which overshadowed the positive long-term prospects. Valuations were also a concern given the stock's strong performance leading into the conference.

title: Wall Street Divided As Oracle's $225 Billion Growth Vision Sparks Optimism — And Concern - inkl

Piper Sandler raised its price target to $380, citing strong OCI momentum and bookings, while JP Morgan maintained a Neutral rating with a $270 forecast, acknowledging OCI progress but highlighting constraints in data center capacity and heavy capital expenditure. Oracle's stock traded lower despite optimistic long-term projections.

title: Wall Street Divided As Oracle's $225 Billion Growth Vision Sparks Optimism — And Concern - Benzinga
summary: Oracle Corporation has unveiled ambitious long-term growth targets, projecting $225 billion in revenue by fiscal 2030, largely driven by its cloud and AI infrastructure initiatives. While analysts like Piper Sandler express optimism with an Overweight rating and an increased price target of $380, JP Morgan maintains a Neutral stance with a $270 target, citing concerns over high capital expenditures for data center expansion despite strong demand. The stock traded lower following the analyst day, indicating a divided market reaction to Oracle's aggressive growth vision.

title: Instagram will soon let parents stop teens from chatting with AI characters - CNN
summary: Instagram is introducing new parental controls that will allow parents to prevent their teenagers from chatting with the platform's AI characters. This initiative by parent company Meta aims to address growing concerns from parents and lawmakers regarding the safety of children on online platforms and the potential for AI to be used for emotional support or inappropriate conversations. The updates are expected to roll out early next year, with AI characters designed to avoid discussions related to self-harm or other harmful topics.

title: Audible Defeats Proposed Class Action Over Meta Pixel Tracking - Bloomberg Law News
summary: Audible Inc. successfully moved to dismiss a proposed class action lawsuit in Washington state that alleged it was illegally tracking users with Meta Platforms' tracking pixel. The court ruled that the complaint, which exclusively relied on California law, failed to state a claim the Washington court could address, as the plaintiffs were aware Washington law would govern the dispute. The plaintiffs have been given one month to amend their complaint to address this issue.

This move signals increased competition in the AI chip race, challenging current market leaders and reshaping the landscape of AI infrastructure.

title: Major Corporate Layoffs of 2025: How AI is Transforming the Workforce - OpenTools
summary: In 2025, major corporations like Intel, Meta, Amazon, and Starbucks are undergoing significant layoffs, impacting thousands of employees. This trend highlights AI's transformative influence across various industries, leading to widespread restructuring.

title: Meta secures $30bn Blue Owl finance package for Louisiana data center - report

This financing package, structured through a special purpose vehicle (SPV) with partners Blue Owl, Meta, and Pimco, includes $2.5 billion in equity and $27 billion in debt, allowing Meta to keep the debt off its balance sheet. The campus is anticipated to span over four million sq ft and offer up to 2GW of capacity, with construction expected to conclude by 2030.

title: Warning after ‘King Kong’ of weight-loss jabs found being sold illegally on social media - inkl

Yang's team was tasked with developing features to enhance Siri's capabilities by integrating web-based information, making it more akin to ChatGPT.

title: Arm CEO says moving some AI workloads from the cloud will make it more sustainable
summary: Arm Holdings CEO Rene Haas suggests that shifting some AI workloads from the cloud to local applications will make AI more sustainable by reducing energy consumption. He argues that while AI training will remain cloud-based, inference can occur locally on devices, alleviating the need for numerous multi-gigawatt data centers. This hybrid approach to computing, seen throughout history, will help manage power investments required for AI.

title: Olivan, Meta Platforms COO, sells $368k in Meta stock - Investing.com
summary: This article indicates an error in loading the content from the investing.com website. It notes an application error while trying to display information about Meta Platforms COO, Javier Olivan, selling $368k in Meta stock. Due to the error, the full article content is unavailable.

title: Olivan, Meta Platforms COO, sells $368k in Meta stock - Investing.com India
summary: This article reports a recent insider stock sale by Javier Olivan, COO of Meta Platforms. Olivan sold 750 shares of Meta stock for a total value exceeding $368,000. This transaction was disclosed in a regulatory filing.

title: Lemonade appoints Prashant Ratanchandani to board of directors By Investing.com - Investing.com Australia
summary: Lemonade, Inc. announced the appointment of Prashant Ratanchandani to its board of directors, effective October 16, 2025. Ratanchandani, who is eligible for a compensation package including an annual cash retainer and equity-based awards, will serve as a Class II director until 2028. This appointment follows other recent board additions and comes as analysts like Piper Sandler and BMO Capital have updated their price targets for Lemonade.

title: Tech Titans Drive S&P 500 Surge: AMD, ASML Soar Amidst AI and Data Center Investment Frenzy - FinancialContent
summary: The S&P 500's technology sector is experiencing a significant surge, driven primarily by Artificial Intelligence (AI) innovation and massive investments in data center infrastructure. Companies like Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) and ASML Holding N.V. are seeing impressive stock performances, while Meta Platforms and Amazon are committing billions to solidify their AI and cloud computing dominance. This trend highlights a pivotal moment for the tech industry, with AI reshaping corporate strategies and market valuations.

title: Meta Removes ICE-Sightings Group After DOJ Outreach
summary: Meta, Facebook's parent company, removed an ICE agent-tracking group from its platform following pressure from the Justice Department. Attorney General Pam Bondi announced the removal of the Facebook group, which shared information about ICE agent sightings and had nearly 80,000 members. This action follows the DOJ's earlier requests to Apple and Google to remove similar ICE-tracking apps, raising concerns about tech companies succumbing to government pressure regarding user speech.

title: Trump to Fete Billionaires Schwarzman, Hamm at White House Party - Bloomberg.com
summary: President Donald Trump is scheduled to host a dinner at the White House East Room for billionaires and corporate executives, including Steve Schwarzman of Blackstone Inc. and Harold Hamm of Continental Resources Inc., along with the Winklevoss twins. The event will highlight a new $200 million White House ballroom expansion project, which Trump stated he and private donors will fund. Representatives from major corporations like Microsoft, Meta, Alphabet's Google, Amazon, Lockheed Martin, and Palantir Technologies are also expected to attend.

title: Arista Networks (ANET) Loses 5.87% on Cutthroat AI Competition - Insider Monkey
summary: Arista Networks (ANET) saw a 5.87% drop in its stock price due to increased competition in the AI networking sector, specifically after Nvidia secured deals with Oracle and Meta for its Ethernet networking solutions. This partnership poses a significant threat to Arista, given Meta was a major client and both companies target the same emerging market for AI server interconnectivity. The article suggests that while ANET carries risk, other AI stocks may offer higher returns.

title: Trump White House dinner sees attendance from Lockheed Martin, Microsoft, Meta, Google, Amazon, and Palantir - Business Upturn
summary: President Donald Trump is hosting a White House dinner to raise funds for a new $250 million ballroom. The event is attended by executives from major corporations including Lockheed Martin, Microsoft, Meta Platforms, Google, Amazon, and Palantir Technologies, as well as prominent business figures like Harold Hamm and Steve Schwarzman. The dinner highlights Trump's engagement with key corporate stakeholders across various sectors for this White House renovation project.

title: Investors on guard for risks that could derail AI gravy train
summary: The article discusses how optimism over AI has driven US stock markets to record highs, with nearly 50% of the S&P 500's market cap having AI exposure. However, investors are identifying potential risks, including the massive capital expenditures required for AI infrastructure, the interconnectedness of AI companies, and the financing methods for these investments. Concerns also include the sufficiency of energy infrastructure to support AI development and data centers.

title: Trump White House dinner set to include representatives from Lockheed Martin, Microsoft, Meta, Google, Amazon, Palantir-WSJ - MarketScreener
summary: The article reports that representatives from major tech and defense companies, including Lockheed Martin, Microsoft, Meta, Google, Amazon, and Palantir, are expected to attend a Trump White House dinner. This news comes amidst other reports concerning Lockheed Martin's stock performance, contract awards, and dividend changes.

title: Inside the Multi-Billion-Dollar Infrastructure Deals Powering America’s AI Boom - Built In
summary: The United States is experiencing an AI-driven building boom, with tech giants investing billions in hyperscale data centers to meet the surging demand for computing power. This unprecedented expansion, while fueling AI innovation, also raises concerns about strained resources and the potential for a financial bubble. Major projects across the country from companies like Amazon, Google, Microsoft, and Meta highlight the scale of this infrastructure development.

title: Nvidia’s Revenue Can’t Double Anymore
summary: Nvidia's revenue, after significant growth in recent fiscal years, including a jump to $131 billion in fiscal 2025, is no longer expected to double. The company faces new headwinds such as an inability to sell to China and potential limitations from electricity availability for data centers. While growth will continue, it is projected to slow to around 50% for several years, ending the era of hypergrowth.

title: ‘The Smartest Investments We Can Possibly Imagine’: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang Says OpenAI Will Be Worth Trillions, Rivaling Amazon and Meta - Barchart.com
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang believes OpenAI is poised to become a multi-trillion-dollar hyperscale company, rivaling giants like Amazon and Meta. He describes investing in OpenAI as "one of the smartest investments we can possibly imagine," highlighting its potential for strong returns and its role in the AI evolution. Huang's perspective stems from Nvidia's critical position in providing the GPU infrastructure that powers OpenAI and the broader AI revolution.

title: Oracle rises after revealing AI Data Platform and new partnerships at AI World event (ORCL:NYSE) - Seeking Alpha
summary: Oracle's stock rose by about 2% after the company unveiled its new AI Data Platform, agents, and numerous partnerships at its AI World event. The new platform is designed to help customers prepare data for AI and automate business processes, potentially boosting enterprise efficiency and adoption. Oracle also highlighted the benefits of its internal AI use, which has improved employee work quality, saved time, and enhanced customer service and supply chain insights.

title: The Unsung Powerhouse: How Utilities Are Silently Dominating the AI Boom - FinancialContent
summary: The Utilities sector has surprisingly outpaced the Information Technology sector in market performance, driven by the immense power demands of artificial intelligence. This shift redefines investment perspectives as the foundational infrastructure for AI – reliable electricity – becomes a lucrative investment. While utilities are experiencing a boom due to growing data center demands and their own AI adoption, challenges like infrastructure investment and regulatory hurdles remain.

title: Afraid Of The AI Bubble? Just Buy Amazon Stock
summary: Amazon.com, Inc. is presented as an undervalued investment compared to other "Mag 7" stocks, offering significant exposure to AI without the pure-play risks. The article highlights Amazon's strategic investments in logistics, data centers, and AI infrastructure as drivers for future earnings growth, despite current margin compression. A DCF analysis suggests a potential stock valuation over $400, making AMZN an attractive buy due to its diversified model and growth levers.

title: Meta Building New Gigawatt-Sized Data Center in Texas - Bloomberg.com
summary: Meta Platforms Inc. is constructing a new gigawatt-sized data center in El Paso, Texas, investing over $1.5 billion to further its artificial intelligence initiatives. This move marks Meta's continued significant investment to maintain competitiveness in the rapidly evolving AI industry, following previous substantial data center financing.

title: OpenAI accused of using legal tactics to silence nonprofits
summary: OpenAI is accused of using overly broad subpoenas to silence at least seven nonprofit organizations that have been critical of the company. These subpoenas, issued as part of OpenAI's litigation against Elon Musk, are seen by critics as a tactic to intimidate and chill speech, despite many of the nonprofits having no connection to Musk or the lawsuit. The nonprofits argue that OpenAI, initially founded for the benefit of humanity, has strayed from its mission and is leveraging legal processes for corporate advantage.

title: Meta Partners with Arm Holdings for Facebook and Instagram AI Systems - parameter.io
summary: Meta Platforms is partnering with Arm Holdings to power AI ranking and recommendation systems for Facebook and Instagram, utilizing Arm-based data center platforms. This move away from traditional x86 architecture is expected to provide higher performance and lower power consumption, with both companies open-sourcing AI infrastructure software improvements. Meta is also investing $1.5 billion in a new Texas data center to support its expanding AI workloads.

title: Meta Platforms Breaks Ground on $1.5 Billion AI Data Center in Texas - MarketScreener
summary: Meta Platforms has broken ground on a new $1.5 billion AI data center in Texas. This investment underscores Meta's commitment to scaling its AI infrastructure amidst a growing demand for AI capabilities. The facility will support Meta's various platforms including Facebook and Instagram.

title: Oracle Executive Just Gave 50,000 Reasons to Buy AMD Stock Right Now
summary: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure's senior vice president, Karan Batta, announced that Oracle will deploy 50,000 AMD Instinct MI450 AI chips starting in late 2026, bolstering AMD's position as a strong contender in the AI chip market. This significant order diversifies AMD's customer base, offers substantial revenue upside estimated between $1 billion and $1.5 billion, and validates AMD's AI strategy against competitor Nvidia. The deal highlights AMD's competitive advantage in AI inferencing and its open-source ROCm platform, positioning the company for sustained growth in the AI sector.

title: Meta says Arm Holdings PLC & Co enter multi-year strategic partnership to scale AI efficiency - MarketScreener
summary: Meta Platforms and Arm Holdings PLC & Co have entered into a multi-year strategic partnership to enhance AI efficiency. This collaboration focuses on scaling AI for Meta, particularly for powering AI recommendations across platforms like Facebook and Instagram. The news follows Meta's recent commitment of over $1.5 billion for an AI data center in Texas, signaling significant investments in AI infrastructure.

title: Lemonade Appoints Prashant Ratanchandani to Its Board of Directors, Effective October 15, 2025 - MarketScreener
summary: Lemonade, Inc. announced the appointment of Prashant Ratanchandani to its Board of Directors, effective October 15, 2025. He will join a board comprised of other notable members including Lemonade's co-Founders and experienced professionals from various fields.

title: Arista Networks Stock Soars on AI Hype – NVIDIA Rivalry Raises Eyebrows - ts2.tech
summary: Arista Networks (ANET) has seen its stock soar by 59% year-over-year due to strong demand for AI data center networking solutions, with a Q2 FY2025 revenue of $2.205 billion and an adjusted EPS of $0.73. The company faces new competition from NVIDIA, which recently announced Meta and Oracle would adopt its Spectrum-X Ethernet switches for AI. Despite NVIDIA's entry and Arista's high valuation (39x forward EPS), Wall Street analysts largely maintain a "Strong Buy" rating with an average 12-month target of $168, though they caution that the stock is "priced for perfection."

title: BlackRock, Nvidia-backed group strikes $40 billion AI data center deal
summary: An investor group including BlackRock, Microsoft, and Nvidia has agreed to a $40 billion deal to acquire Aligned Data Centers, a major data center operator. This deal reflects the growing demand for AI infrastructure and significant investment from tech giants and investors in the AI boom.

title: Meta Platforms : Breaking Ground on Our New AI-Optimized Data Center in El Paso - MarketScreener
summary: Meta Platforms is building a new 1GW AI-optimized data center in El Paso, Texas, marking its 29th facility. This $1.5 billion investment will support growing AI workloads, create approximately 100 operational jobs, and over 1,800 construction jobs, while focusing on environmental stewardship with LEED Gold certification, water positive initiatives, and 100% clean energy. The data center is designed for flexibility to accommodate evolving AI hardware and network systems.

title: Meta taps Arm Holdings to power AI recommendations across Facebook, Instagram - CNA
summary: Meta Platforms is partnering with Arm Holdings to use Arm-based data center platforms for its AI ranking and recommendation systems across Facebook and Instagram. title: Arm and Meta Deepen Strategic Partnership to Power the Next Era of AI, from Megawatts to Milliwatts, for Billions Worldwide - Arm Newsroom
summary: Arm and Meta have announced a strategic partnership to enhance AI efficiency across all layers of compute, from device-level intelligence to data center infrastructure, for billions of users worldwide. This collaboration focuses on optimizing AI software technologies like PyTorch and utilizing Arm's power-efficient Neoverse-based platforms to achieve significant performance and efficiency gains. The partnership aims to accelerate AI development and deployment from the cloud to the edge, contributing optimizations back to the open-source community.

title: Apple Second-Gen Smart Glasses Could Have Two Modes
summary: Apple's second-generation smart glasses are anticipated to feature two operating modes depending on the connected device. According to Mark Gurman, the glasses will run a full version of visionOS when linked to a Mac, and a lightweight mobile-friendly interface when paired with an iPhone. Apple is prioritizing these smart glasses to compete with rivals like Meta's Ray-Ban smart glasses.

title: Arista Networks (ANET) Sees Buying Opportunity Amid AI Networking Developments

The company exhibits robust financial health with strong revenue growth and profitability, though insider selling activity and high valuation metrics are noted.

title: Billionaire Investor David Tepper's $180M Investment in Intel in Q2 is Already Up 58%

title: Monolithic Power Systems price target raised to $1,200 from $800 at Oppenheimer By Investing.com - Investing.com Australia
summary: Oppenheimer raised its price target for Monolithic Power Systems (NASDAQ:MPWR) to $1,200 from $800, maintaining an Outperform rating due to its strong position as a 48V power supplier for AI GPUs/XPUs and potential for long-term growth. title: UK's Nscale to supply Microsoft with 200,000 Nvidia AI chips - NewsX

This expanded agreement, supported by Dell Technologies, also includes supplying Microsoft with 52,000 Nvidia GPUs from Nscale's AI campus in Norway through a joint venture with Aker. The company, backed by Nvidia, plans to start supply next year and expand its Texas operations, having recently raised $1.1 billion for data center development.

title: Pure Storage Up 69% in 3 Months: Where Will the Stock Head From Here? - The Globe and Mail
summary: Pure Storage, Inc. (PSTG) has seen a significant 69% stock increase in three months, driven by AI tailwinds, its subscription model, and demand for flash-based storage. Zacks Investment Research currently recommends a "Hold" for PSTG, suggesting new investors await a better entry point.

title: Oracle Deepens Microsoft Partnership, Unveils AI Agent Studio And Marketplace - Benzinga

The collaboration aims to enhance supply chain efficiency and responsiveness by integrating Oracle Fusion Cloud SCM with Azure IoT Operations and Microsoft Fabric. Oracle's AI Agent Studio now supports multiple large language models and introduces a marketplace for validated, partner-built AI agents to accelerate enterprise AI adoption.

title: Morgan Stanley says the colossal AI spending spree could pay for itself by 2028 - AOL.com
summary: Morgan Stanley suggests that the immense investments in AI infrastructure by companies are not a speculative bubble and could yield substantial returns. This outlook provides a reassuring perspective for investors concerned about the significant capital being committed to AI.

title: Lemonade adds Meta’s VP of AI Products to its Board of Directors - MarketScreener

He leads engineering teams responsible for Meta's Generative AI products and has held leadership roles at both Meta and Microsoft.

title: BlackRock, Nvidia, Microsoft and xAI to acquire Aligned Data Centers in $40B deal - Türkiye Today
summary: BlackRock, Nvidia, Microsoft, and xAI are set to acquire Aligned Data Centers from Macquarie Asset Management for approximately $40 billion. This acquisition, led by the Asset and Infrastructure Partners (AIP) consortium, aims to significantly expand Aligned Data Centers' operations across the United States and Latin America to meet the growing demand for AI and cloud computing infrastructure. The consortium plans to commit $30 billion in equity and raise an additional $70 billion to fund this expansion, addressing long-term challenges in energy and water management for large-scale data facilities.

title: Oracle’s AI Agent Studio gets enterprise controls, LLM flexibility and deterministic workflows - SiliconANGLE
summary: Oracle Corp. is enhancing its AI Agent Studio for Fusion Applications with new enterprise controls, LLM flexibility, and deterministic workflows. These updates aim to operationalize AI for businesses by improving governance, security, and management visibility for AI agents. The studio now supports various LLMs, offers cost monitoring, and includes a marketplace for prebuilt agents, making AI adoption easier and more controlled for enterprises.

title: Innodata price target raised to $90 from $75 at Wedbush - TipRanks

The firm anticipates further business opportunities for Innodata with its Big Tech and Hyperscaler clients.

title: Down 27% From Its High, Is CoreWeave a Top AI Stock to Buy Right Now? - The Globe and Mail
summary: CoreWeave, an AI-focused cloud computing infrastructure provider, has seen its stock drop 27% from its high, raising questions about whether it's a buying opportunity or a trap. While the company exhibits rapid revenue growth, its burning cash and the short lifespan of GPUs pose significant challenges to its profitability and long-term viability. The article suggests that CoreWeave's reliance on customers who are also building their own AI infrastructure could limit its growth potential, advising investors to consider other AI stocks.

title: Jamie Dimon Says You Can't Look At AI As A Bubble: 'People Should Stop...' - Benzinga
summary: Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase & Co., believes that artificial intelligence is not a bubble, though some related investments might be speculative. He emphasizes that AI represents real innovation with significant long-term payoffs, despite potential job displacement. Dimon urges for thoughtful regulations and guardrails to protect the public from job losses caused by increasing AI adoption, comparing the current AI boom to the early internet era.

title: AMD Stock Moves Higher as New AI Deals Lift Sentiment - TipRanks

Analysts maintain a bullish outlook on AMD's growth in the AI accelerator sector, with a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating and an average price target implying an 11.96% upside.

title: Down 27% From Its High, Is CoreWeave a Top AI Stock to Buy Right Now?
summary: CoreWeave, an AI-focused cloud computing infrastructure provider, has seen its stock drop 27% from its high, raising questions about whether it's a good investment. While its revenue is exploding, the company remains unprofitable, and the short lifespan of GPUs poses a challenge to its long-term viability and profitability. Investors are cautioned to consider the potential for clients to eventually transition away from CoreWeave's services to their own infrastructure.

title: 3 Reasons to Care About Private Markets Even if You’re Not Investing in Them - Morningstar
summary: The article explains why investors should be aware of private markets even if they don't directly invest in them. It highlights that shifts in capital formation are significantly impacting public stock and bond markets, leading to a smaller public market opportunity set, struggles for small-cap stocks, and changes in high-yield bond characteristics due to the rise of bank loans and private debt. The author argues that private markets' growth has broad implications for all investors.

title: Samsung joins Nvidia's NVLink Fusion program to produce custom AI chips — additional Spectrum-X platform to be deployed by Meta and Oracle for data center use - Tom's Hardware

This partnership expands Nvidia's control over the AI supply chain beyond TSMC, enabling companies to license Nvidia's IP and manufacture chips at Samsung. Additionally, Meta and Oracle will deploy Nvidia's Spectrum-X Ethernet platform for AI data centers, demonstrating Nvidia's ambition to dominate both compute and networking in the AI ecosystem.

title: OpenAI partners with Broadcom to build its own AI chips - Techloy

The collaboration also signals a move towards open, modular infrastructure, distinct from proprietary ecosystems.

title: The Battle of the Billionaires: Musk Leads the Pack in 2025! - OpenTools

title: The AI Ouroboros - The American Prospect

It highlights the financial unsustainability of this model, particularly for OpenAI's ambitious buildout plans, which involve significant deals with Oracle and AMD despite a lack of sufficient cash. The piece warns of a potential AI bubble due to these practices, coupled with looming shortfalls in revenue and power infrastructure.

title: Should I buy Tesla shares ahead of Q3 earnings? - Fool UK
summary: This article discusses whether investors should buy Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) shares before its Q3 earnings report. While there's optimism for strong Q3 results due to a surge in EV sales demand, the author suggests waiting, citing potential Q4 slowdowns, delays in key projects like robotaxis and Optimus robots, and uncertainty surrounding the company's long-term ventures. The author advocates for a strategic "wait and see" approach until the stock price offers sufficient value.

title: Caterpillar Stock Rallies Most In Over 4 Months After Analyst Sees AI-Driven Growth In Power Segment - Asianet Newsable
summary: Caterpillar (CAT) stock rallied over 4.5% after JPMorgan raised its price target to $650, citing bullish prospects in the company's power generation business. This growth is driven by increasing power demand from AI data centers, with JPMorgan projecting double-digit percentage growth in Caterpillar's Energy and Transportation segment between 2026 and 2028. Caterpillar has also secured an agreement to provide 4 gigawatts of energy to an upcoming data center, leading analysts to focus on the company's backlog in its upcoming Q3 earnings report.

title: Samsung’s Android-powered XR headset to debut in October - KED Global
summary: Samsung Electronics is set to launch its extended reality (XR) device, "Project Moohan," on October 22, in collaboration with Google and Qualcomm. The headset will run on Android XR and aims to compete with devices from Meta and Apple in the rapidly growing XR market, which is projected to reach $1.1 trillion by 2030. Samsung anticipates that its hardware expertise combined with Google's software will offer a more accessible platform for users and developers.

title: South Korean Investors Move $1.24 Billion to US Tech and Crypto Markets
summary: During South Korea's Chuseok holiday, investors poured $1.24 billion into overseas markets, primarily targeting high-risk, leveraged US tech and crypto assets. Leveraged Tesla ETFs, Iris Energy, and Meta Platforms were among the top investments, showcasing a strong risk appetite despite previous losses and global market volatility. This trend is driven by a desire for rapid financial growth, limited local market returns, and increasing regulatory support for crypto-friendly policies in South Korea.

title: Top Social Media Stocks To Watch Now – October 13th
summary: This article identifies five social media stocks, Strive (ASST), Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT), Blackboxstocks (BLBX), and JOYY (YY) (listed twice), that had the highest dollar trading volume recently, making them top stocks to watch in the social media sector. It provides a brief description of each company, highlighting their primary operations and business models within the social networking space. The article also touches on general metrics investors use to evaluate social media companies and the risks involved.

title: AI will create a better world, says Oracle's Ellison - Computer Weekly
summary: At Oracle's renamed AI World event, founder Larry Ellison emphasized AI's transformative potential, claiming it will create a better world by solving humanity's most difficult problems and leading to longer, healthier lives. CEO Mike Sicilia highlighted Oracle's ambition to be a leader in AI, integrating data, infrastructure, and applications to power AI initiatives across industries. The company also announced significant upgrades, including Oracle AI Database 26ai, Oracle AI Data Platform, and an expanded partnership with AMD for AI supercluster development.

title: Smart Speaker Market Featuring Amazon, Google & Apple: Growth & Forecast 2032
summary: The smart speaker market is projected to grow from USD 11.81 Billion in 2024 to USD 42.05 Billion by 2032, at a CAGR of 17.20%. This SkyQuest Technology Group report offers a strategic analysis of the market, segmenting it by OS type, application, power source, and technology, while also highlighting key regional growth drivers and competitive landscapes. Leading companies like Amazon, Google, and Apple are profiled, with an emphasis on their strategies and future product evolution.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI targets gaming with ‘world models,’ hires Nvidia experts - Storyboard18
summary: Elon Musk's xAI is venturing into the video game industry, utilizing advanced 'world models' to create life-like gaming environments. The company is actively recruiting AI experts, including former Nvidia researchers, and plans to release an AI-generated game by the end of 2026. This move positions xAI to compete with other tech giants in developing AI systems that understand real-world physics and environments.

title: Calif. Passes New Laws On Children's Use Of Social Media, AI - Law360
summary: California Governor Gavin Newsom has signed several new laws aimed at protecting children from the potential threats of social media and emerging artificial intelligence technologies. These laws introduce measures such as age verification requirements, limits on liability defenses for AI developers and users, and mandated reminders for minors using companion chatbots to take breaks. The legislation reflects a proactive stance by California to address concerns over children's online safety and the responsible development of AI.

title: Tech Stocks Climb As AI, Chips, And Gadgets Spark Investor Interest - Finimize
summary: Tech stocks, especially chipmakers, saw significant gains driven by advancements in AI, planned product launches, and strategic investments. Meta's $1.5 billion investment in an AI data center and OpenAI's $1 trillion spending plan highlight the growing investor confidence in artificial intelligence. Companies like Apple, AMD, and Alphabet also contributed to the surge with new device rollouts and expanded autonomous vehicle services.

title: Apple Stock Shrugs Off Trade War Scare as New Products & CEO Succession Buzz Fuel Optimism - ts2.tech
summary: Apple Inc. (AAPL) stock remained stable despite U.S.-China trade war threats, closing near $248 on October 14, 2025, buoyed by dovish Fed signals and optimism about new product launches. The company is preparing to unveil new MacBook Pros with M5 chips, iPad Pros, and an upgraded Vision Pro headset, while also subtly preparing for CEO Tim Cook's succession with John Ternus emerging as a leading internal candidate. Analysts are split on Apple's outlook, with some forecasting a new "supercycle" of demand and a $310 price target, while others express valuation concerns given the current market cap of $3.8 trillion.

title: Oriental Harbor Trims $5.4 Million From TQQQ ETF — But Still Keeps Big Tech Bet Intact
summary: Oriental Harbor Investment Master Fund sold $5.4 million worth of ProShares UltraPro QQQ (TQQQ) shares in Q3, but the leveraged ETF remains a significant portion of its portfolio. This reduction is viewed as a prudent rebalancing move after strong returns, as the fund maintains a strong conviction in technology-driven strategies through its direct holdings in companies like Nvidia and Alphabet, and other leveraged funds. TQQQ, which tracks the Nasdaq-100 Index with 3x leverage, has significantly outperformed the S&P 500 over the past year.

title: Jamie Dimon gets real on AI, sees stocks ‘in some form of bubble territory’ - Fortune
summary: Jamie Dimon, CEO of JPMorgan Chase, discussed the transformative power of AI while cautioning that some asset prices are in "bubble territory." He distinguished between AI's genuine breakthrough and the speculative nature of certain investments, urging businesses to adopt AI but also to prepare for potential job displacement. Dimon also highlighted JPMorgan's extensive AI investments and the need for thoughtful planning to mitigate AI's societal impacts.

title: Meta Platforms price target raised to $870 from $830 at Goldman Sachs - TipRanks
summary: Goldman Sachs has increased its price target for Meta Platforms (META) to $870 from $830, maintaining a Buy rating. This adjustment reflects a positive outlook on Meta's operating environment, leading to boosted topline growth estimates for 2026 and beyond. The firm also anticipates Meta will moderate its non-D&A total expense growth in the coming years.

title: Oriental Harbor Adds $39.5 Million Alibaba Stake After Strong Quarter and Surging AI Growth - Mitrade
summary: Oriental Harbor Investment Master Fund acquired a new position in Alibaba Group Holding Limited, purchasing 221,003 shares valued at approximately $39.5 million. This investment diversifies Oriental Harbor's portfolio, which is heavily weighted in U.S. tech giants, adding Chinese tech exposure. The move follows Alibaba's strong Q3 performance, including a 10% revenue increase and triple-digit growth in AI-related product revenue.

title: Oriental Harbor Adds $39.5 Million Alibaba Stake After Strong Quarter and Surging AI Growth
summary: Oriental Harbor Investment Master Fund has acquired a new stake of approximately $39.5 million in Alibaba Group Holding Limited, making it a new position and representing 3.1% of the fund’s reportable AUM. This move diversifies the fund's portfolio, which is heavily weighted in U.S. tech giants, adding exposure to Chinese tech against a backdrop of Alibaba's strong quarterly revenue growth and surging AI-related product revenue. The investment comes as Alibaba shares have significantly outperformed the S&P 500 over the past year.

title: Oriental Harbor Sells $37 Million in Netflix Stock — Here's What Long-Term Investors Should Know - The Motley Fool
summary: Oriental Harbor Investment Master Fund sold 30,576 shares of Netflix, valued at an estimated $37.3 million, in the third quarter of 2025. This transaction reduced Netflix's stake in the fund's reportable assets to 1.13%, though the fund maintains a strong focus on megacap tech. Despite the sale, Netflix continues to show exceptional financial performance with significant revenue and earnings growth, suggesting the trim was more about portfolio rebalancing after a substantial stock rally.

title: Opinion: Say Goodbye to Nvidia's Biggest Competitive Edge in 2026
summary: Nvidia's dominance in the GPU market may face significant challenges by 2026 due to increasing competition from AMD's advanced MI450 GPUs and an OpenAI partnership, as well as hyperscalers developing proprietary silicon to reduce costs. Geopolitical tensions and supply chain diversification efforts could further impact Nvidia's market share and valuation. Investors are advised to monitor these developments as they could pressure Nvidia's growth trajectory beyond 2026.

title: Roblox on a Trajectory to Billion-User Status, Mirroring YouTube's Meteoric Rise - FinancialContent
summary: Morgan Stanley projects that Roblox will reach one billion monthly active users by 2030, mirroring YouTube's growth trajectory and highlighting the immense potential of user-generated content models and immersive virtual experiences. The report maintains an "Overweight" rating on Roblox stock with an optimistic price target, citing the platform's strategic integration of AI, robust creator economy, and diversified user base. This growth signifies a pivotal moment for the digital landscape, impacting various industries and emphasizing the future of digital engagement through UGC and metaverse models.

title: Mixed options sentiment in Meta Platforms Inc with shares down 0.61% - TipRanks
summary: Meta Platforms Inc (META) is experiencing mixed options sentiment, with its shares currently down 0.61%. Options volume is relatively light, showing a put/call ratio of 0.54, which is slightly higher than its typical level, and implied volatility is elevated. Despite the mixed signals, a modestly bullish tone is suggested by the flattened put-call skew ahead of its upcoming earnings report.

title: Oracle (ORCL) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) Sign Deal for 50,000 AI Chips - Stansberry Research
summary: Oracle (ORCL) and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) have partnered for cloud-computing services utilizing AMD's latest AI chips, with Oracle initially deploying 50,000 chips and planning future expansion. This deal highlights the ongoing "circular" AI economy where major tech companies are both customers and suppliers. The article also emphasizes that the massive demand for AI necessitates significant advancements in power generation, particularly nuclear fusion, to meet future computational needs.

title: Wells Fargo Elevates Applied Materials (AMAT) Price Target to $250 Amidst AI Supercycle
summary: Wells Fargo has increased its price target for Applied Materials (AMAT) to $250, maintaining an "Overweight" rating, due to strong confidence in the semiconductor capital equipment sector amidst the accelerating global AI infrastructure development. The firm highlights AMAT's pivotal role in the "AI Supercycle" through its advanced technologies for chip manufacturing, including its Centura™ Xtera™ Epi system and Kinex™ hybrid bonding system. This bullish outlook emphasizes AMAT's strategic positioning to benefit from the growing demand for advanced process nodes, HBM, and advanced packaging driven by major tech companies' investments in AI.

title: OpenAI is trying to be a Google with its tie-up with Broadcom, says analyst and they don't seem to be ple - Times of India
summary: OpenAI is partnering with Broadcom to develop custom AI chips, a strategy that analysts believe mirrors Google's approach to reduce costs. This move positions OpenAI against competitors like Nvidia, but concerns are being raised about the immense spending and energy demands associated with such a venture.

title: Stock Of The Day: Walmart In Buy Zone On OpenAI Deal - Investor's Business Daily
summary: Walmart (WMT) became the IBD Stock of the Day after its shares rallied past a buy point following the announcement of a partnership with OpenAI. This collaboration will enable users to purchase items directly from Walmart through the ChatGPT AI bot, pushing Walmart stock to a record high. The move highlights Walmart's focus on AI-powered shopping and follows similar deals by OpenAI with other e-commerce platforms.

title: Caterpillar Stock Rallies Most In Over 4 Months After Analyst Sees AI-Driven Growth In Power Segment - Stocktwits
summary: Caterpillar Inc. (CAT) stock surged over 4.5% after JPMorgan raised its price target to a street-high of $650, citing bullish growth prospects for its power generation business driven by AI data center demand. JPMorgan projects double-digit percentage growth in Caterpillar's Energy and Transportation segment between 2026 and 2028, with potential for greater than $10 incremental earnings per share. The company has already secured a significant agreement to provide power for an upcoming data center in Utah.

title: Piper Sandler Keeps Their Buy Rating on Meta Platforms (META)
summary: Piper Sandler reiterated a Buy rating on Meta Platforms (META) with an $880.00 price target. This aligns with a strong Buy consensus among analysts, with an average price target of $876.98. Corporate insider sentiment for META is positive, with significant share purchases by insiders, including COO Javier Olivan.

title: Nvidia Brings Open-Source Innovation to AI Factories at OCP 2025
summary: Nvidia introduced several open-source innovations at the Open Compute Project (OCP) Global Summit 2025 aimed at developing "giga-scale AI factories." These advancements focus on next-generation data centers, featuring new rack designs, power delivery methods, and expanded partnerships for its NVLink Fusion ecosystem. The goal is to provide a unified, open approach to building and scaling AI data centers, emphasizing efficiency and open standards.

title: Nasdaq 100 Outlook As Quantum And AI Bubble Fears Intensify - The Market Periodical
summary: The Nasdaq 100 Index is facing potential bearish pressure due to intensifying fears of an AI bubble and risks within the quantum computing sector. Analysts are concerned about inflated valuations in both industries, with a Bloomberg survey indicating that 54% of participants believe the AI industry is in a bubble. The article highlights the significant market capitalization of quantum computing companies despite low revenues and substantial losses, and concludes with a technical analysis suggesting a potential bearish breakout for the Nasdaq 100.

title: Form FWP Morgan Stanley Finance Filed by: Morgan Stanley Finance LLC - StreetInsider
summary: Morgan Stanley Finance LLC has filed a Free Writing Prospectus (Form FWP) for Market Linked Securities—Auto-Callable with Contingent Coupon with Memory Feature and Contingent Downside Principal at Risk Securities. These securities, fully and unconditionally guaranteed by Morgan Stanley, are linked to the performance of common stocks of NVIDIA Corporation, Meta Platforms, Inc., Alphabet Inc., and Broadcom Inc., maturing on October 20, 2028. The filing details the terms, risks, and payout profile, including contingent coupon payments and automatic call features, and highlights that investors do not participate in stock appreciation but bear full downside exposure if certain thresholds are breached.

title: How Meta & Oracle Boost AI with Nvidia Spectrum-X Ethernet - Technology Magazine
summary: Meta and Oracle are adopting Nvidia's Spectrum-X Ethernet networking technologies to enhance the performance of their large-scale AI data centers, enabling more efficient training of trillion-parameter models. This move signifies a major expansion of Nvidia's networking influence among hyperscale companies, driving giga-scale AI performance with an Ethernet solution specifically designed for AI tasks. Both companies leverage Spectrum-X to support next-generation AI infrastructure, with Oracle integrating it into OCI and Meta employing it within its Facebook Open Switching System.

title: Nvidia Stock Falls 4% -- U.S-China Tensions Rattle AI Chip Investors - TradingView
summary: Nvidia Corp. shares fell 4% due to renewed U.S.-China trade tensions and increasing competition in the AI hardware market after China's transport ministry reviewed a U.S. probe into Chinese shipping firms. Semiconductor peers, including Broadcom, also retreated. Despite the decline, analysts primarily view the weakness as temporary, citing Nvidia's strong developer ecosystem and dominant software platform as long-term growth drivers.

title: Arm joins with Open Compute Project to unveil new chiplet standards for AI data centers - SiliconANGLE
summary: Arm Holdings plc is collaborating with the Open Compute Project to establish new high-efficiency infrastructure standards for AI data centers, aiming to address increasing energy demands. This initiative includes supporting the development of purpose-built silicon and packaging with a new Foundation Chiplet System Architecture (FCSA) specification and expanding the Arm Total Design ecosystem. The goal is to promote modular chiplet designs for denser, more efficient, and less power-hungry AI compute solutions.

title: Can LinkedIn Revenue Growth Accelerate Microsoft Stock's Upward Trend? - The Globe and Mail
summary: Microsoft's LinkedIn platform is experiencing significant growth in members and engagement, driven by AI advancements in hiring and marketing solutions. This strong performance, with projected double-digit revenue growth for LinkedIn in fiscal years 2026 and 2027, is expected to positively influence Microsoft's stock trajectory. Microsoft shares have outperformed the market year-to-date and maintain a "Buy" rating from Zacks, despite trading at a premium valuation.

title: Instagram adds content restrictions, BlackRock gains on Q3 beat - Yahoo Finance
summary: BlackRock (BLK) reported strong Q3 earnings, driven by $205 billion in net inflows from ETFs and private markets, causing its shares to rise. Meta's (META) Instagram is implementing new content restrictions for users under 18 in response to ongoing pressure and lawsuits regarding its apps' impact on younger audiences. Domino's (DPZ) exceeded quarterly earnings expectations and saw strong US sales, attributed to promotions and a DoorDash partnership, with management optimistic about continued momentum.

title: Williams: Attractive Secular Tailwinds With Visible Growth (NYSE:WMB) - Seeking Alpha
summary: Williams (WMB) is shifting its focus to become a key enabler for the digital economy, specifically targeting AI data center power needs through its Power Innovation strategy. The company's natural gas pipeline network and new "behind the meter" generation projects, including partnerships with Meta (META), offer scalable growth due to strong unit economics. WMB's exposure to major natural gas basins like Haynesville and Appalachia ensures resilient cash flow and positions it to benefit from increasing LNG demand.

title: From Clouds To Chips: Is The Tech Sector Entering A New Phase For Investors? - Seeking Alpha
summary: This article explores whether the tech sector is entering a new phase for investors, driven by the changing nature of innovation. It questions if the "golden era" of tech investing is still ongoing and how technology returns have evolved across different tech innovation periods. The piece highlights the significant impact of revolutionary technologies that emerge every few decades, specifically mentioning the rise of AI and its influence on semiconductors.

title: What role does Latin America play in Oracle’s overvaluation? Understand
summary: Latin America contributes to Oracle's growing number of AI technology applications, though it is not the primary driver of the tech giant's recent valuation surge. Billion-dollar contracts come mainly from leading AI model developers and global technology companies, while Latin America's role is significant in consuming GPU processors and developing applications based on large language models. Oracle executives note the region's increasing demand and potential for future investment and application export.

title: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) Expands into Data Center Construction Business
summary: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) is expanding its business by offering "Data Center Building Block Solutions" to help customers construct entire data centers, including GPUs, servers, networking, and cooling. This new service aims to reduce "time to online" and incorporates liquid-cooling systems that can cut power usage by up to 40%. The announcement comes amidst increased demand for data centers driven by AI and follows a period of stock volatility due to past accounting concerns that were later dismissed.

title: Who is the richest person in the world 2025? Is Elon Musk a trillionaire - Bergen Record
summary: Elon Musk was briefly dethroned as the world's richest person by Larry Ellison but quickly regained the top position with an estimated net worth of $453 billion as of October 14, 2025. This article details the fluctuating net worths of the world's wealthiest individuals, including the top 10 list, President Donald Trump's net worth, and a look at the wealthiest countries globally. It highlights the significant growth in billionaires and collective wealth in 2025.

title: Nasdaq 2026 Breakout? Netflix, Meta and AI Stocks Poised for Stock-Split Frenzy! - ts2.tech
summary: This article discusses the potential for a stock-split frenzy among major tech companies like Netflix and Meta in 2026, driven by their strong financial performance and high stock prices. It highlights how stock splits often act as catalysts for further gains and explores other AI-related companies that might follow suit. Despite some market caution, analysts remain largely optimistic about the Nasdaq's continued bull run, fueled by AI investments and favorable economic conditions.

title: LiveOne Regains Nasdaq Compliance, Bolstering Investor Confidence Amidst Aggressive Stock Buyback
summary: LiveOne (Nasdaq: LVO) announced it has regained compliance with Nasdaq listing rules, effectively maintaining the minimum bid price. This development coincides with the company's aggressive stock buyback program, with $5.5 million still authorized, signaling strong management confidence in its valuation. LiveOne is also pursuing strategic pivots, including B2B partnerships and Web3 initiatives, while navigating a challenging digital media landscape.

title: Up 4x This Year, What’s Next For Applied Digital Stock? - Trefis
summary: Applied Digital (NASDAQ:APLD) stock has surged by 330% year-to-date due to strong Q1 results driven by AI data center demand. The company, which designs and operates AI-first data centers, is benefiting from substantial investments in AI infrastructure by major tech companies. While its valuation is high, future growth is projected to be robust as new data centers come online, though risks like capital intensity and increasing competition remain.

title: Amazon top idea in internet investing space, analysts also favor Alphabet, Meta - Proactive financial news
summary: JP Morgan analysts maintain a bullish outlook on Amazon, Alphabet, and Meta, citing strong growth prospects and attractive valuations. Amazon is highlighted for its AWS acceleration and consumer spending benefits. Alphabet is recognized for its AI products and Gemini 3, while Meta's AI Ad improvements and Reels are noted as key drivers.

title: Where can I watch the Victoria's Secret show 2025? - CEO Today
summary: The Victoria's Secret Fashion Show is making its return on October 15, 2025, after a six-year hiatus, streaming live at 7 p.m. ET on Amazon Prime Video, YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, and Amazon Live. The event will feature a mix of returning Angels and new faces, including Gigi Hadid, Ashley Graham, and WNBA star Angel Reese, with performances by Missy Elliott, Karol G, Madison Beer, and TWICE. The show aims to celebrate diversity, body positivity, and modern beauty ideals, building on the brand's reimagined approach since its pause in 2018.

title: Wall Street Analysts Just Upgraded These Five Stocks: DASH, AMD, WMG, META, PANW - 24/7 Wall St.
summary: Despite trade war fears impacting markets, Wall Street analysts have upgraded several key stocks. This article details the upgrades for DoorDash (DASH) by JPMorgan, Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) by Wolfe Research and Mizuho, Warner Music Group Corp. (WMG) by Wells Fargo, Meta Platforms (META) by Citi, and Palo Alto Networks (PANW) by BTIG, highlighting the reasons for their bullish outlooks including acquisitions, market share gains, and new partnerships.

title: Wayve wheels in Microsoft and Softbank for $2bn cash injection
summary: British autonomous driving startup Wayve is in early talks with Microsoft and SoftBank for a potential $2 billion funding round, which would value the AI firm at $8 billion. Wayve, founded in 2017, uses machine learning and computer vision for self-driving technology and is already backed by major investors like Nvidia and SoftBank, testing its software with partners such as Asda, Ocado, and Uber. This significant investment would underscore confidence in the UK's AI innovation sector.

title: Rising AI Chip Demand to Boost Taiwan Semiconductor's Q3 Revenues - The Globe and Mail
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor is projected to see significant revenue growth in Q3 due to surging demand for AI chips, with strong performance in 3nm and 5nm manufacturing nodes. Despite rising operational costs from global expansion and increased energy prices, analysts remain optimistic about the company's bottom-line growth. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for Q3 revenue is $31.5 billion, and earnings per share are forecasted at $2.59, representing substantial year-over-year increases.

title: Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg, Jeff Bezos Gain Billions As S&P 500, Nasdaq Rally Adds $60 Billion To Top 10 Billionaires' Wealth
summary: The world's ten richest individuals saw their combined wealth increase by nearly $60 billion due to a rebound in global markets, driven by optimism over President Donald Trump's softened stance on China. Tech executives like Elon Musk, Larry Ellison, and Mark Zuckerberg were among the biggest gainers, with Musk's net worth alone skyrocketing by $16 billion. Despite this surge, some experts warn of a potential tech bubble and advise diversifying investments.

title: Future Of Vision Pro Headset Uncertain As Apple Favors Smart Glasses Development - iLounge
summary: Apple has reportedly paused the development of its Vision Pro headset and its planned budget version, the Vision Air, to prioritize smart glasses development. The company aims to release its first smart glasses by 2026, competing directly with Meta. The Vision Pro, announced in mid-2023 with a starting price of $3,499, may see its development resume after the smart glasses launch.

title: Investing mantra: Why your portfolio needs global diversification - explained
summary: Indian equity funds with global investments have demonstrated superior performance compared to domestic-only funds, especially when the broader market has been stagnant or declining. This success is attributed to gains from US tech giants and rupee depreciation. Experts advise allocating 10-15% of an equity portfolio to global stocks to mitigate local market risks and capitalize on worldwide growth opportunities.

title: Nvidia DGX Spark Supercomputer With Grace Blackwell Chipset to Go on Sale Starting October 15 - Gadgets 360
summary: Nvidia's latest AI supercomputer, the DGX Spark, which uses the Grace Blackwell Superchip, will be available for purchase starting October 15 for $3,999. This compact, yet powerful, system is designed for advanced AI workloads, featuring 128GB unified memory and one petaflop of AI performance. Early recipients include major tech companies like Google, Meta, and Microsoft.

title: OpenAI partners with Broadcom on custom AI chips to meet soaring demand - The American Bazaar
summary: OpenAI and Broadcom have announced a partnership to jointly build and deploy 10 gigawatts of custom AI accelerators, aiming to scale AI infrastructure. This collaboration, underway for 18 months, will involve OpenAI designing the chips and systems, with Broadcom handling development and deployment of racks starting late next year. The initiative is a strategic move to meet the surging global demand for AI compute power, with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman highlighting the potential for huge efficiency gains, better performance, and cheaper AI models.

title: AMD Unveils "Helios" Rack-Scale AI Platform at OCP Global Summit 2025, Pioneering Open Infrastructure Standards - Quiver Quantitative
summary: At the OCP Global Summit 2025, AMD unveiled its "Helios" rack-scale AI platform, an open AI reference platform designed in partnership with Meta's Open Rack Wide (ORW) standard. This platform, integrating AMD Instinct GPUs, EPYC CPUs, and advanced networking, aims to provide high performance, efficiency, and scalability for demanding AI workloads in large data centers. "Helios" emphasizes open, interoperable AI infrastructure, quicker serviceability, and efficient cooling, enabling rapid adoption and customization by OEMs and hyperscalers.

title: AMD Showcases 'Helios” Rack-Scale Platform Built on the Open Compute Project Open Rack for AI, Introduced by Meta - The Manila Times
summary: AMD unveiled its "Helios" rack-scale platform, designed for AI workloads and built on Meta's Open Compute Project (OCP) Open Rack standards. This platform features AMD Instinct MI300X accelerators, showcasing AMD's commitment to open ecosystem innovation in artificial intelligence. The announcement highlights collaboration with industry leaders like Supermicro and emphasizes modularity and efficiency for large-scale AI deployments.

title: Super Micro launches new data center construction business as stock continues to recover - Yahoo Finance
summary: Super Micro (SMCI) is launching a new business line called Data Center Building Block Solutions to help customers construct full data centers, including GPUs, servers, networking, cooling, and electrical systems. This offering aims to reduce the "time-to-online" for new data centers, enabling faster deployment and monetization of AI and other algorithmic operations. The company's stock has seen significant recovery, up 81% year-to-date, despite past issues with accounting irregularities.

title: Can AMD Stock Reach $300 In 2025? - Barchart.com
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock is being scrutinized for its potential to reach $300 by 2025, following a significant partnership with OpenAI and strong analyst upgrades. While AMD's valuation metrics are high, its growth in AI chips and data centers, coupled with strategic acquisitions, positions it as a major player in the semiconductor industry. Analysts currently hold a "Moderate Buy" rating with price targets ranging up to $300, driven by expectations of substantial revenue and EPS boosts from AI initiatives.

title: AMD Showcases “Helios” Rack-Scale Platform Built on the Open Compute Project Open Rack for AI, Introduced by Meta - Toronto Star
summary: AMD unveiled its "Helios" rack-scale platform at the OCP Global Summit 2025, an open-based AI reference platform built on Meta's Open Rack Wide (ORW) standard. Powered by AMD Instinct GPUs, EPYC CPUs, and Pensando networking, Helios aims to provide scalable and efficient infrastructure for next-generation AI workloads. This platform underscores AMD's commitment to open standards and collaboration within the Open Compute Project community to address the growing demands of AI.

title: AMD Showcases “Helios” Rack-Scale Platform Built on the Open Compute Project Open Rack for AI, Introduced by Meta - Yahoo Finance
summary: AMD unveiled its "Helios" rack-scale platform at the OCP Global Summit 2025, an open-based AI reference platform built on Meta's Open Rack Wide (ORW) standard. Powered by AMD Instinct GPUs, EPYC CPUs, and Pensando networking, "Helios" aims to provide scalable and efficient infrastructure for next-generation AI workloads. This initiative highlights AMD's commitment to open standards and collaborative development to meet increasing global AI demands.

title: Nvidia Unveils ‘World’s Smallest AI Supercomputer’ - TechRepublic
summary: Nvidia has launched the DGX Spark, which it calls "the world's smallest AI supercomputer," to address the growing demands of AI workloads. This compact desktop system provides 1 petaflop of AI performance and 128GB of unified memory, allowing developers to run and fine-tune large AI models locally. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang personally delivered one of the first units to Elon Musk, highlighting the supercomputer's potential to drive new AI breakthroughs.

title: Instagram unveils new feature said to help protect teens - ABC News - Breaking News, Latest News and Videos
summary: Instagram has announced a new feature designed to help protect younger users. The platform will implement a new system to rate and limit sensitive content for teens. This initiative comes as part of ongoing efforts to enhance safety measures for its youth demographic.
source: ABC News - Breaking News, Latest News and Videos

title: Oracle to offer cloud services using AMD's upcoming AI chips - MarketScreener
summary: Oracle Corporation (ORCL) will offer cloud services utilizing AMD's upcoming AI chips, specifically planning to deploy 50,000 AMD AI chips in its Oracle Cloud infrastructure. This move highlights Oracle's significant investment in AI capabilities and its collaboration with AMD to enhance its cloud service offerings for AI workloads. The partnership addresses the growing demand for robust AI infrastructure.

title: Oracle Becomes the Destination of Choice for AI Innovators - MarketScreener
summary: Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI) has become a preferred platform for AI innovators due to its high performance, reliability, and scalability for large-scale AI training and inference. Numerous AI startups and enterprises, including Baseten, Luma AI, Mithril, Modular, Rime, and Tensor, are leveraging OCI for its advanced capabilities and cost efficiency. These companies highlight OCI's role in accelerating model training, optimizing workloads, and enabling global scaling for demanding AI applications.

title: Arista Stock Falls As Nvidia Wins Meta, Oracle Orders For AI Networking Chips - inkl
summary: Arista Networks' stock fell after Nvidia announced that Meta Platforms and Oracle would use its Spectrum-X Ethernet networking devices for AI computing in their data centers. This move suggests increased competition for Arista, despite its projected revenue growth in AI networking. Nvidia's strategy of bundling its networking devices with AI accelerators presents a formidable challenge to Arista in the burgeoning AI networking market.

title: Latest] Immersive Vr Market Focus: Challenges, Trends, and Insights
summary: The Immersive VR market is projected to reach USD 80 billion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of over 30% from 2024 to 2030, driven by gaming, training, education, and enterprise adoption. While offering significant investment opportunities in sectors like healthcare and education, the market faces challenges such as high hardware costs, content fragmentation, privacy concerns, and regulatory uncertainty. title: OCP Launches AI Data Center Initiative to Standardize Power and Cooling - TechPowerUp

Key projects include developing new Coolant Distribution Units (CDU), direct current power distribution architectures, and specifications for high-performance AI compute trays.

title: NVIDIA Empowers Meta and Oracle with Next-Gen AI Data Centers

Spectrum-X promises a significant upgrade over traditional Ethernet, with up to 95% data throughput, reshaping the economics of AI-scale networking for hyperscalers.

title: Apple hit with new copyright lawsuit over material used to train its AI

This cost is passed on to households and smaller businesses, while power suppliers and tech companies alike profit from the increased demand for energy and AI hardware. Investors are closely watching CEO Jensen Huang's comments on the company's outlook, China business, and next-generation product pipeline, particularly the forthcoming Rubin platform and the potential $50 billion China market opportunity. Despite these mixed results and ongoing China trade policy headwinds, analysts remain overwhelmingly bullish on Nvidia's long-term prospects due to strong AI demand.

These systems will be used for high-volume production test and burn-in of advanced AI processors and are expected to ship over the next two quarters. The hyperscaler plans to expand capacity for this initial device and add more AI devices, highlighting the growing demand for Aehr's solutions in the rapidly expanding AI semiconductor market which is projected to reach over $600 billion by 2032.

title: NVIDIA Blackwell-Powered Jetson Thor Now Available, Accelerating the Age of General Robotics
summary: NVIDIA has announced the general availability of its NVIDIA Jetson AGX Thor developer kit and production modules, designed to power advanced robotics and physical AI. Powered by Blackwell GPUs, Jetson Thor delivers significantly higher AI compute and energy efficiency than its predecessor, enabling robots to have real-time, intelligent interactions. Industry leaders like Agility Robotics, Amazon Robotics, Boston Dynamics, and Figure are among the early adopters, praising its capabilities for running powerful AI models at the edge.

title: Entergy to Build Three Gas Plants for Meta’s Biggest Data Center
summary: Louisiana regulators approved Entergy Corp.'s plan to construct three natural gas plants to power Meta Platform Inc.'s expansive 4 million–square–foot data center, dubbed Hyperion. This facility, intended for Meta's AI models, is projected to consume up to 5 gigawatts of electricity. Entergy states Meta will cover project costs, which include new transmission lines and 1.5 gigawatts of solar power procurement, without impacting grid customers, yet some critics argue it will raise consumer bills and endanger public health and the environment.

title: Entergy Louisiana receives LPSC approval for major infrastructure investments to support Meta’s data center and improve reliability
summary: Entergy Louisiana has received approval from the Louisiana Public Service Commission (LPSC) for significant infrastructure investments to support Meta's new data center in Richland Parish. These investments include constructing three new combined cycle combustion turbine generation facilities and new transmission facilities, which will enhance grid reliability for all customers and support economic growth. The agreement also allows Entergy Louisiana to procure up to 1,500 megawatts of solar resources.

title: Entergy power plant for Meta data center moves toward early regulatory approval
summary: State utility regulators are planning an early vote on Entergy's proposal to build a $3.2 billion power plant for Meta's $10 billion data center in Northeast Louisiana. The fast-tracked decision has raised concerns about transparency from ratepayer advocacy groups, though many stakeholders have reached an agreement with Entergy to advance the project. The project is expected to bring significant job creation to an economically depressed area and addresses growing demand for digital services, but concerns remain regarding potential long-term costs for ratepayers and preferential treatment for Meta regarding renewable energy access.

title: Entergy Louisiana wants fast approval of gas plants to power Meta data center
summary: Entergy Louisiana is seeking fast-tracked approval for three new gas-fired power plants to supply 2.3 gigawatts of power for a Meta data center in Richland Parish. Consumer advocates are challenging the proposal, arguing that Entergy bypassed competitive bidding and failed to adequately assess alternatives or long-term costs to ratepayers, especially since Meta's 15-year contract covers only half the typical lifespan of gas plants, potentially leaving consumers responsible for billions in costs if Meta exits early. The Louisiana Public Service Commission is set to vote on the project on August 20, potentially before an administrative law judge issues recommendations on ongoing legal challenges.

title: ProShares Launches First ETF to Target 2x Daily Returns of Nasdaq-100 Top 30 Index

This new offering expands ProShares' $40 billion suite of leveraged and inverse Nasdaq-100 ETFs, focusing on 30 leading companies including Nvidia, Apple, and Meta Platforms. ProShares aims to allow investors to target magnified daily returns from these influential innovators through a single ETF trade.

authors: Tim Bohen, Ben Sturgill, Ellis Hobbs

title: Here’s how AI and tariffs can impact the U.S. economy, according to Morgan Stanley

They note that the productivity benefits could manifest within 2-3 years, similar to past technological introductions like the internet. However, the potential economic boost from AI could be limited by the ongoing impact of U.S. tariffs introduced by former President Donald Trump, with their full effect expected to be seen in the current and next quarters.

It highlights how creative automation can streamline workflows, optimize visuals, and improve campaign performance through features like AI-powered resizing, image variations, video generation, and title generation. The key takeaway emphasizes the benefits of mixed campaigns (static images and AI-generated video clips) and ethical AI usage with transparent watermarking.

title: Arista Earnings: We Raise Our Forecast After Blowout Quarter
